Reviews.Title: “The true meaning of service”
Reviews.Author: lisamacmarket
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough great things about this hotel. They define service. When my flight was cancelled and I returned to the hotel, the manager immediately took care of me by alerting the front desk staff to show me to a complimentary meeting room that I could use "for as long as I needed." Always warmly greeted when I returned to the hotel. Rooms are spacious and comfortable; amenities of top quality; restaurant and bar offer a great beginning and end to the day. Look no further in Chicago. This is the real deal.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: UDSL05
Reviews.Content: I went to Chicago on Business and met up with some friends while I was there. The hotel is well located for the excellent shopping and dinning Chicago has to offer north of the river. The rooms are clean, comfortable, and modern. The workout facilities were on the top floor with moderate views, but new well maintained equipment. With the exception of check-in, which was a poor experience due to a small cramped lobby, the staff was attentive and detail oriented.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Q
Reviews.Content: We booked on HotWire and got a great rate on St. Patty's Day weekend - last minute. The hotel was above our expectations, everything was great. Check in and front desk service was great, our room was beautiful and we especially loved the fact they turned down our sheets and set the lighting low for us every evening when we came back to our room. We also loved the $10 mine bar credit, the pool and sun deck. Our only "complaints" were that there was no closet in our room, the food was EXPENSIVE, and there was no complimentary breakfast. But that last one is being a bit nit-picky. We LOVED the coffee and tea each morning, delicious fresh local sodas and candies and complimentary wine hour from 5-6. We would stay here again as long as we got some sort of deal on the room - $300/night is a bit too rich for our blood.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff, avoid dining at Sable kitchen...”
Reviews.Author: FLNOLE
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights in late December celebrating my birthday. The location is great, weather was mild and allowed us to walk quite a bit. Our room was very comfortable, had a city view and was generously sized. Housekeeping was great, bath toiletries were higher end and good quality. The room has an iPhone dock which was great to listen to music prior to dinner, etc. I would hands down stay here again when in Chicago. The hotel acknowledged my birthday by sending a bottle of wine and chocolates to our room, this was a very hospitable gesture and another reason why we love Kimpton hotels. We had room service for breakfast one morning and it was very good. We ordered French toast and eggs though so that is pretty hard to mess up... My only suggestion, don't bother with Sable Restaurant. We ate lunch here on our first afternoon and it was so-so. Chicago is a foodie city and this restaurant offered nothing special. Not to mention the decor was stark and tired, think the Delano hotel in 2002. Unoriginal food in an atmosphere better suited for sweltering Miami nights...not Chicago. Had two nice meals at Table fifty-two and Gibson's. Had hoped to score reservations at Alinea but no such luck...book that early!

Reviews.Title: “My New Fav' Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BalhamBlonde
Reviews.Content: The husband's been lucky enough to stay at this hotel a couple of times before (business), he has so enjoyed his trips that as a special treat he took me over for 3 nights (from London, so we are talking big treat here). As it happened this coincided with the St Patricks Day celebrations. I figured I'd better make some restaurant bookings well in advance. I got into contact with Jessica Ebacher one of the hotel's amazing team of concierges. She was extremely helpful and more than happy to get everything organised, very prompt in replying to emails. In the past the lovely Mark Kraemer has helped the husband with his restaurant bookings, and on this occasion Mark re-confirmed the bookings and ensured that we got special tables and exceptional service. Check in (at around 6pm on a Thursday) looked at if it was mobbed - but it wasn't, in fact they have an evening wine sampling and guests were milling around clasping large glasses of vino - which I have to say I gazed at longingly. As we checked in, because we 'just' missed the wine tasting we were presented with two tickets entitling us to claim a complimentary glass of the evening's wine at the Sable bar (more on that in a moment). I'd also signed up as a Kimpton InTouch Member (it's free), this further entitled us to free wifi for the whole of our stay and a one off $10 'raid the mini bar'! We had been upgraded to a corner room 1604 and I was totally blown away by the size of the space...there was a large working desk and chair, a large flatscreen TV, a coffee table with a three seater sofa and easy chair and a gi-normous bed. Plenty of storage space. A couple of wacky dressing gowns and even a yoga mat (with a special TV channel that you could tune into to do various exercises). The bathroom was almost as large as our first flat. A Jacuzzi bath for 2, which after a long day of pounding the streets was fabulous. A walk in shower for 2 plus guests!! All the usual complimentary smellies and a whole host of things in the mini-bar if you had forgotten anything. The hotel is well situated for plenty of really good restaurants including Joes Seafood, just around the corner, and Smith & Wolenski on the river just down the road. In the mornings you can amble downstairs to grab tea or coffee, also available mid-afternoon, thereafter iced water and a selection of sweeties (I noticed some people taking handfuls). The Sable bar was buzzing every night, great atmosphere and the food looked pretty good too. The husband wasn't feeling so well on the Saturday evening so I asked Mark if he could work his magic and ensure that I had a seat at the bar so I could enjoy a drink on my own - sure enough he liaised with the bar manager and they reserved me a spot, much to my great appreciation. All in all this is an absolute gem of a hotel, all the staff are delightful from door men (one of these guys, wears a hat, has the most amazing whistle I think I've ever heard!) to room service. My special thanks however remain for Mark Kraemer, in him this hotel has the greatest gem of all.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: 18hf18
Reviews.Content: I should've known this would be one of those memorable hotel experiences after Michael at the front desk cheerfully arranged for the complicated delivery and storage of a package before our arrival. Or when Mark was happy to arrange for an artistic fruit bowl to be delivered to a friend at the hotel before our arrival. Once we arrived, we were delighted with the friendly welcome, iced water bottles at the door, fresh coffee and gourmet organic teas every morning, wine reception at 5 pm, striking art pieces and furniture throughout the hotel and 17th floor rooftop terrace. Alex was happy to print our boarding passes and arrange for luggage storage, and Blue the doorman put us in a shiny limo to the airport--for the same price of a frumpy taxi. The hotel is in the center of the Miracle Mile and has a luxurious yet playful feel.

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton Palomar - Keeping the Chic in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Meet-the-Furkids
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palomar Chicago for 2 nights on return from a week in Vegas. Wanted to stay somewhere handy for all the attractions the city has to offer and the hotel met that expectation. We took the train from the airport and the hotel is a short walk from the station. Next day we walked a few blocks down and were at the bus stop for the City tour. Check in was a breeze and as Kimpton in touch members, we got free wi-fi and were able to 'raid the minibar'. Rooms are not huge, but enough space to get around. Bathrooms on the small side but very clean & modern. As we were celebrating an anniversary, we were given champagne & strawberries on arriving in the room - nice touch. The corridors of the hotel have some rather quirky artwork. Be warned though as some of them stick out in places and you might just catch your arm on them! The pool area and outside deck are gorgeous. In fact, I think they make the Palomar a real winner as many city boutique hotels don't have pools or outside sun decks. We went for a late night swim and it was fab! The hosted wine reception in the evening is a great place to chill for an hour and chat / relax. Great wine & great pizza! The lobby and lounge area are really nice with a gorgeous fireplace. We ate an evening meal at the restaurant and the quality was very good although this is reflected in the prices. All in all, this was a good stay for our short time in Chicago. Would recommend to others and would happily choose this hotel, and the Kimpton brand in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The best boutique for the miracle mile”
Reviews.Author: canadianwarmth
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for two nights in march. The hotel is clean, friendly and run very professionally. The location is right next to nordstroms and within an easy walk of all the miracle mile shops The doormen were helpful in arranging transport to the museums and the blackhawks game The rooms are bright, quiet and very clean A lot of the guests were there on business or were from europe with lent itself to a very efficient stay which is what we liked. The pre-supper drinks and morning coffee were a treat. The restaurant in the hotel has top rated food (although skip the coffee for breakfast as it free in the lobby) We shall definitely return and highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “A new gem right in the heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: mareku
Reviews.Content: I stayed in kimpton hotels before and the new Palomar hotel did not disappoint me in the level of comfort and service which I am used from Kimpton. The location is awesome - right where the shopping is, close to the millennium park and the lake shore. Lots of great restaurants around - I did not had dinner at the restaurant of the Kimpton itself. Breakfast was good quality, but at a price - even when we had "free breakfast" included in our package, it still was a hefty $60 for a normal breakfast. (The free breakfast being some tea, juice and fruit only). We had breakfast at the close by Omni hotel - where they have a huge excellent breakfast buffet for only $16... Blazingly fast wireless internet for free (when you are a Kimpton memeber - which is free as well) The large rooms are very nice designed, with comfy beds, nice view and a modern bath room. As usual lots of dogs around - because this is a pet friendly hotel - which I very much like. Also the afternoon winetasting is a nice touch, where you actually meet new people from all around and get some new tips. The pool has a terras and is (as is the gym) on the 17th floor and has a awesome view of Chicago. Staff is super duper nice and very helpful and friendly. The doors to the street are a little bit weird, they are heavy to open (two of them) which is not very handy when you come "home" after a day of shopping with zillions of shopping bags. Luckily most of the time the porter will open them though... After 3 night of sweet dreams it was time to go back home - till next time!

Reviews.Title: “A thoroughly enjoyable stay where they aim to please”
Reviews.Author: JennyGB
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights here in mid-March, 2012. Loved it. Helpful staff, comfortable rooms, fantastic location. Cool bar/restaurant on first floor. Nice amenities. I recommend that you avoid staying on the 17th floor, as fumes from the swimming pool pervade that floor and I found it slightly unpleasant. But with one complaint, I was quickly moved to a different floor and all was well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very clean, good front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: jcrdaycare
Reviews.Content: First trip to Chicago for a wedding. Nice location. Great night sleep last night. Called front desk in the morning to notify them of our late arrival and the man who spoke with me in the morning was there to check us in and remembered my name. Impressive. Nice that they offer free coffee every morning- it was very popular. Missed the wine from 5-6pm, but again its a nice addition. Recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay at Palomar”
Reviews.Author: Nita1011
Reviews.Content: If you are travelling with children, this review should help you decide where to stay. We have spent 2 wonderful nights at the Palomar visiting with our 7 and 13 year old children. If you like your kids to be near but not in the bed next to you do splurge a bit and stay in the luxury one bedroom suite. I have booked the suite and found a cheaper price on expedia a week later. No problem, the Palomar was willing to match the price. The location of the hotel is amazing, the staff is one of the friendliest I have ever encountered, and the wine reception is so relaxing. The suite spoke for itself. The room was huge. Two double doors separating the kids from our bedroom. The beautifully appointed bathroom was located between the two rooms and a wonderful sitting area by the window that the kids loved. It was nice to return from visiting all the museums and have the kids relax in their own room, with TV a pull-out queen size sofa bed, and wireless internet. BTW the wireless internet is free if you join Kimpton hotels online, which is also free. The service was promt and they really listened to you if you needed something, and was delivered to your room asap. The staff actually remembered what we had told them in the morning, and asked about our excursions upon our return. The kids also received a welcome package which made them feel special. I highly recommend this place to anyone seeking quality accommodations for their money, not some loud, crowded, outdated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique with Fabulous Service and all of the Amenities you could want”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveler1020
Reviews.Content: I am a Kimpton Inner Circle Member (highest rewards status) and was very happy with my visit to The Palomar. I have stayed here a number of times and they somehow seem to out do themselves every time! The restaurant is tasty and trendy with a bar the boasts one of the most lengthy drink lists I have seen. The hotel is new and immaculate with large rooms and big windows. The gym is fabulous and the staff (everyone from the bell men to the front desk to the cleaning service) is very friendly and helpful. Free wi-fi and a $10 mini-bar credit if you sign up with the free rewards program. I definitely recommend this hotel. Thank you for the amazing room upgrade and Inner Circle gift!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location & great staff!”
Reviews.Author: LondonDanMark
Reviews.Content: Can't fault this hotel in anyway, as soon as we arrived the staff were great. We checked-in just after 5 just in time for happy hour where you're given free wine until 6. Were advised wifi is around $10 per day however if you join their loyalty program it's free of charge. Also if you join you'll get $10 free to spend in the mini bar. Booked a twin room which was a great size with 2 queen sized beds. The hotel is only a couple of years old so quite modern with a large plasma TV and an Iphone/ipod docking station. Bathroom had a shower and a bath, good size and clean. Hotel is very close to lots of shops, restaurants and bars. Michigan Ave just a couple of blocks away. Staff were very helpful and have lots of recommendations for places to eat, shop etc...... Continental breakfast included as well! Would like to give a special mention to Gad on reception and Jon Luke on the door who are a great assest to the hotel and couldn't be more helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Palomar...so close to perfection”
Reviews.Author: 594traveler
Reviews.Content: Palomar's location on State Street near Illinois is central to all of Chicago's best. Staff here treats you royally from check-in to check-out. Our room wasspotless and oversized and the hotel has a rooftop lap pool and state of the art fitness center. An evening social of wine along with delicious flatbreads is served from 5 to 6 in a beautiful street level room with horizontal fireplace and cozy chairs and decorative allure. Morning coffee and tea is available early each day. One thing I might suggest is a complimentary breakfast along with the coffee since this area is a gathering place and a light bite along with morning coffee would be most appreciated. On anothewr note, Palomar's restaurant Sable has a fine dining reputation whcih we will be sure to check out at our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I was expecting...”
Reviews.Author: Keith C
Reviews.Content: I booked a King Spa Premier Suite two months in advance for mine and my wife's anniversary. When we got to the room, I noticed that the bathroom did not match the pictures I had seen nor the descriptions from the website. My wife called the front desk to make sure we got the right room and was promptly assured we were. After looking at their website once again, I knew it was not the right room so I decided to call guest services and explain why. I read the exact description from their website and was told that ours was different because it was handicap accessible. I told them that the floors were not Italian Marble and no stand up separate shower. Also, I had requested a higher floor way in advance and was put on the very bottom floor with terrible views. I am a Kimpton InTouch member and was not expecting this type of service from a hotel rate so highly. Word of advice to all who plan to stay here....make sure you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “I have stayed here 10 nights and keep coming back.”
Reviews.Author: Brian K
Reviews.Content: Great location and everything is well kept and nice touches throughout. Just a nice vibe throughout.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: falcon_scranton
Reviews.Content: Best hotel ever,clean,great location,and just a dream home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Kimpton hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: mikelovesutah
Reviews.Content: My one night stay at the Palomar was great in every respect. The room was spacious, clean, comfortable, and well decorated. The service was friendly and helpful. The location was convenient walking distance to all the sights and landmarks downtown. The price relative to comparable nearby hotels was excellent (and as usual, by being a member of the Kimpton loyalty program, I also got a nice little minibar credit). I really can't complain or criticize anything about my stay, which says a lot because I can be quite critical. Nice job on this hotel, Kimpton!

Reviews.Title: “Nice new hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: uww326
Reviews.Content: I'm picky with hotels and the Palomar is very very good. Pro's: Service as good as any hotel I've stayed at in a longtime. New clean rooms with modern amenities. Stylish decor. Location in the heart of the city. Room service is quick. Cons: poorly designed first floor that creates logjams of people at the main doors, front desk, and elevators. Don't bring a car unless you want to pay a lot to park, but that describes all hotels in the area. It would be nice if the room service had better appetizer options. Would return. We stayed for two nights at 144/night.

Reviews.Title: “Great gem of a hotel in the heart of a great city!”
Reviews.Author: holidaygoogler
Reviews.Content: Hotel Palomar Chicago brings you excellent service, a warm smile, from all the staff that we encountered during our stay! The street noise was the same as any big city , emergency vehicles etc, but not load enough to disturb you. the room was well porpotioned and very clean overlooking the river..awesome. therer are over 100 galleries at your feet, along with boutiques, great dining, lively nightlife and outdoor activities on the Chicago River. Just steps away from world renowned shopping on Michigan Avenue. It is perfectly postioned for everything, a really convienient for museums also. And in a city known for great cooking, Sable Kitchen & Bar stands out. A bit pricey though, but breakfast was very good! Sunday brunch was excellent , the restaurant very busy at weekends so you would need to book a table. The hotel does really give you exceptional Services and Conveniences The evening wine hour in the lobby living room is great way to to meet up with other people if you are on you own, they are not stingy with the wine either! If I had one complaint and it is minor, the pillows are way tooo soft!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for its location, service, and rooms”
Reviews.Author: alostyankee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with our 2 sons. We had a one bedroom suite and it was perfect! Very clean and roomy and also quiet! Service was impeccable. Our bathroom door handle broke and it was immediately fixed (and we were given some extra chocolates!). On a rainy day we called the front desk to ask if we could borrow umbrellas and they were waiting for us when we got there. When I was looking at all the hotels in the area The Palomar seemed the best value in terms of quality and footage of rooms with price. We were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Solo Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: MsTravelHag
Reviews.Content: Fabulous Kimpton property in a great location (Red Line across the street Grand/State)! From the welcome email that I received 2 days prior to my visit from Ms. Benes (thanks Ashlee for remembering all my room requests!) , to all the smiles and service I encountered during my two night stay from every single employee! Loved the ETRO amenities, the Chicken and Waffles at Sable, the comfy bed and all the other perks when you become a Kimpton Loyalty member at no cost! This is not the biggest and grandest hotel in Chicago, but definitely a gem of a property and my place of choice when I return to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Wow.”
Reviews.Author: DogButt
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome. Valet was quick, what a beautiful hotel. Check in and check out were so quick. Elevators were fast. There was virtually no noise by people walking by in the hall way, and outside the room was what you'd expect, emergency vehicles going by and waking you up. Not a big deal, because the best part of the hotel were the beds. They happen to be the most comfortable thing I've ever slept on.

Reviews.Title: “What more can be said”
Reviews.Author: Gitane48
Reviews.Content: Of the 500 plus "Excellent" rated reviews, I'm at a loss to add any other observations or accolades, other than to convey my gratitude to Mark and Bobby for making our stay special.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: rarhode
Reviews.Content: Room was perfect, rate was very reasonable, great location, staff was so friendly. Fridge was not chilling so maintenance not only replaced it w/in 5 minutes, they gave us free drinks w/o requests. This hotel is about friendly customer service!!

Reviews.Title: “this IS value.”
Reviews.Author: dmross
Reviews.Content: I went on a nice little pre-Christmas trip to explore Chicago. This was a little Christmas gift to myself... a well deserved break in the windy city. I LOVE KIMPTON hotels. You can stay here in the low $100's some nights, with so much value: -Salt water pool -Complimentary evening wine hour (beer too) -Good location - a short 5 minute walk to either "mag mile" and theatre district -Big windows -Fresh decor -Friendly staff -Kimpton intouch (loyalty points) I believe the second OR third room category up from standard gives you this DEEP soaking tubs. LOVE THEM.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Wedding Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Rory0110
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I are getting married in Chicago in September, and stayed at the Palomar over President's Day weekend while we took care of wedding business. I can not say enough great things about this property (but I'll try to limit my review to the highlights): 1. The staff - I emailed the management a few weeks before our stay to request a room on a high floor. Not only did they accomodate us, but they also upgraded our room to a FANTASTIC suite and had the room ready for my 10am arrival. They also sent my fiance and I a bottle of sparkling wine on the evening of our anniversary. 2. The room - Out of control awesome...floor to ceiling windows, seperate sitting area with a couch and comfy chair, great bed, huge closets, and the best tub I've ever seen (seriously...it fit two comfortably and could probably have fit five somewhat awkwardly). I would also recommend becoming a Kimpton In-Touch member - the service is free and it provides you with ammenities like a newspaper in the morning, pillow menu, free Wi-Fi, and a $10 raid the mini bar credit. 3. The restaurant - Excellent food and a drink menu that could astound even the most seasoned drinker (which I am certainly not). I loved the half portion option. My fiance and I wanted to try a few things, so ordered five small plates which will all great. I highly recommend the Short Rib Sliders! 4. Location - 15 minute walk to Hancock Tower, 15 minute walk to Millenium Park, and an inexpensive cab ride to pretty much anywhere. Perfect. ...so in case you're still unsure about staying here...BOOK IT NOW, thank me later. We'll be reserving a block of rooms for our wedding weekend, and know that our guests will be very well taken care of!

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice”
Reviews.Author: Evanston_Jeff
Reviews.Content: I was perfectly pleased with my stay at the Palomar Chicago. The hotel is stylish without being too modern. The rooms were nicely appointed, although the beds were just a bit soft (but I like a firm mattress so this would not be a big issue for most people). The bar in the hotel is very hip and crowded on the weekends, and the gym is actually reasonably well-equipped, but there are only 6-8 cardio machines, so they get filled quickly. The pool is rather small, and more of a dipping pool than a swimming pool. The concierge was pretty good, but they were not super helpful A few quibbles....it took a while for the water in the shower to get hot in the mornings, and the bathrooms are a bit smallish. Also, there are only 2 elevators for the hotel floors, which can make for a slow wait at peak times. Overall...this was a very solid choice, and I would not mind going back again, however I think that the 5-star ratings that many people have been giving the property may be somewhat inflated.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Southernredhead
Reviews.Content: We chose the Palomar based on the Trip Advisor review and the location in downtown Chicago. We are totally sold on the Palomar and Kimpton Hotels! The front desk personnel were professional, friendly and helpful. The interior of the hotel has an art deco feel and the room was very nicely appointed. Our room was a nice size and very comfortable. We upgraded to a city view and were lucky to have been given a corner room. We had breakfast at Sable, which was very good, but a bit pricey. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Can't recommend this hotel for several reasons”
Reviews.Author: Travels_Mucho
Reviews.Content: We wanted to like this place because we visit Chicago from the suburbs as a family frequently. Unfortunately, we cannot recommend the Palomar Chicago. We wanted a one-bedroom suite with another room with two beds. Before reserving, I called and was told they don't have these room types that connect, but that the rooms would be within a few doors of each other. We also wanted to make sure the rooms were quiet, away from the elevators, service doors, etc., especially since the kids like to sleep in. We arrived a little early and were given the suite. When we came back later to check into the other room, the room number was quite a bit different from the suite. I asked to see the diagram for the floor, and after several minutes of fumbling around, they produced one that showed that not only was the other room not close to the suite, it was around the corner from the elevators, near the closet with the ice machine, and right next to the housekeeping service room. When I recounted what I was told by reservations, they indicated that was not the case and said they have heard of others being misled the same way we were. The only other choices were a room across the hall from this one or one in a quieter location but literally as far as you could get from the suite. They offered to give us rooms which were closer, but someone would end up on a rollaway or sofabed, do we took the quietest room a long walk from the other. Very disappointing. We also brought our dog. We completed all the paperwork, and it still took three calls and a visit to the front desk just to get a (temporary) bowl so he could have water. Finally, they delivered the bed and bowls while we were out. The bed was laughably small, not even close to being adequate even though we had told them his size (and they could see him) when we checked in. We didn't bother trying to get another. We brought swimming suits with the intention of using the pool. We ended up not doing so because the water was very cloudy and not warm. The pool is also quite small and very shallow (less than four feet). The price for rooms at the Palomar is good, but we just can't get past being misled combined with the poor service we received. The decor of the rooms is pretty garish, but we knew that before we reserved from pictures on this site.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to relax”
Reviews.Author: irishiiis
Reviews.Content: We spent a Friday night at the Palomar and had a wonderful time. The rooms are spacious, trendy, and designed to provide every comfort. The work-out room has a variety of equipment, all of which operate properly, and an indoor pool with a nifty rooftop terrace outside it which is definitely more welcoming in the summer. The Sable Restaurant is headed by the creative chef, Heather Terhune, whose work will make you happy you decided to try the hotel's restaurant, and the attached bar wins awards. Did I mention there is a wine reception from 5 to 6? Give it a try if you need a weekend getaway, even in your own backyard.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing weekend”
Reviews.Author: Tamhicks10
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 619 this past weekend from Friday to Sunday. The room had a figi soaking tub that was plenty big enough for two. The bed was probably the most comfortable bed that I had ever slept in. So much so that I checked out the label on the mattress, it was a selle Postropedic. We had bath robes and plenty of towels. The mini bar had a great selection and even the shampoo/conditioner was great. We had planned to stay at this hotel because we wanted a relaxing weekend away. I met my bf there who is currently working in Dallas and we rarely see each other. We splurged on the fancy room only to find out that there was a wedding reception directly below us Saturday night. It was so loud the room, bed, lights, we shaking. We could hear what people were saying and Shazam the songs from our room. It was not relaxing one bit and a total bummer. Had we had known prior that this would be the case, we would have stayed elsewhere or requested the best room they had up farther from the event. But we really wanted that bathtub. So we called down to the front desk not so much to complain but to see when the reception would be over. It still had another 2 hours left and I was not relaxing at all. We didn't want to ruin anyone's time or be "those people". They did offer to move us up to the 8th floor but that would have been a standard room with a double bed and moving at 10pm did not sound appealing. The manager Gad called us back and was truly apologetic. He wanted to make things right and ended up comping our second night. He also gave us great restaurant recommendations and we ended up leaving for a few hours just to get some quiet. Gad also let us have extended check out until 4 pm the next day at no charge. This was perfect since my bf flew out at 9pm. The moral of this lengthy story is that although we were really bummed about the dance party in our room, the manager went out of his way to make it right. I was SO BUMMED when it came time to leave and I have already begun looking for future dates to stay there. The pool was beautiful and the room service food (from Sable) was wonderful as well. All in all, a wonderful experience at the Palomar. After walking the magnif. mile, it was fantastic to bring a glass of wine down to the "living room" to warm up by the fire. Truly a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Quick Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan757
Reviews.Content: I stay here often - great location but a fantastic staff. The room is always clean, everything works, and they usually manage to surprise you with something nice. Smiles from the doorman to the front desk . . . An excellent value and an excellent business hotel in Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Palomar chicago”
Reviews.Author: senecaii
Reviews.Content: Amazing stay! Loved all of it, the Hotel, bar, staff...

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Experience, Palomar stands apart”
Reviews.Author: kariejeanne
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled with this hotel. Staff were gracious and fun, not stuffy. The overall feeling we got from the hotel was welcome and relaxed, not snooty at all. Upon check in, the kids were given goody bags with toys and blow up beach balls to play with in the pool. They were out of goldfish to borrow but oh well. The rooms were fantastic, clean and upscale. We had a corner double queen unit and windows overlooked the city. The location was great. Rush street and michigan ave were both in easy walking distance and options for eating abound. The pool was nice, clean and open, lots of fluffy white towels available. We went to the wine reception in the evening, which was lovely. Great chatting with other guests and relaxing before going out into the city for dinner (reminded me of a bed and breakfast type thing). I would definitely recommend signing up for Kimpton rewards prior to your stay, even if you hotwired or pricelined the room. With membership you get a $10 coupon for mini bar, free wifi and free newspaper in the morning. I would say that this hotel is the nicest we have ever stayed at in chicago, and we had a regular room. That's saying alot. It was also the most enjoyable atmosphere. I hate snooty and I really felt at home here, relaxed and able to be ourselves (kids and all!). There's a good reason this hotel rated top 25 on trip advisor for 2011!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: roxychicago
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “4 Days in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: TKlash
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location, within walking distance of the theater district, many restaurants, and great Chicago sites. The management is exceptional. The room was very, very clean and quiet. I recommend this hotel to business persons traveling to Chicago and to couples.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Zo O
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I decided to have a two day get away to Chicago, decided to stay at the Palomar, and we are happy we did. The staff was always on point, very courteous and professional. The concierge â€œBobbyâ€� was able to help us plan out our weekend, with no regrets! We arrived Friday afternoon, and joined the free wine reception near the lobby from 5-7pm (it was very classy and gave us a chance to socialize with other people from all across the nation.) The following morning we had breakfast at the hotelâ€™s restaurant â€œSable Kitchen & Barâ€� where the staff and the meals really impressed us. The rooms were unique and comfortable. On Sundays check-out again the staff was helpful and had us leaving satisfied with our stay. Overall the Palomar was a great experience at an affordable price and can easily pass for a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Palomar gets better and better”
Reviews.Author: Travel M
Reviews.Content: I started staying at Kimpton properties 4 years ago. I've stayed at Kimptons in Denver, Arlington, and Miami. They all impress. Palomar Chicago was no exception. The guys in the front are super friendly and greeted me as I entered. Jessica at the front desk checked me in, she was very friendly and helped any way she could. The rooms and bathrooms are very comfortable and stylish. Great decor in the hotel. I cant say enough about the staff here. I didnt get names, but the big African-American guy at the front door was funny and friendly. I also bumped into one of the bellman in the elevator, he was an Asian-American, we chatted about California a bit, he asked if I was checking bags in or anything, very friendly. Whenever I stay at a Kimpton property, I feel like I'm at home. The staff makes the stay that much better. The property is also very exquisite and close to a lot of restaurants. The Red line is across the street. Excellent location. This is the hotel of choice when I'm in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “great chicago boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: lisamahnkenelson
Reviews.Content: great location - walk to miracle mile. nice wine reception in evening. great rooms, very modern. door to bathroom was odd (sliding) so not as much privacy as you'd like. would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Chksrgn
Reviews.Content: This was a fabulous, relatively cheap (for Chicago), hotel! Perfect location-the redline is just a stone throw away, and walking distance to Michigan Ave and the theater district. We stayed here on the coldest weekend of the year for the auto show, and the staff was always pleasant, even the poor valet and doorman outside in the bitter cold! The wine reception (a Kimpton standard, I think, because they had it at the San Francisco Kimpton I previously stayed) is a nice touch- the cocktail area with fireplace was packed. At check-in, we also got a "Raid the Minibar" voucher which was fun for drinks while getting dressed for the evening. As for the room, it was funky and unexpected, in a very good way. One of the nicest touches was the Etro bath products- though it is quite unfortunate because I can't seem to find them online to buy them now that I'm addicted to the musk scent! Overall, a great hotel. I'd suggest parking your car (and yes, the $50/night is standard in Chicago), and explore!

Reviews.Title: “A New Standard of Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Yobs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I take weekend getaways to Chicago almost once of month. Last time, we stayed at Hotel Monaco, but this time I wanted to try Hotel Palomar (both are Kimpton Hotels) as it was recently named one of the top 25 hotels in the country. Our perfect weekend was engineered by concierge Bobby Gonzalez. Due to lack of a response while setting up in-room spa services, I had sent an email to the hotel expressing my disappointment. Bobby did everything from getting us a room upgrade to setting up a private table at La Scarola to make up for my inconvenience. It was a pleasure to see that customer service is not a foreign concept to Mr Gonzalez. Hotel Palomar is a gorgeous hotel with all the amenities one would expect from a property of this level. I will not stay anywhere in Chicago other than Hotel Palomar.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, hip, hooray...”
Reviews.Author: znetbabe
Reviews.Content: We got this great deal via hotwire, so glad we did! Very hip vibe hotel,spacious size room, great breakfast in downstairs restaurant, and best of all they gave toys bag to our little one which she loved. The indoor swimming pool was very nice, even cold weather outside, still able to use it. Great location, close to a small supermarket, restaurants- surrounded with many and I mean "many" great chop/steak houses, shopping, easy walk to everywhere & felt safe too. Absolutely will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYerUWS
Reviews.Content: Liked the hotel despite very noisy wedding party next door - they partied mostly in the hall and the doors are NOT soundproof. Beautiful pool and wonderful breakfast room service. best blueberry preserves ever. Was not crazy about dinner at hotel restaurant - too many flavors mangled together - a sort of amateur approach to cuisine. Martini served in a cordial glass - why? Ruined the martini for me. Good location. Internet free but cords and plugs too short, and impossible to adjust without moving major pieces of furniture so couldn't use my laptop easily. Had a surge protector which also had a short cord so I spent most of my time picking it up from the floor and trying to keep my devices plugged in. These kind of details should have been trouble shot long ago. Probably would stay again, but I would not eat in the restaurant again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: AMGAWRIT
Reviews.Content: Although we live in Chicago we stayed here recently to attend our Company party and give our children a night of "luxury". It was the night of the "surprise" snow storm and after 2 hours getting to the hotel from the near north side we were all more than ready for a relaxing evening. Being centrally located we could walk everywhere we needed and return to an amazing suite, and I mean amazing. Contemporary styled, comfortable, clean, and extremely spacious. The service was amazing, the staff were very friendly and accomodating. It all just had a great feel about it. We had room service which was fantastic and we also ate at Sable for brunch and the food there was outstanding. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. I love Kimpton....and if there is one in the city we're travelling to, we search it out. I hope they go international...they would be so popular!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: RegionGolfer
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay here on Sat., Feb.4. Rooms are very nice and modern, bed was great. Love the wine reception from 5:00 to 6;00. Had a great breakfast in their restaraunt Sable on Sun. morning. Our 3rd time staying here, and we will certainly be back. Staff could not be more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Palomar Service Exceeded Expectations !”
Reviews.Author: cssccssc
Reviews.Content: When visiting Chicago we usually stay at the Hotel Monaco but on our last visit we decided to inquire about the Palomar. Upon visiting the lobby the front desk personnel offered their assistance. After telling them we were just checking the place out for a possible upcoming visit and telling them we usually stay at the Monaco the lady offered to let us view a room. We were allowed to view a corner spa room. It was excellent. Our next trip is scheduled for Feb 17th with a reservation at the Palomar. My only critique is the reservation process. I wish there was the ability to reserve a corner room or specify upper floor. Both of which are desired for the upcoming visit but we will just have to take our luck on what we get. I look forward to writing a great review after our upcoming visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Girsl Get away Birthday Weeked”
Reviews.Author: singermom4
Reviews.Content: Although I have lived in Chicago for years and occasionally spend a weekend downtown, I was unaware of this little gem. The hotel is well-located to attractions, shopping, and restaurants. The decor is elegant and modern. The lounge area with the compimentary wine hour in the evenings and the coffe/tea service in the mornings is a nice touch. We had booked a one-bedroom luxury suite and a double queen room for six women celebration a special birthday. One woman in our group is a frequent guest at this hotel so she was able to procure a very good rate. She also asked that special note be made of the birthday celebration and asked for wine and a small cake to be delivered to the room - not necessarily complimentary but to have these items available. By the day of check-in she had not heard back from the concierge and expressed her disappointment at the front desk. They quickly made amends by first, delivering wine, nuts, fruit, and chocolate-covered espresso beans. Then at 5, two excellent cheese plates were delivered. When we returned to the room after dinner, a small strawberry shortcake cake was waiting for us. We we also given an extra cot at no extra charge for the suite. The service, decor, and charm of this hotel will have me back for a repeat visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly Y
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palomar in January and thought it was a very clean, modern, and conveniently located hotel. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The best part of my stay was stopping in the bar that's attached, Sable, and trying their drinks. Best cocktails ever! The only con to this hotel is their room service. I ordered from them twice, and both times I was very disappointed. I ordered fish tacos and it was like they chopped up some dried up fish sticks and put them in a tortilla. The tomato soup was way too salty and I thought I was going to have a sodium overdose. So in summary, I would definitely recommend Hotel Palomar but just make the effort to go out and eat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: OHProf
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hotel Palomar in Chicago on four separate occasions. The hotel is our favorite in Chicago, due to the great service, great location, and hip-but-not-pretentious vibe. One visit was a disappointment, but they staff more than made up for it on our next visit. Be sure to tell them when making the reservation if you are celebrating a special occasion (anniversary, birthday, etc.) because they add in nice little touches to make you welcome.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet retreat in a central part of downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: tycl516
Reviews.Content: Booked this place through SniqueAway, and got a corner city view king room on the 16th floor (room 1623 to be exact) for an awesome deal at $114 for one night after taxes and fees. We had never stayed at any Kimpton hotel, so we didn't know how things would be. Being avid travelers, we've stayed at the typical chains (Hilton, Marriott, Starwood) and boutique hotels worldwide. I would have to say that Hotel Palomar delivered on all fronts with what they advertise on their website and with the positive reviews from fellow TripAdvisor members and the recent award for Best of 2012. Location: State and Grand. Very central to all the major sites like Magnificent Mile for shopping and dining, The Shops at North Bridge, Macy's, Navy Pier, clubs and bars on Hubbard St., and a lot of great eats within several blocks. Ambience: Has a slight mid-century modern and artistic flair. The hallways are lined with abstract/fine art sculptures and paintings from local designers. The walls are a dark cherry wood color with colorful art pieces. Nice touch. Upon entrance, a waiting/socializing area that has complimentary wine hour in the late afternoon (i think it's 5-7pm), and complimentary tea and coffee in the mornings. We didn't personally partake, but liked the concept. The space itself was lovely with burgundy chairs accented with gold ottomans. Room: Loved the room. It was a pretty big room with a large entrance that lead into the bed. The sliding door that had a mirror built in was a clever design feature that also functioned as the bathroom door. For such a large entrance, the bathroom was a little on the small side. However, the furnishings were of high quality and a nice rich color. We weren't huge fans of the wood grain marks that were on the vanity, but that is minor. Door was heavy and made of good quality materials and the walls were decently insulated. We couldn't hear much of any outside noise, save for a little bit from our neighbor. Bed was really comfortable, though the comforter could have been a little heavier. That is personal preference. Fluffy pillows that weren't too soft, so we were able to sleep like babies! The view was awesome with floor to ceiling windows, but be careful, it's pretty close to other hotels, so people can see in! Overall, we had a wonderful time here. We would have liked to stay an extra night and tried Sable, but this place really delivers on its promise as a Kimpton Hotel brand. Service was awesome, with staff looking happy and staying professional and greeting each guest as you entered through the lobby. Valet was prompt, though be forewarned, it's $48 per night with in and out privileges. However, given its close proximity to everything, we were able to walk everywhere - that is convenience! :) I would definitely recommend this place, as the location and value are great. Keep your eyes peeled out for a SniqueAway deal. It's definitely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent downtown location”
Reviews.Author: mjb358
Reviews.Content: A superb downtown location, with exceptional convenience if your destination is the theater district. The neighborhood is loaded with dining choices if you decide to go out. The staff is very friendly. There is intense competition in Chicago in this price range, and it shows in the quality of the stay. Our city-view room was worth it, although I didn't see rooms without the city-view premium. In any case, the floor-to-ceiling window was wonderful. The bed comfort was great; better than average. And the bathroom had a very good quality soaking tub, which is a big deal for my wife. The in-house lounge and restaurant, Sable, is very good. The drinks menu is varied, and of high quality. The food is perfect for sharing. Highly recommended, both for lodging and meals.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels!”
Reviews.Author: Ruben-Anthony
Reviews.Content: This hotel ended up being a great surprise. This was the second leg on our trip and we had just stayed in New York at a disappointing and more expensive hotel. Right off the bat this hotel was better. The staff was very personable, the room was large, clean and stylish. The location was great. It was within walking distance of Lou Malnatis, Gino's East and my favorite XOXO. The subway is about a block away. The magnificent mile is only 15 minutes away walking. The attached restaurant was also very helpful. I wanted to sit in the hotel sitting room and have a drink and they accommodate me by sending a pleasant waitres over. FYI they have an extensive selection of scotch at very fair prices. Lastly I want to mention Tony, the doorman. He was a wealth of knowledge and made our trip so much better. A real feather in the Palomar's cap. So much so, that I now look for Kimpton hotels first when I travel. Oh I know I probably won't find another Tony, but one can always hope.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jsEyes
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my adult daughter over the weekend. We had driven separately from different cities. I arrived first and told the parking attendant that my daughter would be coming and I would spring for her parking. When she arrived he he called her by name--she was surprised and impressed! Staff was so friendly and helpful. I arrived before check-in but was given a better room that was ready right away. Loved the decor altho the elevator floor is weird--optical illusion. The location is great. We had to go to the Merchandise Mart for a show and it was easy;also the train is across the street. Nordstrom is a block away.We did not eat at the restaurant so I can't comment on that. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Saved some bucks and loved this place...”
Reviews.Author: FastGirl39
Reviews.Content: We decided to take kids to Sheed Aquarium and wanted a hotel close by. We were pleasantly surprised by Hotel Palomar. Check in efficient and kids were given goody bags on arrival. Valet parking was quick. We asked concierge about Sheed tickets and could buy them at hotel and skip the mile long line at the door, so great on a cold January day. Our room was two queen beds on the 8th floor, did not hear any road noise, none. Very quiet. Beds so comfortable, sheets very soft and pillows very nice. I loved that we could crank the heat down in the room. Shower/tub combo one sink. Called for extra towels and they were there in 5 min. (When does that happen?) Took kids up to pool while hubby went to lounge to get us a beverage, perfect after a long drive. Kids had pool to themselves and loved the blue lights and view from the 17th floor. Front desk called Rainforest Cafe and booked us a dinner table (short walk). Food there was pretty bad but kids loved going there. Our room was booked online and included breakfast ($50.00 credit). We ate at Sable the restaurant on site. Food was great and service spot on. We ordered chicken/waffles, veggie egg white scramble, pigs in blanket, choc chip pancakes, fresh berries. All served hot and delish. Hotel very clean every single staff person we encountered was friendly. I guess I saved $500.00 or so choosing this hotel over one on Mag Mile and could not tell one single bit of difference. We will be back for sure! Great job Hotel Palomar.

Reviews.Title: “Homely and inviting”
Reviews.Author: Petesyd2204
Reviews.Content: We had been staying at another hotel in Chicago and had no choice but to go looking for another hotel. Our travel agent had booked us into another Palomar in Washington DC so we thought we would check out the Palomar Chicago...and we weren't disappointed. We checked into the hotel on the 24th December. The hotel definitely made you feel very welcomed from the helpful doorman to the front desk staff. When checking we were advised that the hotel's restaurant was going to be closed on Christmas day. To minimise the inconvenience they provided a complimentary breakfast in the lounge room. From the moment we checked in, we were made to feel like a valued guest. Having travelled from Australia for a white Christmas, the hotel got you into the Christmas spirit with all the Christmas decorations. We had a nice glass of wine on the first night, which was a great touch. On Christmas day, we were pleasantly surprised with the complimentary breakfast...pastries, bagels, toast, fruit, tea, coffee, juice and hot chocolate. Along with fruit etc. The room was excellent, a great size. The funky bathroom robes are a nice touch. After our less than pleasant stay at another hotel in Chicago, we ended up having a great stay, thanks to the excellent staff and beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelGuy12
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I wanted a hotel to kick back and relax. Well we were glad we picked this one based on the rating on trip advisor. The staff was really nice and made us feel welcomed. The happy wine hour was great. We did that before we went to Paris club for dinner which the front staff called and made the reservation for us. We had the one bedroom suite and it was clean and comfortable. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic birthday stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah L
Reviews.Content: I was planning my boyfriend's birthday weekend and looked up a lot of hotels. When I came across the Palomar hotel in chicago and read all the reviews and looked at all the info I could about this hotel it just seemed to fit!!! I joined the Kimpton inTouch and got a email asking if I wanted to upgrade for $25 more, sure why not! When I checked us in the lobby smelled fantastic and the decor was very beautiful, and that was just the lobby!! The sweet young girl who checked me in, informed me that they upgraded us again to even bigger room! She explained where everything was and gave us directions to our resturant for dinner. Right away I felt welcomed! When we got out of the elavator even the halls were amazing! We found our room and when we opened the door we were blown away!!! This was by far the most beautiful room I have ever stayed!! They even had a bottle of wine with a note that said "For the Birthday Boy"! That made him and I feel extra special, like the hotel cared that it was his birthday. Beds were very comfortable and our stay was worth every penny!! We are still talking about the hotel a week later and already have planned on staying for our Anniversary!! Oh and the breakfast, YUM!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Palomar”
Reviews.Author: BabylonSister
Reviews.Content: This is the first time my husband and I stayed at Palomar and it won't be the last! I surprised my husband with a night in Chicago at the Palomar for his birthday and when we arrived in the room, a birthday card and bottle of wine greeted my husband. The room was modern, tasteful and very clean. Bed was very comfy. Loved the wine reception, a welcome treat after battling a snowstorm at rush hour to get to the hotel. I did sign up for the Kimpton in-Touch program online and enjoyed a nice $10 minibar credit and morning newspaper. We loved watching it snow and sipping the complimentary coffee and reading the paper in the morning. And the location is great...within walkling distance to many restaurants and bars. Can't wait to come back this summer!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for shopping and restaurants”
Reviews.Author: rymcgovern
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. Beautiful room and comfortable beds which is of utmost importance. The restaurant on the first floor is exceptional

Reviews.Title: “In-Room Massage at the Palomar!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingBeautifully
Reviews.Content: I had been wanting to stay at the Palomar in Chicago for about a year due to the outstanding reviews and the #2 ranking on TripAdvisor. Because I have had a previous outstanding Kimpton experience at the Palomar Philadelphia, I figured the experience at the Chicago Palomar would be just as great. It was! This hotel is in a good location, but not necessarily in the middle of everything. The staff is smart, efficient, and gets it right. I was promptly given my hotel key and got to my amazing hotel room. The outside of the room is beautiful as well as the interior. The outside of the rooms are designed to look like your own private hotel suite. The beds are quite large and comfortable, which was probably the best part of the entire room. The bathroom is very nice and elegant; you get the feel that you are in a high-brow hotel. I was immediately in love with the bedding, as it was ultra-comfortable, and luxurious. They have the kind of beds here that you just want to lay in for days and never move. The dÃ©cor of the room is very nice and pleasant. I enjoyed the $10 in free mini bar that I usually do at all Kimpton properties, plus their amazing animal bathrobes (so cute!) One thing I like about the Kimpton properties is that they have a low fat section on their menus for those that are health conscious and I have always found a good value for my money with their room service. (This is pretty hard to find!) Most hotels will leave you feeling utterly ripped off with your room service bill, but here, I find that it isnâ€™t so bad. I ordered a burger and I could tell the woman didnâ€™t understand me on the phone. Her English wasnâ€™t great and I repeated the order to her again and again. Up came a garden burger to my room, when I ordered a real burger. I contemplated sending it back, but the thing was so deliciously made and presented with goat cheese and fixings, I just ate it! Everything there was so good. We tried to head down to the main restaurant of the Palomar, but unfortunately, it was a Saturday night and we didnâ€™t have a reservation. Because it was merely a hotel restaurant, I didnâ€™t think it was going to be slammed packed and hoppin, but apparently, it was the place to be on a Saturday night in Chicago. Because of the wait and the crowds, we left, but I would recommend if you want to eat here to book yourself a reservation. Personally, I think one of nicest perks of the Kimpton properties is that you can get in room spa services performed right in the privacy of your guest room, any time you want. I took advantage of my Kimpton Rewards and got a fabulous in room massage at $30 off. My masseuse was kind, warm, and gave me a wonderful massage. Definitely budget for this experience if you select this hotel property. This was one of the major highlights of my stay in Chicago. I would describe the Palomar as hip, trendy, eclectic, hot-spot, modern, sleek, sophisticated, young, sexy, and comfortable. This is the place for you for value, good service, and nice accommodations. This is not the place for you if you favor large, grand hotels. If it was between this hotel and the Sofitel for business, I would put pick the Sofitel. For a girls weekend, or a couples weekend, the Palomar will not disappoint. I would recommend this hotel to just about anyone and would definitely return to this property again because I know I can expect a good experience. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Just another positive review...”
Reviews.Author: above_average_eater
Reviews.Content: Feel silly endorsing a hotel that everyone already loves but I had a very good experience at the Palomar. Location is dead-center in tourist land but still convenient to the rest of the city. Lobby scene isn't too horribly hip or loud--just enough to feel like there's something happening but not so awful that you need harassing en route to your room. Fitness room is under-outfitted but better than most hotels, for sure, and there's an indoor pool on a high floor. There is a fussiness to the art and fixtures that tries only slightly too hard but the layout in the room was great (had a corner upgrade with these extra vertical floor-to-ceiling windows on either side of the bed wall). Often, hotels like the Standard think "funkiness" justifies cheap outfitting or the incongruous choices that come from retrofitting an old office building into a hotel. This place had its share of laminated surfaces but it was good wenge laminate on functional well-thought out surfaces. When I can afford The Peninsula, I'll stay there. When I can't, I still value quality choices well executed at a lower price-point, not overworked nonsense designed to camouflage a lower investment by hotel operators looking to maximize profits. Overall, it was a nice place and a great value. My experience may not be typical since I went off-season and got the room for about $140 pls tx.

Reviews.Title: “1 night stay for work”
Reviews.Author: na9101
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Palomar for 1 night in January 2012 for business. The hotel has everything you need, can provide almost anything you forgot, and is a great deal, especially on a corporate rate. The $10 mini-bar credit was also a nice touch (with membership in Kimpton In-Touch). I'll definitely be back here when I return to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful surprise!”
Reviews.Author: TeriLee_Illinois
Reviews.Content: I was planning a night downtown Chicago for my husband's birthday. We usually stay at a select few hotels on Michigan Avenue when we visit but I decided to try Hotel Palomar this time. Boy, am I glad I did! We were pleasantly surprised at this little gem of a hotel. After driving in a snowstorm to get there, the front desk staff could not have been nicer. Check in was quick and the hotel was was very nice. We had asked for a room on a high floor away from elevators and ice machines and we received just that. The room was very clean, well maintained and spacious. After spending a few hours out, we returned to find a bottle of wine and a birthday card from the Assistant Front Manager, Gad Eidels. What a nice surprise! We had enjoyed the bar at Sable, although the staff were not so attentive, and had breakfast at Sable that was yummy. The wine reception was a nice touch and the servers, who were also fantastic, refused a tip. After this trip, we have decided Palomar will be our hotel for all future visits downtown!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Palomar never disappoints”
Reviews.Author: moxie529
Reviews.Content: Stayed there over President Day weekend with my niece for a 'fun aunt' weekend. Loved it - again... I think this is my fourth or fifth stay there. The rooms are beautiful - we had the luxury suite - huge living room, great bath with a soaking tub that I thought my niece would never leave, and a great bedroom with plenty of room for shopping bags. The staff is incredible. And breakfast at Sable is a must. Love this hotel and it's my first choice and always my number one recommendation for staying in Chicago - convenient to the Train, River North, Michigan Avenue, and about anything else you may need. Love it. One note - while they are a very pet friendly hotel - you can request a no-pet room if you suffer from allergies. They think of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Palomar Chicago has nice pool and stellar staff!”
Reviews.Author: Kim D
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palomar for a quick overnight visit and enjoyed the nice king bed, fluffy pillows, pool and loved the wine happy hour in the lobby they have every evening from 5 - 6 pm. We will definitely stay there again. The check in staff were very pleasant and helpful as well as the valet parking staff. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “All that we hoped for and more”
Reviews.Author: 3girlsmom777
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, top to bottom. Gave my kids activity bags and "coupons" for warm milk and cookies to be ordered from room service. Also gave the kids a voucher for a free pay-per-view movie which is a $16 value. Hotel was immaculate, well-appointed, and had a large list of items they had available should we have forgotten something. They also printed our boarding passes, hailed our cabs, and pretty much made us feel like if there was something we needed, they would take care of it. Fantastic location, great sitting area with warm fire place, and very friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Dingwoman
Reviews.Content: Received a great rate from expedia, called Kimptom InTouch and it was quickly matched. When I arrived Jessica checked me in very hospitably. I asked for a room on a higher floor and she was very accomodating. Enjoyed the wine reception. LOVED that pets are welcome, although my two 'girls' were at home. Absolutely no complaints! I will be looking more closely at Kimptoms throughout the US.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place for a mini-break!”
Reviews.Author: sbodie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed overnight for a quick vacation from the kids. It was our 10th wedding anniversary and he decided to surprise me with an upgraded room on a higher floor. He booked through his company's travel site and verified the booking the morning we were to arrive. Turns out there was a problem with the hotel downloading the reservation properly and our upgraded room was not available. However, they were able to accommodate us with an Artist Suite!!! We had a great city view, a very comfortable living room and a King size bed. The separate commode and large soaking tub were extra perks! The Manager also sent up a bottle of sparkling wine to help get our celebration started! The customer service really went above and beyond. The wine happy hour was fun. They bring out fire grilled pizza's to snack on and on a very cold January night we really appreciated the elongated fireplace! We tried to tip the servers at the wine reception and they refused. In the morning, they have coffee and tea down in the library as well. I checked out the pool but it was a bit overrun with kids (something we were looking to get away from). Walked around the block to Mastro's for dinner at the recommendation of the front desk and was not disappointed. All in all, a great night!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Palomar Chicago Visit”
Reviews.Author: GreggP227
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience during our visit to Chicago while staying at the Hotel Palomar. The hotel was very clean, staff was very helpful, professional and courteous and we enjoyed the free wine tasting event in the late afternoon. Location made things very convenient for travel around the city and to Lincoln Park. We are looking forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, and staff who are willing to go above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: lah343
Reviews.Content: I am a fan of all the Kimpton hotels but this one really blew me away. The minute we stepped out of the car our every need was attended to. Check in was efficient and friendly, the gentleman who brought our bags to the room was extremely polite and went out of his way to make us comfortable. He went and got a bottle of distilled water free of charge for my husband to use in his C-Pap machine just because he overheard us mention we forgot to stop at a store on the way there. I chose our room because of the spa-like qualities. The bathroom was like a personal retreat. The soaking tub and massive shower were so relaxing we never wanted to leave. Since we were there in the winter the rate was extremely reasonable. I couldn't believe we had such a huge room for the price. We were only passing through on the way back from our ski trip in northern Wisconsin; I wish we had made the reservation for two nights instead of one. We will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: DMilo46
Reviews.Content: This is the second Kimpton property we've stayed in and we thought it was nicer that the Los Angeles location. Though the dogs in the lobby still give me pause, I was told by the desk clerk that this is something the chain takes particular delight in--go figure. In any case, we were upgraded to a suite and found it clean, comfortable and well-appointed throughout. Staff is unfailing courteous and helpful, the fitness cente is large nad unusually well-stocked for a hotel and the restaurant, though expensive, is about what you'd expecte from a high-end hotel. Mainly, we chose the Palomar for its location and were not disappointed. It's two blocks from Michigan Ave and the Magnificent Mile and we enjoyed ourselves while there. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: PAMomanddaughter
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palomar for two nights, along with my two 20+ year old kids and my brother and his wife, for a fun weekend in Chicago where a lot of family and friends live. Had stayed at the Kimpton in DC and thought it was just so so, from the look of the hotel to the bar, so I wasn't expecting anything great. But this hotel was really terrific Clean, comfortable, updated, without a lot of the brash retro colors in the DC version. Good exercise facility with enough treadmills, bikes, ellipticals, weights for a load of people and nice lap pool, great location. Free wireless internet on my tablet. Parking isn't cheap but at least the valets were really prompt and everyone was really nice. Plus they have a 5 pm wine happy hour in the front lounge by the fire, with treats from Sable restaurant. Location is also terrific. Then there is Sable, restaurant owned by Heather Terhune of recent Top Chef fame. The bar was packed but we still managed to find a place and ate there (too cold out to go out and who even wanted to with this food and bar right there?). Both the food and the drinks were superb. Service is great. We had dessert and drinks in the restaurant late too, yummy, really good drinks made up by their mixologist, and breakfast was also really excellent. I'm from Chicago, and sometimes I stay in the suburbs where family is, but I may never stay anywhere else in the city when I'm downtown. All that and a great rate too.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel for business traveler”
Reviews.Author: bmart88
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel - I've stayed here twice last year, and would have returned a 3rd time had they had availability. Great location, steps away from Michigan Ave. Friendly staff, modern accomodations, nice gym, great happy wine hour (free).

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: Saddlebredchris
Reviews.Content: Weekend visit to Chicago for my wife's birthday was well spent at the Palomar. Second time there and was once again treated exceptionally well. Everyone at the front desk is eager to help. They made dinner reservations and sent a bottle of wine to our room for a birthday treat. Squeaky clean room. We love the Kimpton atmosphere. $48 a day to park hurts, but that is probably standard for Chicago. next time we will fly in and use the subway which has a stop right by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good.”
Reviews.Author: jd294
Reviews.Content: Pluses: The staff were friendly; the location is great in the heart of River North, near the Loop; the adjacent Sable restaurant offers stellar service and food; and the rooms were comfortable and modern. Minuses: The wine hour was overrun with dogs and small children and adults threatening time-outs; and the room smelled a bit like mildew. All in all, however, a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing property”
Reviews.Author: FarmGirl78
Reviews.Content: Went here for an annual christmas shopping trip, though we had never stayed here before. We were all amazed by the friendliness of the staff, and the decor and cleanliness of the property. The bathtub even passed my "white glove" treatment, which is rare, I'll admit. Someone else commented on small rooms, but our room met all expectations for a king bedroom, and we were on the 18th floor, though the view was nothing special. (we could have upgraded, but didn't). It was very cold the night we stayed, and we had been out and about, and wanted some coffee to go, which the attached bar way happy to provide us with, with no attitude about us not staying for drinks. Wine reception was fun, and included hot spiced apple cider with an optional whiskey shot (seasonal, I'm sure). Turn down service, chocolate left on the pillow, exceptional staff and superior rooms. Bottom line: I intend to make this a regular place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Chicago. Loved the Palomar”
Reviews.Author: Steph25
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Friendly and helpful staff. Cool rooms. Welcoming lobby with wine and treats... what more could we ask for? Loved it. Will return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for our first trip to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: tarheel08
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at the Hotel Palomar. The staff lived up to the Kimpton standard of excellence in customer service. We had a room on the 12th floor with a good view. Be prepared for the small size of the rooms! But, this is normal for big cities and the room was not too cramped for two people. The bed was very firm as it was one mattress on a platform. It was okay, but it would be better for customer comfort to have the box spring included. Our room issues were minor and staff were very prompt in resolving them. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, another impressive Kimpton hotel”
Reviews.Author: UckfieldSue
Reviews.Content: Having spent a week at the wonderful Epic Kimpton hotel in Miami in June, I looked forward to a night at the Palomar. There is clearly a "Kimpton style", which is to make sure that customers receive the best service, but informal not stuffy. Once again, lovely welcoming helpful staff; complimentary wine at 5-6pm every evening (the room was packed with mingling guests). Great location on State Street. We had a very good deal. My 2 friends are from illinois and do regular trips to Chicago for shopping, theater etc. This was their first stay at the Palomar and they liked it so much, they booked their next stay when we checked out. The rooms and general feeling of luxury did not nearly match that of the Epic but, in fairness, nor did the price (about double the cost at the Epic). I am definitely a Kimpton fan!

Reviews.Title: “Chicago heatwave, Hotel Palomar kept us cool”
Reviews.Author: SailorDrew
Reviews.Content: We arrive in Chicago last summer during a heatwave, and were delighted to discover the Hotel Palomar. Based on reviews from TA, we booked our room, with a TA discount, and we were not disappointed. The Hotel was urban chic, which can sometimes mean trendy hotel with rude staff. This was not the case. All the staff were extremely friendly inspite of the heat. The room was very nicely appointed, comfortable beds, and the AC worked great. Kudos to the Hotel Palomar Chicago. We look forward to our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff of any hotel I ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: DraperyDude
Reviews.Content: The property and it's amenities ware top notch, however it is the staff that separates itself. I stay in Chicago once a month and this was the first time I stayed at the Palomar and was so impressed. If it was more affordable when I would be in town I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “The Palomar made our trip to the "Windy City" Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Crystalee H
Reviews.Content: I reserved two rooms, one spa suite, one queen (x 2) room. Both rooms were clean, spacious, and well-equiped. The front counter staff were warm and made us feel at home. The wind tasting social every day in the beautiful lobby was very nice. We visited the Sable while staying at the Palomar and I would highly recommend saving yourself some steps and eating breakfast there. The wait staff at the Sable knew the menu inside and out and the food was delicious. Also, the front desk sent up a special basket for our daughter who was leaving out to fly to London in a couple of days. Such a nice, extra touch that made us feel comfortable in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “New Years and 25 anniversary in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Ttirrem
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the Palomar you are greeted by a subtle fresh signature scent setting the mood for a comfortable stay. The decor is modern but does not lack atmosphere. The concierges are extremely helpful and eager to please. Nabeel, who seemed to be there all the time , even remembered us by name after one day! Make sure that your room is on a higher floor when you stay at this hotel and that it faces State St. The views on the other side are uninspiring. The king spa premier room is spacious and has a great tub. Toiletries are by Etro and smell heavenly. The pool is rather small and almost always crowded with kids. The restaurant and bar are awesome. If you like cocktails this is your bar and if you like to sample many different flavours this is your restaurant. The waiters are attentive and friendly without being overbearing. We loved staying at this hotel, have already recommended it to our friends and will absolutely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Gret Location, Great Staff, Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: billyseagull
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights from the 22nd to the 26th of December, and had a very enjoyable stay. We had done a LOT of research before choosing our Hotel, as this was our first time in Chicago, and felt that location was very important. Before our arrival I had contacted the Hotel requesting a high, corner room, and even before we got there I had received a reply from Nabil the Manager, confirming that he would look into our request (and indeed on arrival we had an ideal room.) Check-in was smooth and friendly (what you need after a long journey) and both Bobby the Consierge (who was a great help with local knowledge and advise throughout our stay) and Tony, who took our bags to the room made sure we received the right sort of welcome.
