Niced sized room (2 Queen Beds) good view, excellent Bathroom. Plus Points: Rooms are clean and spacious. Gym/Pool - Both excellent, clean and well equipped. Wine Hour - Hosted wine hour(complimentary) each evening, some nibbles provided too. Location. Excellent - On State Street, close to everything you want. Wi-Fi - Free to Kimpton Members (You can join when you book.) Staff - outstanding including cleaning staff etc..Nothing too much trouble. Good Quality Bathrobes. Free Tea/Coffee in the Lobby each morning. Minus Points. No breakfast (But plenty of options nearby) No tea/Coffee making facilities in room. Slippers - they provide 'socks' but if you use them (you have to break the seal to get them on) then you are charged $15,00 (I think that's the correct figure) You do get to keep them though! Overall this is an excellent Hotel, we are very pleased we chose it, and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in King Spa Room”
Reviews.Author: Christine K
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel. I stayed at the Palomar for 2 nights for a mini staycation. I booked a King Spa room, getting a discounted rate because of my Kimpton InTouch membership. Just prior to my stay, Ashley from the Palomar emailed me to ask if I had any special requests and if it was a special occasion. I informed her that I was celebrating my birthday, and also asked for a DVD player and early check-in. I was actually unable to check in much earlier, but only because the staff was trying very hard to get me a specific room and it wasn't ready when I got there. After I told them that I would take any room, as I had to be somewhere shortly, they quickly scrambled and checked me in to a different room. The DVD player was installed and the maintenance man helpfully explained how to run the machine. They also sent up a bottle of champagne for my birthday, which was a lovely touch. The room was very spacious. I gathered with four friends in the room before going out for dinner and there was plenty of space in the sitting area. Wonderfully comfortable bed, and the room was very quiet, too (a must for me). There were lots of kids and dogs in the hotel, and there is a lot of traffic outside, but I wasn't bothered by any of it (fyi, I was on the 10th floor, so this may have helped with the noise of the traffic). Also, I LOVED the blackout curtains - made it easier to sleep in in the morning. The deep soaking tub was awesome. The room also had a large, separate shower. The wine hour is very nice; I believe this is done at all of the Kimpton hotels. The workout room was very clean and well-equiped. There is also an indoor pool, but I didn't have time to try it out. The staff was very helpful. Housekeeping was unobtrusive and thorough. I mentioned to Ashley that I was thinking of trying Yolk for brunch; she told me to tell them that I was staying at the Palomar because the hotel had preferred seating there - totally worked, we didn't have to wait at all to be seated. I read other reviews about the front desk area being chaotic, but I checked out on a Monday and did not have any problems. I really liked the location of the hotel, too - close enough to lots of shopping (another must for me) but without being right in the middle of crazy Michigan Ave. Also, there are lots of dining and bar options nearby. Side note on parking: I didn't park at the hotel, but used SpotHero.com to reserve a spot at the garage kitty-corner from the hotel. I bought 48 hours of parking for less than the cost of one day at the hotel (It was my first time using this service so I wasn't sure what to expect, but everything went smoothly). My only teeny tiny quibble during the entire weekend was with the TV remote - it had no numbers and I could only scroll through the channels in one direction. But you're not supposed to waste your vacation watching TV, so it wasn't a big deal. I've also stayed at the Palomar in DC (which is what prompted me to check out this hotel) and had a great experience there, too. I've become a big fan of the Kimpton hotels. Hoping to check in to another one for my next birthday, whether it's in Chicago or elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “great stay, great price”
Reviews.Author: canesmiami1
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Hotel Palomar in Chicago. Great location on State Street. Kimpton in-touch program provided a large king-sized room for $128.00 a night. Unbelievable price for Chicago. Friendly staff, generous rooms, & spotless clean. Valet was very fast. Sable Kitchen is located in the hotel & dining room and bar were packed on the Saturday night we stayed. I would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: goiuIndiana
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay, very pet and kid friendly hotel! Extremely nice decor and great customer service. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: vboles
Reviews.Content: The rooms were good size and the staff was unbelievable friendly. From the minute we got there til the moment we left. Gave all info about the hotel and had a great free wine hour every night. Very good wine.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Palomar!”
Reviews.Author: DSchrute
Reviews.Content: Just got back from spending an extra night in Chicago. Was in town for business and also stayed at the Doubletree. Got a great deal at the last minute as I needed to stay one more night and the Doubletree was sold out. Thanks to the TA promotion online I got a King size bed in a great room for only $111! The Palomar has a great retro/modern vibe. A lot of use of lighting and contemporary features make it feel more spa like. Some of the pro's are that everyone working there was exceptionally courteous and friendly, eager to help in any way. Rooms felt more like a nice little apartment than a hotel. They also have a complimentary wine reception and although I didn't use the indoor pool and fitness center, they looked very clean and well maintained. It's not a place where you see a lot of families with little kids running around, it's more of an adult themed type of place (which I prefer). A nice touch is that the majority of lights in the room are on dimmers. The only two con's I could think of are the lack of a coffee maker in the room, (but it is free down in the lobby in the morning) and the ridiculously small area to drive into when you first check in. It is literally big enough to hold only 2 cars, but the valets are always there to help get you in and out in a hurry. Beware, as parking anywhere overnight in Chicago is pricey, and the Palomar is getting $46 with in and out privileges.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Rjs1978
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our anniversary get away. Great staff Ashlee even sent up a bottle of champagne with a note. We will definitely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: dkennethr
Reviews.Content: Had our entire wedding guest list stay there last year and my wife and I just went back or a 1 year anniversary night. Front desk staff has unmatched professional courtesy. Great accommodations for reasonable price. Will stay at Palomar for every Chicago return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service - great location!”
Reviews.Author: Nchetcuti
Reviews.Content: My aunt, two cousins and I stayed at the Palomar for a quick Chicago shopping trip. We were impressed with the quality of service and great location. The concierge was very friendly and knowledgeable about the area. They do charge $46 for overnight parking but the extra money is worth it. My cousin forgot something in the car and the valet went out of his way to retrieve the items. The hotel bar draws a nice crowd and the complimentary happy hour from 5-6 is a chic bonus;)

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton never disappoints - Hotel Palomar is another gem”
Reviews.Author: gullygroup5
Reviews.Content: I have been a follower of Kimpton for almost 20 years now and after a recent stay at the Palomar I know why. They just know how to do it right. My husband and I spent a night there on December 30th (we live in Chicago) for our yearly stay-cation. As expected, service was excellent. The decor of the hotel is beautiful. I love the way the sitting area is seperated from the check in. Our room was so nicely appointed with a mini-bar stocked with anything you could think of, food and non-food items. The concierge arranged a last minute reservation for us at a popular downtown restaurant, GT Fish and Oyster, which was excellent. Prior to dinner we sat at the hotel bar in the Sable Grill and were treated to great service by Bobbie. It was fun to watch him mix drinks...truly an art. We could have sat there all night. We ate breakfast at the Sable which was amazingliny inovative. Not your typical eggs and bacon. Finally, the River North location is within great proximity of Michigan Avenue shopping and many fabulous restarurnts. We did not use the pool, but it looked nice and the gym was a good size but a bit hot (according to my husband). The only complaint I have is that they should have built a few more elevators when they constructed the property. We had a room on the top floor and the elevators were slow and crowded. A small inconvenience for a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: vacationfam
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Palomar for one night on December 29, 2011. It was our Christmas gift to one another, and it did not disappoint. From the moment we walked through the door, we were treated incredibly well. We got a free room upgrade, and great advice about where to go out, and who to ask for once we got there. We have stayed in several 4 star hotels in Chicago over the years, and the Palomar is by far our favorite. The room was incredibly quiet, even though the hotel was very busy. We loved the floor-to-ceiling windows, the fun robes, and the lighting with the dimmer features. The bath products were generously portioned, and the chocolate at turn-down was much appreciated. The wine hour was busy, but we just bought our wine up to the room and enjoyed the beautiful view of the city. It was great to come in after a chilly afternoon of shopping, to have a big glass of red wine! The staff who worked the wine hour were very friendly and accomodating. We also enjoyed Sable, the restaurant that is attached to the Palomar. The craft cocktails were delicious, and the bartender was really helpful in helping us choose one! The food in the restaurant was excellent. It's definately a place we would choose to dine at again. Our favorite thing about the Palomar is the staff. We were so pleased with how much time they took to explain everything, and to make sure we found the perfect places to eat, etc...We can't say enough about Bobby G. He made sure our short little getaway was perfect! We hope to return to the Palomar very soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Another typical excellent Kimpton experience”
Reviews.Author: Geiszlah
Reviews.Content: Over the past two years, Kimpton hotels have become my absolute must stay whenever I'm traveling. Several reasons for this: friendly staff, cool restaurant on site, nicely appointed rooms, and a free wine happy hour every night from 5-6. My experience at Hotel Palomar was no different - another great experience at a Kimpton hotel. It's in a great location (River North about 2 blocks from the Magnificent Mile) with numerous eating and drinking establishments within a 5-10 minute walk. We walked from Navy Pier back to the hotel in about 20 minutes as well. Staff was very helpful, the room was comfortable and as always the happy hour was great. If you go to any Kimpton, you'll get a similar experience - well worth the additional cost over a traditional chain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Over the top customer service - a different kind of hotel experience.”
Reviews.Author: winefoodandsong
Reviews.Content: My 8 year old daughter and I stayed here for two nights for a little mid-winter getaway. The location is great and the hotel is extraordinary. I travel often for business and pleasure and rarely see the kind of service and attention that I saw here. Everyone takes an extra step to make sure you are having a good time. The morning coffee and tea service, the great evening wine hour, the cool rooftop (indoor) pool, the really comfortable rooms all make the Palomar a winner. We especially enjoyed Shay from Engineering and Bleu at the door. Thanks, guys!

Reviews.Title: “The chicken & waffles stole my heart”
Reviews.Author: RunCatchKiss
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Palomar, and it was even better than the first. I'm a big fan of Kimpton hotels, and in my opinion, this is one of the best. Staff are always very friendly, positive and upbeat. The wine reception each evening is a great excuse to mingle and see other faces, and over the holiday season it was particularly busy and bustling. The hotel is modern, clean, and has a SPECTACULAR restaurant on site. I had heard that Sable was amazing, but hadn't tried it last time. This time, it was so good that we ate there three times. Their dinner menu is amazing; our waiter Geoff recommended that we order a bunch of small plates a few at a time so we could experience a lot of different flavors. Great advice! We tried the shrimp & grits, chicken & waffles, mini pork belly sliders... and on and on. Each dish was incredible, some of the best comfort food with a twist that I've ever had. We stayed in a King Premier room, which was a junior suite with a fabulous spa bathroom. After a day of walking around, the jetted tub was particularly appreciated. With the Palomar, you can't go wrong. Seriously, stop thinking about it, and just book it!

Reviews.Title: “Great NYE Stay!”
Reviews.Author: katex414
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided (last-minute) to book this stay for New Years Eve. We had dinner reservations right around the corner (at Ruth's Chris) and it was the perfect location! The Palomar is beautiful! The lobby was contemporary and decorated beautifully. The staff that checked us in was remarkably friendly and courteous. Our room was ready immediately, which on a busy day like NYE we were happy about; the room and bathroom were super clean! They have a list of FREE amenities if you've forgotten something or if you're in need of something to make your stay more enjoyable (for example: a humidifier, curling iron, flat iron, etc.) That's awesome! We were informed that upon returning to the hotel, we would need to provide our name and ID for security reasons, which I liked! Great job keeping the hotel from becoming a free-for-all. The hotel was quiet and we had no problems at all! I'd absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised. Even our pooch was treated well!”
Reviews.Author: divingtraveller
Reviews.Content: As we live in a far suburb, we often spend the night in the city. This is our new favorite hotel. Our golden retriever was welcomed at NO additional charge AND he enjoyed his pet amenities. He was also greeted by name when we would return from a stroll. Gad, front desk mgr., contacted us prior to arrival and helped us with details. Room was refreshingly spotless, although a bit small (we had a Deluxe King), and well appointed. The minibar had no gin, but it did have Grand Marnier! No coffee/tea service in room required getting dressed to get coffee, and we did not get to enjoy the wine hour, though we will next time. Pool and terrace will be great in the summer. Twenty restaurants within three blocks (really!), and this time we enjoyed Shaw's Crabhouse, a three minute walk. You can't go wrong at this property.

Reviews.Title: “I don't understand the fuss...”
Reviews.Author: Ben B
Reviews.Content: When booking my Christmas stay in Chicago, I read reviews online and was thinking of staying at the Radisson Blu, the Wit, the Public, and other hotels... but I've heard a lot about the Palomar and the Kimpton brand and wanted to experience it first hand. I must have been expecting a lot, as I was really underwhelmed. The quick and short review: door man didn't open door or say hello, front desk was good (Mark), called our mobile when our room was ready for an early check in and upgraded us to a huge room. Tub jets didn't work, no big deal, but even maintenance couldn't fix the issue. Lobby was nice, but not outstanding. We don't drink at all, so the wine hour wasn't a draw. I think what got me the most was the incredibly drab design - brown and beige walls with catalog art against 1980s style carpet with brown and beige circles along with brown furnishings and pillows just made everything feel so old when I knew it was so new. No bedside power outlets added to some frustration, crawling on the floor unplugging your lamp is never a fun thing, and only makes the room darker. A huge minus for me (usually takes a star away but I don't want to give them 2 stars) was that they still use little plastic bottles for their shampoo, soap, lotion, body wash, etc... this is so wasteful, and you cannot read what the bottles are, so you have to open them and guess. For every 100 rooms a hotel has, they throw out almost 150,000 plastic bottles a year, most are still almost full, which means a lot of chemicals leaching into the groundwater supply. Another ding was that the water isn't softened... and Chicago has probably the most over-chlorinated and worst tasting water in North America, which is odd because it's next to a giant lake. Having hard water that smells like a swimming pool just makes sleeping in a dry winter climate impossible... I think it took me 2+ hours of going crazy over my skin being so dried out before I could get to sleep. All in all, these are really general issues, the hotel is "fine", it's not a dump, it's not bad, it's just not fantastic or exciting or memorable. If you normally stay in a chain, you'll love the perks, but if you normally seek unique, interesting boutique hotels I think you'll be really disappointed and should actually try out some of the chains in Chicago - and that's something I never say to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: michfamily
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with our teenage daughter and her freinds and we loved the location of this hotel, the cleanliness and the value. Internet was free, as was morning coffee and nightly wine tasting and the breakfast at Sable was definitely a cut above the normal hotel experience. The staff was super pleasant and very accomodating. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the holidays, sightseeing and shopping!”
Reviews.Author: rony_bonbony
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Palomar the day after Christmas, just to escape family for the most part. :) The hotel's location near Chicago's Mag Mile is perfect for shopping, sightseeing and dining. The hotel itself houses Sable Kitchen, which is an excellent restaurant. In Kimpton hotels style, Palomar has a wine tasting happy hour with full wine glasses, far beyond a taste, and snacks from the restaurant. We had a city view room, which was a corner one, with fabulous views. Overall, the hotel is beautiful and a wonderful value. You will not regret staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: iowahawkeye73
Reviews.Content: The Palomar is in my opinion the best hotel in Chicago. It is a fantastic boutique like hotel that is well appointed with style and it is a lot of fun to be at. The rooms are beautiful and modern. The two person Fuji tub is one of the best you'll ever get into. The staff is outstanding and they understand what customer service should look like. The afternoon wine tasting allows you to meet others from across the country. The Sable restaurant was great. We have stayed at other Kimpton Hotels and this company is top shelf. We stayed at the Palomar to celebrate our 10th anniversary and we had a great time. They have an indoor pool that is a nice touch. Check out the outdoor views from the top floor. I would strongly encourage all the suburbanites to check out this Chicago Jewel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mkfhughes
Reviews.Content: Great location and very helpful staff. Customer service was superb. We especially loved arriving to the wine happy hour. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Keep Coming Back!!!”
Reviews.Author: bently1614
Reviews.Content: This is my fifth trip to Chicago in the last two years and I wouldn't stay anywhere else! In fact, I have changed my plans when they haven't had rooms available. It's like my home away from home and most of the staff now call me by name and are so welcoming when I return. A huge shout out to Blu, Mark, James, Sam, Marcus and the rest of the staff. They go out of their way to make me feel at home and help in any way they can! Love the wine hour and coffee in the morning if you aren't having breakfast. Sable is good for breakfast and lunch and the bar area can be a hopping, happening place! Rooms are well appointed and totally clean. Love the walk in showers and the water pressure and temperature are excellent. Can't say enough good things about the hotel and now that the road works have been completed it's pretty much perfect!! Thanks to everyone for taking such good care of me!

Reviews.Title: “Small, cozy, well located hotel with variable service”
Reviews.Author: HCJdallas
Reviews.Content: Pros: Rooms are cozy, clean, quiet, with comfortable beds and upscale bath amenities. The wine happy hour is a nice bonus and quite enjoyable. Hotel restaurant, Sable, is good for lunch and especially dinner. Location is walkable to Michigan Avenue, restaurants, etc. Starbucks is down the street as well as 7-11 for snacks/coffee. Cons: Check in area is small and quite unattractive. If there is a crowd checking in/out the front desk staff are easily overwhelmed. It is also cold, which detracts from the wine tasting. The service is spotty and ranges from excellent (concierges who were universally helpful and had great restaurant recommendations) to the front desk staff one of whom practically rolled her eyes at me when I told her that I needed to change rooms b/c I reserved 2 double beds and I was given a room with a king size bed. Not only did she roll her eyes, she never apologized, and she told me that the hotel could not guarantee the beds. Only after I insisted that I could not possibly sleep in the same bed with my colleague from work and needed a different room did she relent.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: teedotTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days over the holidays and have nothing but good things to say. For starters, the hotel is ideally located close to restaurants, Michigan Avenue and the El train. There's a good mix of fancy, well-known and affordable restaurants nearby, not to mention a 7-Eleven and supermarket right across the street. We never struggled to choose somewhere to eat; the only difficult part was getting a table! The hotel was a great home base for our stay. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and the place is small enough that we never waited for an elevator and rarely heard noise from the hallways or other rooms. Our room was clean and had a good amount of storage, especially in the bathroom. Heating was easy to maintain and quiet, bed was super comfortable, and the desk had plenty of outlets to charge all of our gadgets. The hotel has valet parking, but we parked at the Hilton Garden Inn across the street. It was only $8 cheaper a night, but we're not fans of valet and this allowed us easy access to the car without waiting or tipping. One recommendation would be to join the Kimpton Loyalty program. We signed up right before making the reservation and benefited from an email letting us know of a 30% off sale, and then enjoyed free wi-fi and newspapers delivered to our room as well as $10 of minibar items. The hotel also provides complimentary coffee and tea in the mornings, which is a great way to start the day. They serve wine from 5-6pm too, but we never made it. The only minor minor minor complaints are: the bathroom counter seemed high and even at 5'6" I felt like I had to stand on my toes when brushing my teeth to not get my shirt wet; this might be an issue for kids. Also, the water pressure in the shower could stand to be a bit stronger, and housekeeping was a bit spotty replacing towels and replenishing soap. Again, all very minor complaints. For the price, we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Palomar's Warm Hospitality Removed Sting Of Christmas Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelingCatLady
Reviews.Content: In a break from tradition, my family spent Christmas in Chicago this year and stayed at the Hotel Palomar. Although I was bummed about the prospect of spending Christmas in a hotel room, the Palomar made the stay as pleasant as possible. First, the wine reception is awesome. The two wines available were very tasty and at one point flatbread pizza from neighboring restaurant Sable was brought out (and it was delicious). The wine hour is served in the hotel's lobby/living room infront of an inviting fire and it was wonderful. In the morning, coffee, tea, and hot chocolate was available as well. On Christmas morning, in recognition of the fact that everything nearby was closed, the hotel set out a complimentary breakfast buffet with fresh fruit, bagels, and pastries. This was an absolute lifesaver, and has earned my eternal loyalty (it saved my sanity, as well as my parents', to be fed). The rooms are very comfortable and fairly big for a large city hotel room. Only complaints (and I advised the hotel of this in a post-stay survey) are these: the water pressure is low in the shower. This is not uncommon lately given the fad of low flow showerheads, that invariably result in low water pressure. Also, the sheets and one of the towels in my room were torn. This was disappointing, but the rest of the pluses with the stay more than made up for it. I definitely recommend the Palomar.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a zen feel!”
Reviews.Author: Anne M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 11 nights and every time I came back to my room, it felt like home. The front desk is very attentive, polite and friendly. The turn-down service is great and their people are pleasant and fun to talk to. If you are not there, they do a great job of leaving chocolate and turning down the lights low for a very soothing ambiance when you come in. Their "living room" area is great. We were there during December and the Christmas tree was nice to see since we couldn't be in our own homes. The fireplace is fantastic! They have a wine service every evening and coffee every morning - again all done very classy. The location (River North) was great and the doormen were exceptional and efficient. There is one gentleman who needs mentioning - Blue - he's the greatest. Friendly, attentive and keeps track of the guests and remembers things about them as we return. I was traveling for work with another woman, and it was comforting to have him around. The restaurant was always busy and you needed a reservation very early on so we never got to eat there except for room service which was ok - it was room service. The people in the room service staff were very nice and quick though. Apparently the Chef is on the TV reality show Top Chef and doing quite well so everyone is flocking to her restaurant which was named Sable. I'm returning this month and have already booked my room for the next 10 days.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely pleased with the hotel staff, location, amenities, bar and restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: Cartman059
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two days at the hotel over the Christmas holiday. We could'nt have asked for a better experience, the entire staff is top notch, the bar and restaurant are excellent (best old fashioned in town), the location is excellent, walk to shopping, entertainment, restaurants and bars. We would recommend this hotel over any other hotel in the area. It's rare that you feel that you've received your monies worth when you stay at a hotel in downtown Chicago but that is not the case at the Palomar. We will definitely stay here again. A big thank you to the Palomar Hotel staff and management for a most enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ebriolus
Reviews.Content: We're just ensconced on our first night here, but the impression is so strong I thought I'd write the review now. Hopefully all will continue to go well. Front desk is attentive and courteous, same with bellman. We had a suite (17-year-old daughter in tow), and it was very generously-sized, with a front room that has a fold-out bed, TV, sitting area. Very well designed, the bath in the center has doors on both sides for privacy. Excellent location, a block from the river on State Street. I don't know why I'd stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A Really great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AviaDeSer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel over the holidays and were really pleased with this hotel. We travel a lot and I always try to find a good hotel for my family. This hotel exceeded all of my expectations. The staff in this hotel is friendly, caring, helpful and simply the best I have ever encountered. The rooms were nicely decorated and very clean. The evening wine tasting was excellent, bottled water in the lobby as well as morning coffee and tea were all really nice touches. Because we stayed over the holidays, they had a complimentary breakfast Christmas morning. Excellent idea, especially for families with kids! The only two problems encountered in this hotel were: the water in the pool was not warm enough and the heating/ac in the room was just too loud. However, we will be back in Palomar next time we're in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “True Class on State Street”
Reviews.Author: UKbanker33
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights while attending a conference and as is typical of the Kimpton brand, were completely happy with our choice. We had selected a "spa" room which seems a bit gimmicky since it merely indicates that it has a jacuzzi (which we never used) and is a larger corner room (which we really appreciated). The room was gorgeous in a rather subdued vaguely Asian way. The bathroom spaciously typically Kimpton with a large separate shower. Nice sofa and large work desk. View just of nearby buildings which also slightly limited the sunshine (not that the sunshine needs reasons to be scarce in Chicago in November). The front desk (again typically Kimpton) was extremely friendly and knowledgeable and I feel that they brought in extra staff just to deal with the extra press of convention goers and holiday tourist-shoppers. I received a $10 minibar voucher and free internet automatically as a member of their program (takes 15 seconds to sign up). This is another reason why Kimpton is not Sheraton or Hilton. The complimentary reception was usually packed, particularly with the foreign delegates who seemed amused by the innovation...we actually did not try to squeeze in the lovely room off the lobby. Kimpton has some rather risque properties (which I love even more), but this is one grandma would enjoy. The attached restaurant is superb...great example of the Chicago surge in cuisine recently. Rates are "healthy" by Chicago standards, but as is typical with most hotels in this chain, you feel like you've gotten good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Annette623154995
Reviews.Content: A short walk from the train station, this newly renovated hotel was very clean and modern. The service was exceptional. Every evening, wine tasting in the lobby with hors d'Oeuvres. Bottled water for early morning runners. The staff was very helpful and went out of their way to answer any questions and make suggestions for restaurants, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Another nice Kimpton”
Reviews.Author: PickyTraveler83
Reviews.Content: Spent a birthday weekend at the hotel Palomar. Nice touches: coffee and tea/hot chocolate in the morning, and wine tasting in the evening. Located in the River North section. Staff was great and check in a breeze. Everything was clean and beds comfortable. If you are a Kimpton member, you get $10 free mini bar snacks and free internet. Great chain of hotels. I have also stayed at the Monaco-another good pick.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience--Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: SarahJayne104
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Hotel Palomar last week as we celebrated our anniversary. We are actually Chicago residents and had planned to travel to LA, but being pressed for time around the holidays, we decided to turn our lofty vacation plan into more of a "stay-cation". And we are so glad we did! My parents are big fans of the Kimpton hotel group and suggested we try out the Hotel Palomar here, as they had heard it was cool without being overly trendy and came equipped with an excellent restaurant. We heeded their suggestion and were rewarded with a truly wonderful experience. Here is all that we enjoyed: From the moment we checked we felt the kindness and attention to detail that the hotel is known for in each interaction we had. The front desk attendants were sunny and professional, welcoming us warmly (and by name) each time we entered and wishing us well each time we left. The room itself was lovely--super roomy--and had an AMAZING fuji soaking tub in the spa bathroom. (I mean seriously...this tub was amazing. We actually can't stop talking about. Like...we're going to buy a house to renovate just so we can fit one of those bathtubs into our lives. It's that good.) When they "Restored" the room each evening as we were out at dinner and shows, they also drew the curtains, dimmed the lights, cued the soft Christmas tunes, turned down the bed and put chocolates on the pillow. So cute! As a Kimpton In-Touch member, I had filled out a section about room preference and had noted that we preferred corner rooms if available. I also mentioned in the comments section of the reservation that we were celebrating our anniversary. Not only were we placed in a lovely corner unit, but the hotel had a bottle of champagne waiting for us on our arrival! We felt way more important that we actually are...! The restaurant is great--we had breakfast one morning, and a really wonderful dessert delivered to the room after we returned from an evening at Steppenwolf one night, and both experiences were quite delicious. While we didn't venture down for cocktails this time, we certainly will on our next visit. Waiting for the elevators one evening allowed us a moment to listen to the warm buzz of music and conversation that usually makes me want to jump into a cocktail dress and have a drink...but the bathtub was calling so gently... So, next time! The best thing I can say about the Hotel Palomar is that it took what could have been just another weekend in a city we're almost too familiar with and transformed it into one of the most wonderful, relaxing, and enjoyable vacations we've ever had. We are planning our wedding for September of next year here in Chicago and this trip has us really wanting to do a block of rooms here so our friends and family can experience it is well! I can't recommend this hotel highly enough! Oh--we were also able to book our room prepaid and the rate was AMAZING. We both agreed that we would have happily paid double to have that experience...though we were even happier we didn't have to. :)

Reviews.Title: “Not a negative thing to say.”
Reviews.Author: Tho H
Reviews.Content: I gotta say that I was really happy to have booked here. The staff was more than accomdating to our early arrival and late departure. The property is coviently located next to the Red Line if you need to go anywhere, also walking distance to shopping and all the attractions Downtown. The hallways and rooms were clean, beds were comfy and the Aveda toiletries were a nice finishing touch. I am planning on coming back and I won't need to do any research for a different hotel. The Palomar was great.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: jrgray
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived until we checked out, the Hotel Palomar delivered exceptional service for us. The hotel manager contacted us by email before we arrived asking if there was anything he could do for us. The hotel upgraded our reservation to a Fuji tub suite when we told them it was our 20th anniversary. Service was perfect, the room was clean and spacious and everyone we met was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Your New Home-Away-From-Home”
Reviews.Author: Brian T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palomar when it first opened, having first discovered the Kimpton chain in Salt Lake City, and have stayed three times since -- we wouldn't think of staying anywhere else in Chicago. The location can't be beat -- easy walk to museums, Magnificent Mile, gallery district and best eats (don't overlook Sable, the hotel's restaurant, great for pre-theater or late night). Smartly appointed rooms. You can't help but see a great sense of pride in the quality of service and facility from everyone on the staff, from the bellhops to the restaurant waiters to the able desk attendants. No hotel or chain is more LGBT-friendly. Be sure to sign up for Kimpton's InTouch Program.

Reviews.Title: “Great Ladies Weekend at the Palomar!”
Reviews.Author: KatGio76
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location for the ladies to do some Christmas Shopping! We were between Michigan Avenue and State Street. We returned to the hotel from a long day and were greeted with wine and appetizers in the lounge by the Christmas tree and burning fireplace. Love the clean, modern decor and warm friendly ambiance. The beds and shower were some of the best we have experienced in the downtown Chicago area. We dined at Sable Kitchen in a private area where we sampled and shared some of the best food by far. Then, we had an easy walk to the Theater District for a play. In the morning, we rose to hot coffee and cocoa in the lobby lounge. Price was affordable too. This boutique hotel is one of Chicago's best kept secret!

Reviews.Title: “What's wrong with this place?”
Reviews.Author: DoesNotGetOutMuch
Reviews.Content: Not a lot really. I stayed for a single night. Its well positioned in Chicago, North of THE River a few blocks from the miracle mile. The front desk is prepared for your arrival and efficient. I got a good sized, corner room on the 5th floor, well appointed for business, good bathroom, good sleep even thought there was some traffic noise. Sable restaurant provides a good variety of food. The next day we ran a meeting for 25 in room designed to use natural light. The room was good and activity nicely supported. Departure was smooth.

Reviews.Title: “Best service in the city”
Reviews.Author: TravelingGeneticist
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at over 8 different hotels in the River North area of Chicago. The Hotel Palomar tops my list for service--from managing a unusual reservation request (on a Priceline room, none the less), to the valet, reception, housekeeping and restaurant staff--The people at Hotel Palomar go out of their way to make you feel like their favorite cousin. I even got a hug from the concierge as I was leaving! Definitely the place to stay if you want that warm, welcome feeling. Try and get a corner room. The views are outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: LCP3
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience at the Palomar...the staff was very welcoming & the room was beautiful. Top notch!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: AngeliqueKamara
Reviews.Content: I stayed a couple of nights at Palomar for our 2 year anniversary. It was amazing. The hotel is conveniently located, beautifully decorated, beds are amazingly comfortable, there is a nice pool with great city views, a terrace and a gym. But the best is the quality of service and attention you receive from everyone there. We got a special note for our anniversary, weather cards with chocolates every day on the pillows, email recommendations of things to do, complimentary wine tastings every night, free coffee and chocolate all day, etc. Don't forget to register as a Intouch member to get other nice perks. I recommend this hotel for stay in Chicago. It's amazing value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: Lori F
Reviews.Content: Just spent two nights at the Palomar while on a Christmas shopping trip. It was a wonderful place to stay. The hotel was beautiful and located in such a great location to anything you would like to do. Every person associated with the hotel is truly professional and so kind and thoughtful...from the valet, to the doorman, to the front desk, housekeeping and the management. It could not have been a more perfect stay. I highly recommend the Palomar.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a good experience.”
Reviews.Author: Gabriel G
Reviews.Content: Spending a weekend in Chicago with the wife and stayed at this Hotel. We upgraded to a King Spa Suite, which is a decent sized room with a sitting area, a jetted tub for two and a separate shower. No problems with the hotel in general. It is as advertised. There's a very helpful, considerate staff, upscale interior, and high end furnishings. The room is quiet, has good heat/AC, and great black out curtains. The bed is on the firm side (which is a preference) but you can tell the mattress is well maintained and has nice bedding. The only drawbacks we encountered had to do with the bathroom. Regarding what could be fixed, our jetted tub had a malfunctioning drain stop which would not allow water to drain with the turn of the designated nob. In order to get the water to drain, you had to get your fingers to pry up the drain. A screwdriver would have helped! We told the front desk and they said they would send an engineer, but when we got back to the room things had not changed. Regarding what can't be fixed, the vanity only has one sink, and it should have two. The shower is huge for a hotel. At least 4x4 or even larger. Only problem is it has a single shower head more appropriate to a cheap motel. There should be a rain shower or at least multiple shower heads. Although two people can comfortably fit in the shower, don't try it, one of you will freeze while the other one gets the less than generous stream from the old fashioned shower head. For one person the shower is fine, but not 4star quality. Considering the high quality experience which is the Palomar, the bathroom failings are not enough to stop me from coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to spend a Birthday!!”
Reviews.Author: Marsha P
Reviews.Content: Thank you for the great stay at the Palomar. We came down to Chicago go to enjoy the weekend with my Daughter and my Husband, to celebrate our Birthdays. We were not dissappointed in our service. The staff treated every customer like a million bucks. Your kindness made us all feel respected and important. Our visits are few to Chicago but I can tell you memories were made. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, and beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: nolang78
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Chicago and first stay in a Kimpton hotel. Was very pleased at the overall experience from the very start as we were able to check in early (9am) and were very impressed with the design of the hotel and the quality and size of the room. Our view was fine although that is not a concern of mine as I don't plan on sitting in the room to look outside! Front desk was very helpful with tips and suggestions. Very clean hotel and would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “first stay at Kimpton...”
Reviews.Author: m0rrissey
Reviews.Content: ...and it was ok. Very good, actually. But overall, the Palomar has a "corporate" feel. Not bad, but not as great as some of the reviews here portray. It did feel a little "Marriott-esque" at times. To me that is the kiss o'death. Booked a suite, but the view was of a glass-curtained building next door. Ok, moved to a spa premiere king with a better view. The room was comfortable and clean, but again, no edge just kind of corporate. Mattress was not to my liking. The bathroom was huge with a gigantic tub, but oddly the large walk in shower had a single small shower head. You had to stay right underneath the head to stay warm during your shower, negating all that space. Nothing wrong with that approach, but why spec out such a huge shower if the design includes this type of shower head? Odd. The tub was fun for one splash, but really not that practical. The gym was better than average for an urban hotel. There is nothing wrong with the Palomar. It just lacks that urban edge and vibe that I seek when traveling. Other hotels do a better job in that respect in town (ahem, one begins with a J) and I'll be back there next year. BTW, the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. Sable mixes a mean cocktail. Kudos for the customer service and friendliness. For family or corporate travel, this is a great "safe" option. And that's the scoop.

Reviews.Title: “A good weekend at the Palomar, a very good 4 star”
Reviews.Author: abuck75
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted to bring our 3 1/2 year old downtown for the weekend, and ended getting a very good rate to try a 1 bedroom at Palomar for the first time. I really enjoy the location a couple blocks off Michigan and would certainly stay again. This hotel is a good niche above, imo, the chains (Marriott, Hilton), but not at level of the 5 stars. The Good: A very nice room layout with everything new and clean. Spacious bathroom with modern features and quality materials. The staff is extremely friendly and they knew our names prior to check-in. I was also pleasantly surprised by the prices in the mini-bar, which were just reasonable enough I could justify using it, and thought the room service food from sable restaurant was very good as well. They also brought a goldfish to the room for our son as our "special treat" for saying the secret word. Things to know: Unfortunately, our room was not ready at 3:00 PM check-in. Normally not a big deal but with the little guy after a long day and wanting to get to a dinner slightly early, it was a fairly large inconvinience. They did give us a free drink at the bar while we waited, which was nice but it was an hour delay. In addition, the breakfast room service did make a couple small errors, sandwich included bacon and no syrup with pancakes. Mistakes do happen, and they did correct rather quickly. Also, the loading area at the Valet is extremely small on a busy road (State st.) and can make entering and leaving difficult as slightly hectic. I don't want to give the wrong impression, as this hotel deserves it's ranking, and I would visit again for this price, but if you generally stay at 5 star hotels, there are a few things to know going in. For the price difference, you would expect differences, but if you forget something, the staff isn't able to go out of their way to help as they have at Trump or Elysian in the past. Also, the bed, while very comfortable lacked that "Heavenly" quality at so many top end hotels now.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Palomar in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Becca_Ontario
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Palomar for two nights. We're from Canada and it was our first time in Chicago. The hotel exceeded our expectations. Because I signed up for a Kimpton membership, we were treated to two free drinks from the mini bar in the room. That was a nice start to the trip! The staff were extremely friendly and VERY helpful, Being first-time visitors, I'm sure we were annoying, but they were really patient and accommodating - and gave us great recommendations. Our favourite recommendation was dinner at Brazzas, a wonderful Brazilian steakhouse five minutes from the hotel. Best meal we have had in a while. Don't hesitate to ask staff for anything - they will deliver. Our rooms were comfortable and spotless, the pool was a nice touch, and the location could not have been better. We were within walking distance to everything we wanted to see, and if we weren't, the subway was literally right outside. We loved Chicago - we will definitely be back, and we will definitely be back to the Palomar.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Lisa C
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Palomar was the third Kimpton Hotel I stayed in and it did not dissapoint. It is located in a great location in Chicago-walking distance to some of the best restaurants, Michigan Ave, and terrific bars. The hotel staff were friendly and accommodating. My husband and I wanted to stay an extra night and although the hotel was full, they were able to take care of us. Wine tasting was an added plus and a great way to meet other hotel guests. The Sable in the AM was a great place for breakfast. In the PM, a great place to have cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “"Wonderful"”
Reviews.Author: jgogo
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay at the Palomar. We were there for a girls weekend and had an amazing time! We stayed in a suite with not only a great view of the city but very roomy and super clean. The overall decor and ambiance of the hotel was sleek but yet very cozy. The service was fantastic and the concierge went out of his way to make our night on the town one to remember! Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to spend your trip in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Matt S
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Chicago and it couldn't have been better. The hotel was in a great location and the customer service was awesome. The rooms were very classy and more importantly, comfortable. The hotel was also in a great location in Chicago and I could walk almost anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “All good”
Reviews.Author: Franko76
Reviews.Content: I booked a room through Hotwire and was delighted to see that my chosen hotel was ranked so high on TA. It was good, and the price was excellent, but surely not top five in this city. From the start, I got great support through Hotel Palomar's Twitter service, and the front desk was equally service minded. They have a nice pool and a nice fitness room. The room itself was good. Decent size and clean. Location was also good. You're right it in. I couldn't get the minibar key to work, but it didn't matter to me anyway. The Internet line was also good. Valet parking was expensive, but I guess it's like that in any city. For me, this is a 5* review because the price was extremely good.

Reviews.Title: “Pristine”
Reviews.Author: cheznous3
Reviews.Content: New, sleek, friendly and so refreshingly clean. WOW great location too!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: piuric
Reviews.Content: Very effcient staff, will definetly stay again during my next trip to chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A good bet”
Reviews.Author: Saussy
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at the Palomar, as we have been with Kimpton hotels in Boston, New York, and Washington, D.C. They are always clean, the service is great, and the rooms are roomy. In Chicago, the decor was lovely and the concierge went out of his way to be helpful. We loved waking up to a fresh cup of coffee and having a glass of wine before dinner. The Palomar is convenient to nearly everything we wanted to do. We walked to the Millenium Park, the Art Institute, the Cultural Center, the river boat architectural tour, and the Lake. Although we did not go shopping, we were only two blocks away from the Michigan Avenue. The restaurants around the Palomar were also really good--and interesting. We'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “November, 2011”
Reviews.Author: January48
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Palomar is exceptional. The room was extremely clean and comfortable. The hotel is close to shopping, parks and restuarants. Everything is well within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “What Hospitality - Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Frankpar
Reviews.Content: Truly 4+star hotel! From exiting the car at arrival until loading to leave this hotel delivers outstanding service and hospitality. We asked for a high room and had the top floor, what a view. The staff added to the joy of our Chicago experience. Excellent! 5 star in my book!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Kimpton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: beaker_321
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location with a great staff and great amenities. The only negative was that the view was not particularly special because the nearby buildings blocked the view of more prominent buildings and sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: scionchigirl
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of staying at Hotel Palomar for my birthday, as we went into the city as a family to enjoy the Magnificent Mile Lights Festival. Booked a queen/queen room and went to check in at 2:30. The hotel was VERY busy, packed with familes who had the same idea! The service at the front desk was swift and friendly. The person checking me in saw on my ID that it was my birthday and wished me a happy birthday. She also gave my son a card for a free in-room movie, which was nice. Although we did not have a good view from our room (unless you like the side of a building as your view), the room was large, spotless and nicely decorated. I've stayed at other Kimpton hotels before and I LOVE Hotel Monacco, and I do have to say that Hotel Palomar is not as "chic/boutique-y" as that one, but it was nice. My daughter and I were exiting the room to check out the view from the rooftop patio when a housekeeper came and said "I was told to bring robes" and he had a big pile of animal-print robes, as well as a fish in the cute little fish bowl. The view is nice from the deck, and the pool is small but sharp...I am sure it is awesome up there in the summer! We had fun at the parade and came back to the hotel, where they had warm cookies and hot cocoa in the lobby. I know they have a wine hour with flatbreads, but we missed that. We went up to our room and discovered that Bobby, the concierge, had left a bottle of wine, a card and a tray of treats for my birthday, which included chocolate-covered espresso beans, my very favorite. Nice! The beds were super-comfortable, lots of pillows and goose down. In the morning, they had good coffee and more hot cocoa and tea in the lobby. Though the hotel was packed, I can tell you that it is SILENT. Tons of kids, but I could not hear them. My own two enjoyed swimming with a view of the skyline. Hotel Palomar's staff is super-friendly and professional and I just like the small nice-nice things they do at Kimpton hotels, but I have to say I really like the "meditation stations" at Hotel Monocco, though the Palomar is just steps off Michigan Avenue. The whole operations strikes me as a place where there is a motivated staff that likes their jobs and wants to please their guests. The lobby is sort of small, as you'd expect in a boutique hotel, but it is stylish and they have cute things like bowls of old-school candy with cute quotes on them. A very, very good stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend in Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: pkmills
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoy visiting Chicago, and we usually try different hotels in Near North area. I saw the reviews on the Palomar and decided to try it. We were not disappointed. From the checkin to dinner at Sable to leaving on Sunday, it was a great experience. The location was great and we were able to walk to many restaurants and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: toularuby
Reviews.Content: Hotel Palomar far exceeded my expectations. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Blu the doorman couldn't have been nicer to my 11 year old son.Our room was very nice. It was on the 17th floor next to the beautiful indoor pool, workout room and outdoor deck that had an incredible few. Location could not have been better. Close to Joe's Stone Crab, Eats and Michigan Ave. Price was good and was able to get great deal through outside hotel internet site. Love Chicago and will stay at Hotel Palomar anytime I go back

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zuggor
Reviews.Content: Wow, just wow, it is a very chic and splendid hotel really close to everything around Chicago. We spent 4 days in Chicago and this hotel was superb, the staff, the cleanliness and style is great. Close to restaurants and other attractions also, lot's of choices in bars and food and entertainment. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb personalized service & amenities from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: nonsense100
Reviews.Content: This is a truly special hotel. From check-in to check-out, we were treated with personalized, professional, & friendly service from each and every hotel staff member. We checked in during the evening wine reception. After a day of traveling, taking a few glasses of wine up to the room and unwinding/relaxing was perfect. We were treated to a generous room upgrade and a complimentary bottle of champagne from the concierge to congratulate us in celebrating our special occasion. The room was extremely well-appointed with floor-to-wall ceilings and beautiful view of downtown Chicago. A soak in the huge Fuji soaking tub for two was a wonderful treat. It's a new hotel, so everything was sparkling clean and new. As InTouch members, we enjoyed free internet access and a free mini bar credit. Room service was very promptly delivered with excellent food. Hotel is centrally located, within a short walk to excellent shopping along Michigan Ave. Can't say enough great things about the hotel and service.

Reviews.Title: “nothing too special”
Reviews.Author: hehdu
Reviews.Content: Hmm - this one I don't really get. #2 in Chicago? Boutique hotel? I stayed in the Palomar for 6 nights in October and had a one bedroom suite ($429/night - not quite cheap, right?) and based on the reviews and its website I'd expected something better. Wherever I looked this hotel was just ordinary, nothing special at all. I could not tell the difference between my room and a typical Hilton, Sheraton or the like. Not that anything was bad, but it was simply quite boring. If I had to choose again for a boutique hotel, I would pick the W chain. After the stay and a $3000 bill I felt somewhat cheated and I doubt I will return again.

Reviews.Title: “What Every Hotel Should Aspire to Be”
Reviews.Author: ElQuesoGrande
Reviews.Content: The WOW factor in this hotel is beyond compare. From friendliness and civility to location and performance, this hotel is beyond peer. Did I say this is one of the finest hotels I have stayed in? Anywhere! A shout-out and kudos to Ashlee who arranged a magnificent stay for us. Jessica filled our room with goodies and poetry, including a paean to our pet pug, Sophie-Rose, whom we had to leave at home in California. Gad, Jo-Anne, and Nabeel had conversations with us about the best places in Chicago and about their own personal travels. This is truly what a hotel and a hotel company should be. It absolutely blew us away. I cannot say enough about our stay here. Anyone contemplating a stay in Chicago would do well to stay at the Palomar, one of the all-time great city hotels in the world. And that is not hyperbole. Having been all over the world, we can be a bit jaded, but nothing prepared us for the brilliance of our stay at the Palomar. Wow, wow, and double Wow!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotwire Find”
Reviews.Author: roupl
Reviews.Content: My stay at Hotel Palomar has exceeded my expectations. Being a college student, I have to travel on a budget. This is the second time I have used Hotwire to book a room in Chicago. The first time, I was not impressed. Quality was considerably compromised. Such was not the case at Hotel Palomar. My bus from Minnesota arrived to Chicago at 6:30AM. I went to the hotel to request that they accommodate my luggage until check in. To my surprise, the more than friendly attendant allowed me to check in. Having been on a bus over night, a shower and a nap upon my arrival was more than appreciated. The room decor is interesting, the lighting is interactive and ambient, cleanliness was impeccable, beds are comfortable, not once did I have to adjust the temperature. Best of all, they offer free wi-fi if you sign up as a Kimpton Guest! In addition to that the hotel is in close proximity to Michigan Ave. and just a block away from the red line. Overall, my stay at Hotel Palomar was pleasant and I was given no reason to complain. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Labor Day Oasis”
Reviews.Author: proudbrunette
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this stylish hotel in downtown over Labor Day weekend with friends. Despite the busy area and influx of tourists, our room was quiet and comfortable. The hotel staff was very kind, especially when I needed some assistance after my wallet had been stolen at a nearby bar :( They were more than willing to let me use their computer at the front desk to file a police report and print out a needed document. Unfortunately there are all kinds of tourist-trap restaurants nearby, but that's no fault of the hotel's. Also, the bathroom doesn't feel completely private when sharing a room with 3 other people, but the sliding door sure looks nice! Extra points for the lobby happy hour where we got to sample a drink before heading out for the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great Style & Location”
Reviews.Author: evil2win
Reviews.Content: Decent room, very helpful staff and great location. Wine hour is a great social gathering of guests and the appetizers from the in-house restaurant were a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, Modern, Vibrant, worth the Price”
Reviews.Author: westcoastcook
Reviews.Content: The modern, vibrant vibe, the spacious beautifully appointed rooms and the helpful friendly staff make the place worth the high price. The decor, ambience and location make it memorable. Concierge Bobby Gonzalez was a whiz at arranging numerous reservations. The on-site restaurant Sable, gets high marks. A perfect base for a long weekend in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel, Great Facilities, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: scottkamler
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Chicago for a convention. I liked the River North area, so this hotel is great. When we checked in Jessica was incredibly warm and friendly and walked me through all the facilities. The room is nice, but nothing too special. They have a great swimming pool in which you can actually see the sun rise since you are high enough. The gym was small and crowded. There is a concierge Bobby who took care of some small requests, but when I gave him direction for a restaurant he sent me to a new place that was EXACTLY what I was asking for...I'm happy he didn't send me to a tourist spot. Jessica also made sure that I ate at Nat Mulnati's which is walking distance. Just an incredible experience and would recommend this hotel to any kind of traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek, modern & quiet”
Reviews.Author: MaryAnn0702
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. Stylish look, professional staff, quiet rooms, excellent location close to Michigan Ave. My only beef is that they do not offer hot water in the rooms for tea & coffee--it is available mornings only in the lobby. No breakfast unless you pay to eat at the restaurant. I took the CTA to get there from O'Hare & it was OK, though a long trip (about an hour). We had a great view from our 11th floor room.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: french0
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Hotel Palomar whose decor is modern elegance. Because the room was not quite ready, we were invited into ther bar/lounge for cocktails of our choice. Within a few minutes the room was ready. The furnishings, design, cleanliness and linens over the top. A bottle of champagne, fresh strawberries with a chocolate dipping sauce awaited us, gratis. There is a fabulous 17th floor terrace with great views and lots of cushioned seating to enjoy your own byob drinks along with a indoor lap pool and gym. Each evening 5-6pm, there is wine tasting and yummy flatbreads. The staff are courteous, warm and friendly. We highly recommend the Hotel Palomar.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place”
Reviews.Author: orimarc
Reviews.Content: Nice room, beautiful hotel. You have every thing at walking distance. We chose Hotel Palomar cause we liked a lot the once thay have in DC. The only thing we did not like is the shower. It should be bigger.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: LongIslandRuss
Reviews.Content: Great Location, cool atmosphere, excellent staff......what more can I say. Can't wait to check out Kimpton properties in other locations. Love the lounge area, very comfortable. Even an umbrella when it rains.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home in big city”
Reviews.Author: foodiewinee
Reviews.Content: We were planning to visit Chicago on pleasure trip and looked at Kimpton Hotels - found Hotel Palomar. I also joined the Kimpton Hotel membership for free internet while staying there... Enjoyed wine reception with appetizers each evening, nice room, beautiful hotel, close to subway system, walking distance to shopping and museums! loved it! Even hotel restaurant was good, as well as great restaurants nearby!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant!”
Reviews.Author: dsm22203
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently to Chicago and have my usual hotels that I frequent. I thought I would try the Hotel Palomar and I don't regret the decision in the least. The location off of Michigan Avenue is in the heart of it all with quick access to mass transit. The property is gorgeous and the rooms are surprisingly spacious for a boutique property. Furnishings were modern, clean, and created an environment of elegance of luxury. Hotel staff graciously accommodated my early check-in. Unlike other properties, the Hotel Palomar (and perhaps all Kimpton properties) provide complimentary internet with registration in their frequent guest program. This is an important amenity for me that I truly appreciate. The Etro bath products were sensational...what a joy! I will certainly return to the Hotel Palomar in the future and I hope to have time to check out the bar and the pool (too busy with work on this trip).

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, and service was helpful with checkout”
Reviews.Author: MDC-BIZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed here back in August for a business trip I was attending at the hotel. Rooms were spacious, and clean. Location is perfect for getting around the city too. Hotel service and politeness shined through when I had an unexpected business meeting the next morning, but the hotel graciously awarded me a few extra hours to check out before needing to head to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Staff made us feel valued and special”
Reviews.Author: Robin K
Reviews.Content: Three old friends stayed here in September for three nights for a past due celebration of our 50th b'days. Everyone from the concierges at the front desk to the doormen made us feel welcome and cared for. A bottle of wine was waiting for us upon arrival and one evening when we missed wine hour in the lobby, a bottle of wine was sent to our room. The concierges booked tickets for us at Second City, had great restaurant recommendations. Every time we went out or returned from adventures the staff inquired about our day and showed genuine interest. Hotel is in a great location. Can walk or cab everywhere. Bar is fantastic-- great vibe, great food and unique offbeat cocktail listing. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CaterinaDue
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights and were really pleased with our choice of hotel in Chicago! Our check in was so warm and friendly that we instantly felt welcome! Our king deluxe room was clean, comfortable and stylishly decorated. Our room was on the same floor as the gym and we did hear loud thumps a few times as an inconsiderate muscle man dropped his weights during his work out. I wouldn't want to be staying right next door or underneath the gym. The daily drinks in the evening were really nice and again the staff were super friendly and guests seemed relaxed and were happily mingling with each other. We had breakfast in the hotel twice and dinner in the bar once. Breakfast one morning was really good (and a great cappucino!) but the other morning the white of my soft boiled egg was still runny and after sending it back, I received a warm but hard boiled egg instead! The bar food was good! My husband completed a survey after our visit and we received a nice email from the Chef, Heather Terhune thanking us for our feeback. We joined the Kimpton In Touch program which is free and meant we got free wi fi access in our room. The hotel is just near a subway station and we used the train to go everywhere which was very convenient! I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: toddman22
Reviews.Content: Was very pleased with the Palomar. Good location, very clean hotel with art throughout. The rooms are spacious and very clean. The pool deck is great with heated pool and nice sun deck to hang out and have a drink. The bar is terrific and the food is great as well. Also the complementary wine tasting is a nice touch. Service was also flawless. I would choose the Palomar over most hotels in downtown Chicago without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Location, service & value!”
Reviews.Author: LeAnn002
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hotel Palomar based on Trip Advisor reviews and it was a great choice. The package included a $50/day credit for the restaurant which we used for breakfast and cocktails in the hotel bar. The rooms were clean and a good size. The staff were always friendly, especially during the evening wine hour. The location next to the train stop and the Mag Mile was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: robiemarie84
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our visit to Chicago to celebrate our one year wedding anniversary. When we checked in, I mentioned that it was our anniversary. The next night the hotel had a bottle of champagne waiting for us, along with a note of congratulations! The in-room dining was amazingly good. Definitely get the stuffed french toast for breakfast if you have a sweet tooth! The room decor is very chic, and the bath robes are super cute and a welcomed change from the usual white robes at other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jgillingham
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband, two kids and dog. Could not have been more impressed with the service. Staff were very helpful with giving directions and one day when we were out they heard my dog barking and brought her downstairs so they could keep an eye on her. We loved the cool, funky atmosphere of the public spaces and the rooms were wonderful.....loved robes. Each day we enjoyed the wine social......nice touch by Kimpton Hotels. Our favourite thing about the hotel was the roof top patio......my husband and I would go up there every night to enjoy a glass of wine and the beautiful views. Can't wait to go back and we will stay at this hotel again, no doubt. We staryed here in July 2010 not July 2011 but Trip Advisor does not give the option to write reviews for hotels that you stay in past one year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisSusie55
Reviews.Content: We stayed the Hotel Palomar for the first time in late August in celebration of our wedding anniversary. Had a beautiful room with an upgrade to a one bedroom suite; the staff was wonderful; the room was spotless, gorgeous and the spa tub was just the ticket for relaxing after a long day of walking and touring. We had a great time wandering the city; the hotel is in a great location for getting out and about; had room service for breakfast one morning and it was prompt, hot and delicious. We were treated to a lovely bottle of white wine for our anniversary celebration! We will definitely stay there again... hopefully sometime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Where everyone knows your name!”
Reviews.Author: Brittjc514
Reviews.Content: Best customer service out there! The concierge remembered us calling and changing the reservation and when the computer didn't put it through, he remembered our name and fixed the issue without us having to find out! Very friendly--you are not just another person!

Reviews.Title: “2nd trip to the hotel”
Reviews.Author: jennmattnphanty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the 2nd time in August of this year. While we love the location, service was not as great this time as far as our free gift from mentioning the secret word and it being our anniversary. We requested early check in and while I know they never can promise it, we still had to wait on a room. It was not ready still at the usual check in time so they put us in a different room. When I asked if it was still a corner room the lady at the desk said yes however we got up there and it was not. We would rather they just be honest, leaves a bad taste in your mouth when you get the run around several times, it was almost like they did not know what to say. If you are looking for a great steak dinner Ruths Chris is the place to go, the steak melts in your mouth! Regardless, the hotel itself and the location is great so we will be returning next year for another game.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: ADSNotreDame_IN
Reviews.Content: I met my 2 college age daughters in Chicago for a 3 day "Girl Whirl" as they were returning from summer spent out of the USA and headed back to college. We wanted to splurge and have fun and comfort. We got all of this and more at the Palomar. Specific things we appreciated? The service is outstanding from start to finish. We worked with the manager to get a good room configuration and were delighted with our 2 adjoining rooms. The people at the front desk and the door (especially Bleu) were welcoming and helpful. The rooms are beautiful, well appointed, clean and QUIET. The beds are luxurious (meant to look up the thread count..) Little things add up to make this our favorite hotel. For example, the fitness area is 3 cuts above the usual cave with obsolete equipment, rather it is on the top floor with a wall of windows and apples for the eating. The rooms have plush terry bathrobes in the closet that you can use without the pesky fee most hotels charge. The wine tasting is a lot of fun and they actually give you more than 2 sips. The location could not be better. Walking distance to fantastic restaurants (about which the staff is very knowledgable), metro stop, Nordstroms. Could not ask for anything more.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: anne g
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this hotel! From the pre-check in help provided by the concierge Ashlee, to the special accommodations for my early check-in request, the friendly front desk staff, the perfectly appointed room with fabulous view and very comfortable bed, down to the complementary umbrella provided as I walked out the door...every attention to detail exceeded my expectation. I have always been a Kimpton fan, but I am truly sold on the Hotel Palomar Chicago. I also liked the location...walked everywhere comfortably....and especially enjoyed POPs (champagne bar one block away) and Vermilion (fusion indian) around the corner. The restaurant Sable in the hotel was great for breakfast with very friendly and attentive staff as well.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for the memories”
Reviews.Author: gfkr2
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at the chic Palomar recently with my beloved for a romantic rendezvous.. Overall, it was a very good experience. The room was fab, tastefully decorated and spotlessly clean upon arrival. The check in was a breeze too and the front desk staff friendly and cheerful after our long day of travel. The bed was oh so comfy and we were eager to give it a try...We had a great time at the bar and restaurant, Sable, that was packed and staffed by expert bartenders. The only downer was housekeeping who knocked on our door as 8:00 am the next morning clearly ignoring the "dreaming" tag posted on the door knob. Not sure why she would be knocking on the day of check out so early anyhow. The managers wine reception was fun. The Palomar's locations is top notch and the local neighborhood safe into the evening. We look forward to our next visit, but this time for more than a quick getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: stangina
Reviews.Content: The Kimpton chain seems to be getting better and better. Very comfortable room, close to elevator, but did not hear at all. Curtains really block out the light in the daytime. Free internet with Kimpton membership + $10 free from the minibar. Front desk very helpful in getting my Boarding Pass printed. Add to that the great restaurant on the premises, which helped in the heavy rain when I arrived, and you cannot get much better. I should not forget the wine at 5 pm, which came with a very nice light pizza.

Reviews.Title: “All great except one...”
Reviews.Author: mvolarte
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a week for a conference at a different hotel. I was in a rush before my trip so I didn't plan on whether I should take a cab or the train from the airport. The adventurous in me won and so I took the "L". Called the front desk for directions, they were very helpful. One of them actually got outside to meet me close to the Red Line stop just across the street. I was actually impressed with their service. The lobby was very chic but I must admit I was a little disappointed with my room. I was on the 7th floor with I think a publishing company just across the street so I was not able to keep my blinds fully open most of the time. They probably cannot see me there but I was not comfortable just the same. I joined to become a member of the Kimpton rewards program to get free wi-fi and the connection was always smooth. When I had a couple of hours to enjoy the city, the staff was again very helpful. He warned me that 2 hours is not enough to explore Chicago. He was right. :) Everyone in the staff was very friendly and very pleasant. They also held wine tasting receptions in the evening and free coffee and tea in the mornings but I was not able to join in any so I cannot comment on that. My only beef was the overnight dry-cleaning service that I requested. I arrived late night Monday morning so my only option was the overnight service, with the 50% surplus. They were supposed to be delivered the next morning before 9am. I left the hotel at around 8 am to wander around the city and came back around 10:30 am. When I got back, my suits weren't there yet. Called the front desk. The person on the other line said that they should have been in my room before 9 am, even if I was not there. At checkout, the bill was not ready. They still charged me the whole amount plus the service charge for the overnight service.When I said that they were not delivered when they should be, they offered that I talked to the manager. For a 4-star hotel, I expected that they would have noted this discrepancy already and should have adjusted accordingly. They said they did not want to disturb in the morning but come on, I chose the service for my clothes to be delivered before 9 am and I expect them to be there not after I called for them after 10:30 am.
