I do not have a do not disturb sign on my door and housekeeping did ring my bell twice when it was close to check-out on Friday. What's with that then? Bottom line, if you want a chic hotel where you want to be pampered, from what I have read from other guests, I guess this is the place to stay. For me, I'm still thinking whether I'd want to come back. Everyone deserves a second chance I guess and as I said, except for that one instance with the dry-cleaning, it was all great...

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Palomar”
Reviews.Author: ScamperF
Reviews.Content: We found an incredible deal on Sneakaway for the Palomar and booked a suite for my husband, myself and our 2 young kids. It was such a great experience. The pool was great, clean and easy to get to. We loved the daily wine (and lemonade for our kids) reception. The front desk was extremely helpful and pleasant. The room was huge (700+sq feet) and perfect for our family. Very clean and neat. The bathroom had an amazing shower and tub that was huge! The hotel was centrally located. We rarely heard anything in the hallway or noise on the street. The restaurant in the hotel was good for a unique breakfast but very expensive (as great hotel restaurants usually are). My only issue is that sometimes when i stay at a hotel i might wake up with a sore throat due to the detergent and bleach on the linens. For the entire week at the Palomar I woke up with a headache every day. Overall we would highly recommend this hotel and would seek out Palomar hotels in other cities.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Wynn J
Reviews.Content: We went for our wedding anniversary and had a wonderful time. They went out of their way to make us feel special, but wern't too intrusive. I would recommend this hotel for couples or families. Something for everyone. I must stay in Chicago. OH, and the neighborhood is filled with wonderful places to eat!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: GlenEllynMom
Reviews.Content: I met an out of town friend and we had a fabulous girls catch up week-end shopping. This location was Fabulous! You can walk around the corner to Nordstrom! And when you come back from shopping at 5 you relax with a glass of wine! Then you walk a block down to Hubbard for restaurants and clubs. We thought the service was Fabulous too! The doorman rushed up after he saw that the valet was not coming to take care of the car. When we came out and it was raining he offered advice that we had an umbrella in the room or could get one from the front desk. The concierge was very helpful when we asked about clubs. The front desk helped when we needed scissors to cut off tags. We wanted to check out the pool after it was closed and someone unlocked it so we could look around. Everyone we talked to had a great attitude. The art on each floor is fantastic! You could wander around and feel like you were in an art museum. The decor in the lobby and restaurant from the semi drapes to the silverware and little pepper grinder was very cool. Although we thought they could have made the lobby seating area a little bigger and made the checkin desk smaller and moved it down further. The beds were very comfy and the animal print robes were very cool (they was even slipper socks if were colder). The bathroom doesn't compare to the Penninsula, but the moving wall door is very neat. Someone mentioned smelling food and we did smell bacon both mornings and we were on the 14th floor ?? We thought that was odd, but it got us to eat breakfast in the hotel restaurant (and we both ordered the omelet with bacon).

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem off Michigan”
Reviews.Author: Reginald666
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Palomar, through Hotwire after I could not get a reasonable rate at the conference hotel where I was attending a meeting. The Palomar was a great surprise. A smaller, newer building means fast elevators and quiet heating a cooling, something you donâ€™t find at a lot of older Chicago hotels. The staff was quick, courteous and knowledgeable. Rooms were slightly larger than average, with nice towels and linens, and fairly clean. Floor to ceiling windows give a decent view of Chicago. The hotel is designed for the younger crowd (OK, not me) with cool robes and a staff dressed for fun. A short walk to Michigan Avenue and the Hubbard bar district are also nice for those inclined. Room service was fast, and food was pretty good. The fitness facility was large and had a decent variety of aerobic and weight machines. A good choice in Chicago for business or pleasure

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel, great location. Lives up to the Kimpton brand.”
Reviews.Author: John_and_Seth
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many Kimpton hotels, mostly in California and Texas. The Palomar Chicago is one of their best. We stayed there the month the hotel opened so it was still brand new. We had a great corner with lots of floor to ceiling windows. As with all Kimpton hotels, the property was very stylish. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone: business travelers, couples weekend, shopping trip, etc. And as with all Kimpton hotels, it's pet-friendly. My dog enjoyed his stay as much as we did!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but converted apartment block with existing tenants, ripoff valet parking and concierge keen to get kickbacks”
Reviews.Author: bettiblu
Reviews.Content: Hotel Palomar has a good downtown location. It is a funny hotel, being one of those converted apartment blocks that still has some existing tenants. We had city view room on the top floor which was nicely styled and looked very new, with comfortable beds, nice flat screen tv, neat but small bathroom (poor shower in bath though). We could smell cooking smells in our room which was a bit strange as restaurant too far below to be the cause - assume it was one of the apartments in the building that are alongside hotel rooms. The pool looks good but is 3' 6" deep throughout so you can't really swim. Nice rooftop terrace adjoining the pool and the fitness room is good. Hardly any staff here and this area seems to be self service. The hotel lacks atmosphere which it might get from a good bar - the ground floor area is more of a lounge with no bar and the restaurant is tucked away at the back of the ground floor. Staff were helpful BUT when asked to recommend restaurants there was a really uncool emphasis on giving us a token for a pizza place that had our name on it and would give us a free bruschetta but for which we had to wait for the desk staff to add their name to the token - to get their kickback we assume. In fairness, it was one of the three main deep pan pizza places in the books but this coupled with their lack of knowledge of cool / new / interesting places put us off (one steak house next door being all they could think of in spite of an amazing Italian a block away - Osteria via Stato). The final annoyance was that the valet parking was not clearly priced and was a rip off - it said 24 hours for $49. What they don't mention is that if you arrive at 6pm and leave 2 days later at 4pm you get charged for three days. When we checked out at 12 they charged us for 2 days and only mentioned this extra charge when we came back for the car insisting that if it was after 2 we would have to pay another $20 minimum. Apparently it's standard practice in Chicago - valet guys said hotel governed prices, hotel said valet company did. We didn't care who set the prices but nobody made this clear to us at the start so it was a ripoff tactic. Either way, $112 for 48 hours parking is over the odds in Chicago. All in all, nice rooms but not a proper hotel and some very dodgy practices going on here - wonder if Kimpton support this kind of thing at their other hotels?

Reviews.Title: “First chicago trip”
Reviews.Author: yayatraveldiva
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying in this hotel. We did a ten mile hike around the city to go to all of the touristy sites and the hotel is the perfect location. The staff was friendly as well.

Reviews.Title: “ItÂ´s Ok”
Reviews.Author: jimena_mv
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at Hotel Palomar for one week. In general it is a great hotel their accommodations are well appointed, the lobby/living room are really confortable and beautiful. The restaurant is fine and the fitness room has all the equipment that you might need to exercise. The staff in general is nice and helpful. But not everything is great at Palomar. It has some downsides. The first down side was that upon our arrival no body helped us with our luggage. My husband and I had to carry our bags from the cab to our room because nobody offered us any kind of help. In fact the person in charge of the valet parking was really rude to my husband, when he approach to him to ask him for help he just didnâ€™t bother to answer. One of the door mans (usually there were two of them) was helping other guests to put their luggage in a taxi and ones he finished he never offered to help us with ours. The check-in process was really quick. And the people in the reception were really nice. We are from Mexico and one of the guys at the front desk always spoke to us in Spanish. Our room was a King spa premier room. And I must say that I strongly recommend this room. We previously stayed in the Hotel Palomar at San Francisco and stayed in a King deluxe room which is a little small. But this room the spa premier has the perfect size. The sitting room is really confortable and spacious, and the bath is perfect. The other down side is that it is really crowded for a boutique hotel. And as a boutique hotel we expected to be a little more exclusive. One our first day we went up to see the pool and the terrace and there was a group of 8 guys that were having beers in the terrace as if they were spring breakers in a cheap hotel. The whole scene was tacky. And honestly that is not what you want to see when you are staying in a $300 dls night hotel. As for the restaurant we only had breakfast in both the restaurant facilities and in our room. It was fine and maybe I would had said it was great but unfortunately on our last day the room service toke more than 30 min and ones our order was delivered in our room I realized they had my order all wrong, and when I called the room service phone line the lady at the phone was really rude and nothing helpful, she told me that if I wanted my correct order I would have to wait for another 20 min. It was ridicules if you take into account that my order was only yogurt with berries. And it was their mistake. In general I will have to say that the Palomar is Ok, their location is great, and the room that we stayed on was really comfortable. The staff is almost always willing to help, but as I said they can work a little bit more in this area. And it has some amenities that gives the hotel some points for example the complementary wine hour from 5 to 6 pm. Although itÂ´s not great wine itÂ´s ok.

Reviews.Title: “Bachlorette Weekend in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: PeggyPhenixRichard
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous weekend we had in the beautiful city of Chicago. Thirteen of us stayed at the wonderful Hotel Palomar and it was delux accommodations! Our rooms were elegant, the beds plush and comfortable and the staff extremely friendly and accommodating! I would recommend this property to anyone. As event director for the Dearborn Chamber, we get calls all the time from curious travelers. Thank you again for a perfect experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great staff, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Anderida
Reviews.Content: It was our second stay this year and we really can't fault this hotel - all the positive reviews below are spot on! It is posh but very friendly and relaxed. The staff simply can't do enough for you and are a huge credit to the Kimpton organisation! The location is ideal - walking distance to all the main downtown locations from shopping, eating, the water, museums and parks. Despite its central location on both visits we found our room to be pretty quiet and I hate noisy rooms! The beds are really comfy and the rooms are a good size and very nicely decorated. There are now at least two other great reasons (if you need them) to visit....only opened about a week ago is a wonderful Mexican restaurant - Cantina Laredo - directly opposite. We ate there twice and the food and ambiance were perfect and prices pretty reasonable too.....and for jazz and blues nerds, again just across the road is a wonderful "old fashioned" (in a good way) record store - Jazz Record Mart! (Famous venue Blues is also very close and Buddy Guy's famous Legends is only 10/15 mins on foot. Great hotel. Great city. Why wouldn't we come back!?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all around”
Reviews.Author: Esquimalt
Reviews.Content: Booked four nights (Thu to Sun incl) through Snique-Away special - city view king deluxe. First time visit to Chicago. We relied on TripAdvisor reviews and previous experience with Kimpton brand when choosing the Palomar. The corner city view room was a decent size, well appointed and very clean. Although it faced onto an intersection, it was quiet. The service was top notch - all staff that we encountered were knowledable and freindly. The manager's reception from 5:00 to 6:00 was a nice treat and was well-attended. WiFi was free of charge for members of the Kimpton loyalty porgram. We had breakfast in the hotel's "Sable" restaurant each morning and were pleased with the quality, selection and service. We wanted to have dinner at Sable on the Friday night before going to a club but, because we didn't make reservations, were unable to do. We ordered from room service which was quick and the food was great. On the basis of our breakfasts and room srevice, we would recommend Sable - make a reservation for dinner on a weekend. The gym was well equipped for cardio and resistance exercise and the pool appeared to be well maintained. A newly built hotel. Excellent all around.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay that I have had!”
Reviews.Author: stephanie p
Reviews.Content: I travel for a living, and stay in tons of hotels... This is the tops. Beautiful rooms, beautiful lobby. Attentive staff... Awesome location. My room was silent and dark for sleeping... Love it here.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Travel2Explore
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palomar Chicago for one night during a business trip to Chicago. Fantastic find! Staff was excellent - very polite and welcoming. Complimentary wine between 5:00 and 6:00. Rooms were very well done - large and well laid out. Nice corner desk overlooking one of the windows. Bed & bedding were extremely comfortable. Very quiet - didn't hear noise from the hall or the other rooms around. Bathroom was very clean - shower in the bathroom was quite high - perfect for tall men like my husband who normally feel cramped in most hotel showers. Highly recommended! I would definitely stay here again if I go back to Chicago. One hint - sign up for the Kimpton preferred customer account - very easy to do and the wireless is free during your stays ($10/day savings.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cinnamongrl9999
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our two teenaged boys for 3 nights. We found the rooms to be spacious and well-appointed for a boutique style hotel. Our King suite had a huge bathroom with large deep tub and great toiletries. Comfy beds. Easy walking distance to many attractions and areas. Steps from the Chicago Theatre, easy walk to Magnificent Mile, close to Navy Pier. Several deep-dish pizza options within a couple of blocks! Would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “But watch it if you don t like dogs !”
Reviews.Author: Snoppy07
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a Kimpton Hotel. Trendy but friendly. We stayed there for 3 nights and I must say I was very happy with the size of the room we stayed in, the location, the restaurant (ok we had only breakfast there but it was all right), the friendliness of the reception staff and how clean our room was. Like I mentioned in the title this is a pet friendly hotel and this may cause some problems. My friend is not a doggie "oh how cute it is" type of guy so when he took the lift and he had two quite huge dogs facing him when the door opens, he did not feel exactly very, how can I say, very comfortable that is !

Reviews.Title: “Unique, elegant and pristine”
Reviews.Author: steph21480
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Palomar may just now be my favorite place to stay in Chicago. In all fairness, it is only a year old, so it definitely still has a 'new' feel and it's very modern and sleek. However, as with most Kimpton hotels, they are consistently excellent when it comes to customer service and nice perks (free wireless if you're an InTouch member, which is free to become). It feels very high-end without feeling stuffy, which is exactly what I love in a hotel. Every employee with whom we interacted was overly helpful and friendly - even remembering us every time we walked by and making comments to my husband about his birthday or comparing the weather in Chicago to our native DC. The room service was FAR better than your average hotel - while the prices are just as outrageous as any room service at a high-end hotel, the food actually tastes worth it, which is a nice change. We stayed in a one-bedroom suite, which was quite spacious, with a fantastic bathroom with a separate shower and two-person deep jacuzzi tub, a living room and a separate bedroom in the back. Perfect. Not sure how it compares to a regular room, but the suite was absolutely great. Every time we hung the "restore" sign on our room and left for a while, the room had always been cleaned when we got back, even if we weren't gone very long. The hotel staff seems to work very efficiently. I really can't think of anything to complain about! It isn't cheap by any stretch of the imagination, but neither are any other high-end Chicago hotels, so I can't really hold that against them either. This was a fantastic experience and we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, almost got it”
Reviews.Author: mddoc151
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 3 nights at the Hotel Palomar with my family. A newer hotel located in Chicago's River North area, it is very convenient to local attractions (Navy Pier) and shopping. As always, there is an abundance of construction happening in Chicago and road work was on going right in front of the hotel's small valet entrance. Once that was navigated, we were met promptly by hotel staff. The lobby was modern and appropriate for a hotel of this size. It wasn't overly busy and the staff greeted my young children with gift bags (beach ball, yo-yo, coloring books and more). It made them feel special. I had reserved are larger suite (1& 1/2 baths) and it was modern, clean and comfortable. We tried Sable for dinner. Different than other major brand hotel restaurants. They had curry, lamb-burger, and extremely large children's portions (for smaller children, order one and split it-you'll likely still have leftovers!) We also had 2 enjoyable breakfasts there during our stay. Unfortunately, I was unable to attend the nightly wine tasting ; but heard good things from the other guest. The pool is really the size of an average therapy pool and is 3 feet 6 inches throughout. Located on the 17th floor with a nice patio. Well appointed fitness room as well. Areas that were less than perfect; staff to guest ratio (had to wait for room service to call us back because no one available to take our order), loud apartment tenant(above) or hot water system noises at 530 to 630 every morning (sounded like someone trying to break in one morning), and guests smoking immediately outside the front lobby. Overall an excellent hotel that we will likely stay at in the future

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the price, great location!”
Reviews.Author: anonymousny24
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Palomar in Chicago and was well worth it once again. From the email I received online the day before check-in asking if we needed anything, to the day we checked out, they take care of their guests. I'd also recommend to sign up for a Kimpton Stay In Touch account. Its their rewards program, but much more. It allows Kimpton to get to know you and your likes when it comes to your hotel stays....a little extra you won't get elsewhere. No, I don't work for the hotel, but I travel a lot and have had a lot of different hotel experiences. All positive here. Very clean, they are on their A game. Room service was quick, expensive like anyone else, but quality food and presentation. Rooftop pool was great, could be larger, but they're working wtih limited space so they made great use of it....with an outside deck/lounge also. You can't go wrong with free coffee in the mornings and free wine for an hour in the evenings. They set this up right in the lobby/lounge area. Location was great. Its just off the main strip of N Michigan Ave where the world of shopping is. Great restaurants, bars, and sandwich shops all within just a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: washdcer
Reviews.Content: Relaxed and comfortable, with the amenities you want, this hotel shines. My room/bath/closet were large and spotlessly clean. Everyone on the hotel staff is friendly and helpful. I can highly recommend a Concierge named Mark; he was knowledgeable and kind.

Reviews.Title: “off to chicago for the second time....will be back again next year.”
Reviews.Author: Nancy0509
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Palomar was in a great location and the rooms were a great size as well. The only concern was that there was construction across the street and getting a taxi was a bit disasterous because they didn't want to come close to the hotel because of the difficulty. We were not warned about the construction when we booked the hotel and it would have been fair to warn us, I believe. My husband was on business, I wasn't. I went along for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “I'm a fan!”
Reviews.Author: KLSinNYC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business function and had selected the Palomar for it's location. I've stayed in these hotels in Dallas and San Francisco, and have always been pleased with the rooms and the service. Modern, comfortable, plenty of amenities in the bathroom, always a plus. The service is friendly without seeming overdone. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “First Class service. Great Wines and in-House Bar. Great Location.Have your Speedo ready!”
Reviews.Author: Teenom
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located close to a red line station in Downtown Chicago (GRAND Staton). Although i didn't spend too much time in the hotel premises due to day long meetings I'm glad i had the chance of tryng out the hotel while still fresh. The opening wasn't too long ago. The check in staff was very friendly.Theres free Wifi for "Kimpton InTouch members"-Membership is free. The rooms and baths are spacious for those who care. Breakfast will cost you in this hotel but there are so many options just out the door. There a wine tasting hour every evening in the lounge next to the lobby ..for free(nice place to unwind after a hard day's work). There' also an in House Bar if you really worked hard:.-). Bring your speedo/bikini too if its that time of there year--theres also a swimming pool. Unfortunately i didnt try breakfast..Also take advantage of the free paper if you're interested for

Reviews.Title: “Another fantastic Hotel by Kimpton, can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Bstyln
Reviews.Content: My 1st time in Chicago and being a huge an of Kimpton Properties I thought I would try the Palomar in Chicago. The location was perfect for walking around and exploring. The staff was polite, helpful and made sure all our needs were met. The rooms were super clean, the pool was nice n cool which was perfect as it was very hot out while exploring the area. Beautiful views of the city from the patio deck outside the pool area. I am looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kellycm2
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a corporate rate over a weekend in September. The location is really good with a Red line stop right out front. The dining options withing walking distance are endless. We did not use many of the amenities but the pool did seem quite nice. A couple of complaints. The bed was really hard and the feather pillows were pretty much worthless. We were in a king city view room which was on the 16th floor corner which was nice, but the bathroom was rediculously small. If you can get a good rate, it's a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WIDiane
Reviews.Content: We stayted here for the second night of our anniversary in chicago. Our first night was at our favorite hotel, Hotel Monaco. We could not get a Sat. reservation at Hotel Monaco so we chose hotel Parlomar for Sat. night. We loved it. It is clean and hip. They serve nice iced tea and lemonade in afternoon and coffee in the morning and at 5 wine and some fancy pizza. The best part of the hotel is the roof top deck. We got some drinks from the very nice bar downstairs and brought them to the deck. It was quiet with some new age music in the background, so romantic. The city was all lit up and beautiful. I could have sat there all night. The only draw back to this hotel is the fire house is kind of close, so bring your ear plugs. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: IndianapolisINLori
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd time staying at HOtel Palomar Chicago and it exceeded our previous expectations. The rooms are incredible. Clean, comfortable, hight thread count sheets.It's the little extras that count: free wifi to Kimpton Intouch guests (which is free), raid the mini bar, turn down service, complimentary wine tasting every evening. The Sable bar was incredible. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Janet1836
Reviews.Content: For such a well rated hotel, our experience was very disappointing. Upon late night arrival, we found the bed needing to be tucked in all around and an entry light flickering all night long. This was reported and by the time we left the hotel 7 nights later, the light had never been repaired - only the bulb removed. We were not offered a different room or compensation. The attitude of reception staff was casual in the extreme. However, we did have an excellent meal with very congenial service in the hotel restaurant. Our room was also very large and well furnished.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: NancyD403
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palomar in Chicago for two nights in early July and then returned for an additional night after some days in Michigan. It is a very nice hotel with a decent swimming pool and is conveniently located. It was easy to come in from the airport on the subway, though unfortunately the station nearby was working on it's escalator, making coming up the stairs with heavy luggage a problem. The staff at the front desk is super helpful and recommended several good restaurants and sightseeing options. They booked our Architectural Boat Tour, which was one of the best things we did in Chicago. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Large Rooms”
Reviews.Author: tamiam1969
Reviews.Content: This is a newer hotel and it shows. The rooms are georgous, modern and quite large. The bathrooms are the same. I stayed in a king spa suite and it was a corner room on the 8th floor. The staff were all very friendly. The room service food was good. The fitness center was very nice. I did not use the indoor pool, but it looked really nice and the outside patio area was pretty large, with a view all the way to the lake. Best of all, this hotel is in a great location in the River North neighborhood. I walked to work, shopping, dinning, everything.

Reviews.Title: “Top quality rooms, great location, really truly nice staff.”
Reviews.Author: NYtraveler1234
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Chicago so we selected this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews and we were not disappointed. When we checked in we mentioned that it was our anniversary and when we returned from our walk we found iced champagne in our room with a card from the concierge. We enjoyed it on the rooftop deck. The hotel location is perfect for walking and for taking the Red Line subway. The wine tasting from 5-6 pm every day is so nice. It is served in the 'living room', is free, and serves as a nice place to meet other visitors to Chicago. The staff members here are a happy group. This place is well-run. We can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Another great Kimpton hotel”
Reviews.Author: ruthkred
Reviews.Content: Nice sized room for Chicago. We stayed in a beautiful 1 bedroom suite. It knocks the socks off the Four Seasons where we usually stay. Great location - who needs to stay on Michigan Avenue? Restaurant and bar were incredible. Loved the small plates. Will return here next time we visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Kid Friendly and Cool!”
Reviews.Author: alyssa m
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in a few Kimpton hotels, we decided to try the new Palomar in Chicago for a family weekend. The location is great, a few blocks from Michigan Ave., walking distance to theaters and wonderful restaurants. The staff was very friendly and didn't not ignore the kids as is the case at many "hip boutique" hotels. They were given goody bags, with colored pencils, yoyos etc. Everything needed to keep a "bored" kid busy while waiting for dinner, the yoyos were in constant use on our walks around the city. The room was a true one bedroom suite with ample couch room for the two kids. The bathroom was glorious, one of the largest bathtubs I have ever seen! As for the restaurant and bar, the bar has one of the best cocktail menus, more of a book, I have ever seen. Defining hand crafted. The only meal we eat at the hotel was a breakfast, which was good, but the service was very slow, possibly due to the fact that is was Sunday morning at opening time. We would highly recommend this Kimpton property, it is now our first choice for weekend getaways in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “good but not great”
Reviews.Author: Laurie H
Reviews.Content: I came in April with my family and loved the Palomar. When my friend and I planned a trip with our tween daughters I told her that we had to say at the Palomar. My experience was not as great this time. Our room was not ready until 4:15, and I never got an apology. I had even requested early check-in. I wasn't expecting to get in early, but someone could have at least said he/she was sorry that our room wasn't ready at the normal check-in time. I was given a free breakfast coupon for the two "children" for being a rewards member. When we got to the restaurant we saw on the menu that children eat free all the time. We had a hard time getting enough towels and shampoo. They are stingy with the pizza at the complimentary wine hour. There were a lot of dogs in the lobby. It's a nice hotel, but it's not the fabulous hotel I visited in April.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Great location. Great service. Worth more than we paid.”
Reviews.Author: hyperballad4
Reviews.Content: Room was spotless and staff super friendly and helpful. The hotel was pet friendly but we only ever saw dogs at reception. Very quiet with great views of the downtown. The location is amazing. Across from the metro and steps from the Mag Mile and both big parks. Food at the restaurant was good although not the best. Great experience.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: Tio-man
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in hotel Palomar and were very pleased . Location is perfect : metrostation around the corner, 10 min's walk from the loop, 10 min's walk from the lake, in the heart of a vibrant neighbourhood with lot's of nice restaurants, bars, ... Staff was friendly and helpfull. The room (King Deluxe) was very clean, spacious, luxurious, just perfect. We enjoyed the pool and the roofterrace and had a great diner-experience in "Le Sable", the hip hotels restaurant. The daily free wine-degustation was a nice finishing touch. Would not hesitate to stay again @ Palomar!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here when we return to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Nova99
Reviews.Content: Right off Hotel Palomar got points for having our room ready for us when we arrived at 10:00 a.m. We had a king luxury suite which was wonderful. It had a nice sized living room, connecting hallway (where the bathroom was) and a huge bedroom. The living room had a pull out couch where my daughter slept - she wasn't too thrilled with the mattress (you could feel the springs in the mattress). In hindsight, we should have requested a roll away bed (just a heads up to anyone utilizing the pull out couch). The bathroom was very large with a big walk-in shower and a jacuzzi. We were supplied with shampoo, conditioner and body lotion, as well as some animal print robes. The bathroom had plenty of counter space and the living room and bedroom had drawer space and there were closets in the living room and the hallway. There was plenty of room to store all your things so there was no need to be tripping over suitcases, etc. Everything was immaculately clean and in good condition. One very small picky complaint would be that they could have left more soap for the shower once they saw how thin it had gotten - however, my daughter tells me I always have that complaint so maybe it's just my pet peeve. Enough about the room - the staff was wonderful. Front desk always smiled and greeted you. Employees at the door were always there to hold the door and ask if you needed directions, a cab or advice on where to go - a great group of guys! Every evening at 5:00, there's a free cocktail hour in the "Living Room" where they serve wine, sangria and a sampling of their War of the Roses cocktail as well as flat bread pizza. In the morning, there's free coffe and tea (both hot and iced); and there was always a supply of lemon infused water in the afternoon (which was great since it was very hot while we were there). Gym and pool are on the 17th floor along with a terrace where you can just sit and be amazed at the buildings all around you - Chicago has some great architecture (take an architecture cruise to really appreciate it all - we did one at night and it was spectacular). We're from New York City and were still in awe of the buildings in Chicago. Location is perfect - there are restaurants and stores all over. We were 2 blocks from Michigan Avenue; around the corner from the free Navy Pier shuttle, a few blocks from the theater district and about a 10 minute walk to Millenium Park. The red line train station is on the corner and it was only 3 stops to the Willis Building where you can go to the observatory and stand on the glass enclosed ledges of the Sky Deck -- very cool! There's also a very good grocery store on the next block across the street. Good to buy some things to keep in the room - liquor, cold drinks, snacks - even bought fresh rolls and pastries in the morning for breakfast in the room. It's also very easy to get to and from the airport. Since this was our first time in Chicago, we were hesitant to take the train from the airport since we didn't know the area yet and didn't want the hassle of figuring it out. We took a taxi which cost $42 ($50 with tip for three of us). After getting familiar with the train during our stay, we decided to take it to the airport and it was no problem. You need to take the Blue Line but can transfer from the Red Line very easily ($2.25 per person so $6.75 vs. $50 - next time we'll take the train to the hotel also). Since we had an evening flight, we checked out and the hotel stored our bags until we left. Upon leaving, I noticed the concierge was checking a flight for someone and printed her boarding passes for the next day, so I asked for the same service and he happily obliged -- checked us in for our flight and printed our boarding passes -- loved that service -- saved us time at the airport. Great job Hotel Palomar - we love Chicago and will defintely be back to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: zrom
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Hotel Palomar...a choice based on Tripadvisor reviews and ratings. The prior reviews are spot on. This is a fun, conveniently located hotel that has much to offer. The front desk staff was great on check in. They explained things very well and were very welcoming. The room was clean, modern and inviting with a GREAT bed. We opted a higher floor room. Ours was on the 16th floor below, we later learned, the fitness center. We experienced quite a bit of noise from above so, in the future, would opt for a different floor. We visited the bar for a drink after shopping in the afternoon. We had a difficult time finding someone willing to wait on us. Once we got the attention of the server, however, he was quite attentive. When we visited later, the bar was full and energetic. A fun night spot. The nightly hosted wine reception was crowded, but service was fast and the wine tasty. Breakfast in the restaurant was great. We suggest joining the hotel loyalty program as it carries perk including a mini bar credit, newpaper and wifi. We have long been wedded to staying at the Sofitel when enjoying a weekend in Chicago. In the future, we will be hard pressed to pass on Hotel Palomar. The hotel is centrally located to shopping and dining. All in all a very enjoyable stay that we will surely repeat soon.

Reviews.Title: “Hip in a good way - my gave in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: co04
Reviews.Content: I LOVE the Palomar! You can bring your pets but if that doesn't appeal to you you'll love it here too. Great vibe, cool decor, and very friendly staff. The pool, gym, and living room are fabulous and small/cozy without being cramped or small. Location is great - not crazy busy, only a few steps from the Red Line, plentiful cabs at all hours(hailed by the awesome doormen), close to great food and super close to Michigan Ave and Navy Pier. My room was beautiful, quiet, and the amenities are great (think leopard robe and higher end bath products).

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: charlottemary
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, clean room,wonderful location. We were able to walk just about everywhere. Would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - tries hard”
Reviews.Author: jenshaines
Reviews.Content: I'm probably not quite in sync with many of the reviewers in terms of this hotel. It was lovely, in many ways, but more consistency would go a long ways toward pushing it from very good to excellent. The rooms are lovely, but are filled with quirks, such as confusing switches, a heavy sliding door to the bathroom, and a chic, but awkward, lounge chair. The staff are very willing to help, and there are tons of nice extras such as a daily wine reception, coffee or drinks in the lobby throughout the day, prior to the reception, and especially good treatment of Kimpton "in touch" members. OTOH, the turn down service came on the second night, but not on the first. Three concierge services were somewhat bizarre. While there are many thoughtful details in the room there is no coffee maker, which seemed odd. Another perk of this hotel is the great location - tons of fabulous restaurants nearby, within walking distance of the Chicago River Walk and the theater district, and a block from the Red Line. This is definitely a hotel I'd return to, but again, consistency would make me even happier.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LFaith
Reviews.Content: My husband, teenage son and I stayed at the Palomar for one night and had a wonderful experience. The hotel is in a great location, it's stylish, comfortable and generous -- there's a comfortable "living room" where every night they offer free wine and hors d'oeuvres and every morning they put out coffee. The doormen were all friendly and helpful, as were all the people at the front desk. We got a good deal at the hotel, and there's no doubt it will be our choice for future stays in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience - Service was Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: SandroP
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Palomar over a long weekend in August. Pretty much everything about the stay went off without a hitch. We were able to check in immediately despite arriving four hours before the check in time. The hotel honored our request for a top-floor corner room. The hotel sent up a complimentary bottle of champagne (we had mentioned it was our anniversary). Front desk were very helpful regarding things to do in Chicago. The hotel itself was very clean, with spacious rooms and a great location. The pool on the 17th floor was an added plus, though it was a bit shallower/smaller than it looked in the pictures. It goes without saying that you can probably have a more luxurious experience at places like the Four Seasons or the Elysian. But those hotels are considerably more expensive. If you're looking for a very comfortable and attentive experience in the mid to upper price range (without blowing 300+ a night), the Palomar is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sean A
Reviews.Content: Awesome trip to Chicago in the summer made even better by the staff and location of the hotel. Very reasonable rates for a downtown property, free wine reception in the lobby from 5pm to 6pm every evening and a great bar right at street level. Would definatly stay there if we were back to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location enjoyed our weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: Cobra199
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Palomar in Chicago was a pleasure to stay at for our family of five on a weekend trip to Chi town. We stayed in a one-bedroom suite which was perfect for five. The suite had a jacuzzi tub which was a treat and two TV's so no fighting over the remote. Had breakfast at Sable and that was delish also. Would definitely come back thoroughly enjoyed Hotel Palomar.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, spectacular hotel! BEWARE: Parking is $$$$”
Reviews.Author: newtorontonian
Reviews.Content: I was traveling to Chicago to for a girl's weekend and we decided to stay at the Palomar. The hotel opened in March 2010 and the staff is meticulous with the upkeep of the hotel. The cleanliness of the hotel is a non-issue. The most important things that need to be mentioned are: hotel location, parking, staff responsiveness, fresco deck, pool and room size. The hotel is located in downtown Chicago. However, Chicago is not the most walkable city. Although, the hotel is on State Street is not particularly close to Michigan Ave./Water Tower Place. If shopping is your top priority, stay at a hotel on Michigan Ave. The Hotel Palomar is conveniently located next to a free trolley to Navy Pier (a tourist trap) and many outstanding restaurants. The price of parking blew my socks off. It's $46 a day with unlimited in and out privileges. It's also MANDATORY. In Toronto, parking at a hotel of this caliber is $25-35 a day with in and out privileges. So I'm not just being cheap! Also, taking cabs in Chicago is much cheaper many other cities. The base rate is just $2.25. During our stay we never paid more than $11 for a cab. So it's worth not bringing your car. I would strongly recommend not taking the CTA. It's not safe. When we used it mid-day on a the blue line, they wouldn't stop at some stations due to "police activity". The staff was always friendly and polite. My only complaint is that it took forever to have something delivered to the room. I sometimes would wait 10 minutes. I hope the slow elevators had something to do with it. We loved using the fresco deck and pool during our stay. It's one of the reasons we picked this hotel. It's a great place to go sunbathing! It's heavenly to have room service deliver and eat breakfast there while viewing the city! It's a memory I'll never forget! When staying at this hotel definitely opt for a corner room. I had to book a deluxe queen, because we desperately needed two beds. Our corner room was a bit small, I was told that corner rooms are much bigger than the regular rooms. So requesting a corner room is a must! Over all we had a great stay. I definitely will be back. Just a bit annoyed an extra $200 was tacked on to the bill for parking. I also recommend joining their rewards program. That seems to help with having your requests met. Also, when you join you get free internet.

Reviews.Title: “It really is all that.”
Reviews.Author: SeenAlot
Reviews.Content: I don't have a lot to add to all the other stellar reviews. Have never stayed in a Kimpton before and decided it was time. Picked the Palomar because of the TripAdvisor rating and we really needed to be near a metro stop. What can I add? Yes, there is construction across the street and a large fire station a block away. We loved both. This IS Chicago. We were interested in Sable as the kitchen and it awesome, particularly for the soft boiled eggs cooked to perfection for my in-room breakfast. We had to in-and-out our car a few times- the valet service is amazing. The bellmen are all sweet and cute. Desk staff professional. We needed a hotel where my husband and I can enjoy each other and Chicago but also pick up and drop off our daughter at her new college for the next four years. I think this place does the trick.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Samcat1
Reviews.Content: Here for a bit of family business, bit of sightseeing. Warm welcoming greeting from Jason who answered all my questions pleasantly and patiently, answers which he accompanied with a winning smile. It was noon and my corner room was ready. The room was large, the accoutrements lovely. On the inside handle of the phone receiver next to the bed there's a list of hotel extensions in a font size 4; it doesn't help that it's on a dark background, making it impossible to read. The entire staff was outstanding: I was waiting for an elevator on Saturday morning and a hotel maintenance technician asked me, very sincerely, how my visit was going. Went for the complimentary coffee (which is very good) at 6 am Friday and staff at the set-up was pleasant and appropriately conversational for that early an hour and concerned with my stay at the hotel. If you want complementary coffee or wine, heed the hours on the literature because the Palomar isn't kidding -- staff is whooshing away the beverages at the appointed end hour. Management might want to take a close look at the carpeting in the room next to the lobby, as it's taken its hit of wine and coffee spills and could really use a good bath. Overall, the hotel is clean and neat. Wide selection of free newspapers: local, WSJ and NYTimes. Don't miss the pool and the patio.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Qarolina
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated in the city center, the building is quite recent and the rooms are very clean. In the bathroom/ toilette there is not the bidet and the door is a sliding one (trendy but not comfortable!). The hotel gives you the breakfast coupons for the hotel restaurant but if you usually have a big breakfast you will not satisfied. Anyway the quality of the food is very high! (waffles are recommended) .

Reviews.Title: “Nice room. Service just okay.”
Reviews.Author: TNT14
Reviews.Content: After some really great stays at Kimpton hotels and now some so-so ones I am starting to wonder if it is really worth paying for. As stated in previous reviews,hotel rooms are hotel rooms and even though some are much nicer than others if you vacation like us (walk and visit the sites all day and have a nice dinner and enjoy the nightlife of a city each evening) then what will really make the hotel experience stand out is its attention to service. Upon arrival we did valet (expensive) and checked in at front desk. Unfortunately the welcome was not the greatest. When we check in to any of our hotels we have a lot of excitement and come in with smiles and ready to engage with the staff. Our greeting was very cold. That being said the other staff seemed nice with their guests. As Kimpton reward members we mentioned the password for the month. Now, this is an extra perk and without it we still would stay at the Kimpton but it is nice. Our reward was milk and cookies which is a real shame since our kids get that from the front desk staff free regardless during most of our stays. We then proceeded to our room which was nice. We have come to expect comfortable and well appointed rooms with Kimptons and that is always met. We immediately began our vacation and looked forward to seeing waht Chicago had to offer. The location is perfect to do Michigan Ave and the shops. Chicago may be a walkable city according to some travel sites but prepare to walk a lot. Otherwise the water taxi, bus, cab or el train is available but can become costly time and money wise for a family of 4. Chicago has some great neighborhoods like Wrigleyville Licoln Park area or Andersonville but if you drive you risk traffic on Lakeshore which can be frustrating on vacation and even more ridiculous parking costs. A free trolley also exists for Navy Pier although every time we tried to catch it it seemed to be full and go past the stop so we just walked. The weather was spectacular during our stay so not a problem. When we would return rarely was there a doorman or valet to open the door. Again not a necessity maybe a luxury but service none the less especially when paying over $200 a night plus parking. We did attend the wine hour at night and you cannot go wrong with free wine but the mixed drink or sangria that was offered was not that good and if it reflects their restaurant it actually made us stay away at night when we would maybe go to the bar and order something to end the day on. The pizza appetizers brought around the room were great though. The following morning we went for the coffee offered and unfortunately none of the regular coffee was replenished. We waited for 10 minutes to see if anyone would come but noone did. The ice coffee area needed to be cleaned a little and also replenished. We just headed on our way and purchased our own coffee on Michigan Ave while we shopped. We then checked out by the same person who checked us in and headed to our next Kimpton, the Allegro. The trip to Chicago was prompted by the fact it had some Kimpton hotels available. Anyone can find something wrong with any experience and unfortunately we ultimately weigh our final review on how well we were treated by the staff and would we return. Before I have even left town I usually have a list of things I want to do when I return but the Kimpton didn't really do anything for me in wanting to come back. I would recommend that when staying in Chicago to take your chances with Priceline instead and you may get this hotel or another of 4 star status at a fraction of the cost. You then can use the savings on parking, transportation, or shopping. We have just a few Kimptons left that we want to try on the East Coast so our fingers are crossed that they will meet our expectations as the first ones did that started this craziness of staying at as many of them as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great view and excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: LizCincinnatiOH
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on July 5th after the U2 concert with another couple. It was a fun, hip place to stay with lots of nice touches in the rooms. We enjoyed walking around downtown Chicago, and we were able to walk from Soldier Field back to the hotel after the concert. We enjoyed our stay and look forward to visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews guided another perfect choice.”
Reviews.Author: brisk_51
Reviews.Content: Needed a 1 night stay in Chicago for business. Being a true believer, I chose the Palomar based on Trip Advisor ratings and was very pleased. This hotel has an excelllent location for access to the highlights of downtown Chicago, walking distance to almost everything. It is spotlessly clean, super friendly staff, a delightful happy hour with really nice wine and a great night sleep. Couldn't ask for more. I'll go back on my annual trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “I will recommend whole heartedly !”
Reviews.Author: GinkyH
Reviews.Content: People are so nice and helpful.. Really appreciated Mark, the concierge. Room was quiet as requested and Ioved the extra touches- the free daily paper ,morning coffee, wine+ hour and the location is unbeatable- right across from the Metro and 3 short blocks from Michigan Ave. close to all the shopping. Price was not cheap , but still fairly priced especially because they 'do it well'.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: KayandKen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful, they even lent us a phone charger because we lost one of our suitcases. The area is very good for restaurants and shopping. Our room deal incuded breakfast. We were delighted with the quality of the breakfast and the waiter was very friendly. The only complaint we had was the shower wasn't very powerful. Other than that we would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: lwilliams75
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Kimpton Hotels before and enjoyed them. This was no different - nice decor in the lobby and rooms and decent enough room sizes, although the bathroom was on the small size. The service we had was great - I asked for a room on a higher floor with a view, and received both. The wine hour is always a great bonus, especially as they also had a cocktail on offer, as well as deviled eggs as a snack. We had friends with us (staying at a different Kimpton hotel - hotel Monaco) and the staff had no problem with them taking part in our cocktail hour. We went up to see the pool, which was nice, and the roof terrace had a great view. The hotel had a great location for all of the Chicago sights. My only (very minor) complaint was that the lobby was small, but I guess that is what you get in cities. I would stay here again and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Finally found it!”
Reviews.Author: ninewinx
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice & really like the Kimpton quality boutique hotel experience. It's well situated to shopping & attractions. It will be even better when the construction on the street is completed. The food is fantastic in the restaurant & room service was also terrific. I have been looking for the downtown Chicago hotel to which we would happily return & have finally found it. Love it!

Reviews.Title: “FINE HOTEL, BUT NOT PARTICULARLY ECO-FRIENDLY”
Reviews.Author: carlac
Reviews.Content: Certainly, a fine hotel in Chicago. However, I am concerned because the hotel bills itself as "eco-friendly" with LEED certifications. I cannot speak for the eco-friendliness of the construction, etc., but I can say that the day-to-day operations leave much to be desired. And, that is unfortunate, because there are simple things that could be done to make things much more sustainable. I am not an extreme "tree-hugger" or something of the like, but I do feel that Kimpton is (knowingly or unknowingly) sending the message that it is exceptional in this arena, when really the hotel needs to do more: - When we arrived in our hotel room, the air conditioner was blasting! It was set at 68 degrees. - When we arrived home each night, 4 lights had been turned on by the nightstaff as part of the turndown. The room wasn't even dark with all the city lights coming in! - Our towels were replaced on day 2, despite our telling the staff that they were fine. - Leaving the hotel in the morning, the doorman offers plastic bottles of water. Why? Why not set up a large pitcher of filtered water as they do at other Kimpton properties? - Our travel size shampoo and conditioner were replaced each day whether or not they were empty. Also, we had to ask 2x for our crib and 3x for a roll-away.

Reviews.Title: “Our best stay at a hotel - ever”
Reviews.Author: HighlandCreek
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great hotel in the River North area of Chicago, look no further than the Palomar Chicago. We were sold on the place before we got there, having seen teh ratings at TripAdvisor, but then we had an issue with booking that was cleared up immediately by the General Manager. His solution to our problem more than met our expectations. When we arrived at the hotel (at 11 PM), we were warmly greeted and escorted to our well appointed, clean and comfortable room. Talk about comfortable! The beds and pillows rivalled the comfort of our own (very good) beds at home. Everything was well appointed. We asked for some extra towels and they arrived at our door in 5 minutes. We've never experienced faster room service! We have no hesitation suggesting you stay at the Palomar. It is close to most of the main attractions in downtown Chicago, near a Red Line subway station, blocks from some of the best restaurants in the city. The valet parking worked like a charm, which is more than we can say for some hotels we've stayed at. The staff at the hotel are marvellous. Everyone seems to be on the same page, wanting to ensure that your visit is the best ever. We didn't run into one surly or disgruntled employee. We can't say one person stood out (other than the GM), because they all did!

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary warmth”
Reviews.Author: kboyken
Reviews.Content: The Palomar's contemporary design and decor might lead you to expect cold trendy pretentiousness, and a cool and aloof staff. But the Palomar exudes warmth and comfort, and the staff are very friendly and accommodating. From check-in to check-out, my wife and I loved this hotel and its staff. Our room was beautifully furnished and well maintained. There were lots of nice touches, like the dimmers on every light, and the magnifying mirror mounted in the bathroom. Our bed was comfortable and the room was quiet. We enjoyed the lap pool and sun deck on the top floor. If you stay at the Palomar, be sure to make it downstairs to the complementary wine hour at 5 pm. The day we were there, besides cabernet and chardonnay, the staff were serving a cocktail, War of the Roses, and also bringing in trays of pizza from Sable, the highly rated restaurant on the property. The atmosphere was convivial, and my wife and I got to know several other guests. A couple of tips: If you join the Kimpton InTouch rewards program--completely free--you get free wifi. And if you own a hybrid, ask about the parking discount when you check in. We got a 50% discount on parking--a real deal, in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice overall stay...Lovely staff!”
Reviews.Author: WWWayfarerGirl
Reviews.Content: The Palomar is all that a hotel should be. The rooms were very clean, nice bedding and comfortable bed, great view outside of the floor to ceiling windows, and excellent service from the staff. We did not eat in the restaurant, but we did order room service and the food was very good. We had breakfast served in the room every morning and it always came exactly as ordered. We also utilized the in-room massage therapist and she was very professional and competent. The Fuji soaking tub was great and was wonderful to sit in after the massage. The staff at the Palomar are super! Bleu, who is the doorman, is absolutely awesome! Great guy and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, modern, clean & excellent location - a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: CoffeeFrappe
Reviews.Content: I just spent two nights at the Hotel Palomar for business and would definitely stay here again. This hotel is within walking distance of the Magnificent Mile, Millennium Park, the Chicago River and the Chicago Theater. It's an easy walk to plenty of great restaurants, too. I'm a Kimpton fan, and this hotel did not disappoint. The lobby was very cool, the room was beautiful and comfortable -- and very clean. For business travelers, the desk was large and there were plenty of outlets for chargers and your computer. Service was friendly, and the front desk attendants went out of their way to answer questions and provide information. Loved the artwork in the hallway, too! The outdoor deck was lovely -- I was lucky to have great weather and the entire deck to myself one night. The hotel has a nightly wine reception, free coffee and tea in the morning, and drinks throughout the day, (like iced tea or lemon water.) Looking forward to staying her again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at the Palomar Hotel Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Robins44
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a really nice stay at the Palomar Hotel. As mentioned in previous posts, the red line is just outside of the hotel and there are plenty of restaurants in the area. We were only about 3 blocks from Michigan Avenue (Miracle Mile) and 20 minute walk to the Chicago Art Institute (you can also take the red line about 2 or 3 stops and walk about 4 blocks). We stayed in a luxury suite which was decorated in somewhat of a modern style. This was especially a good deal as I booked this room thru sniqueaway.com. The hotel's fitness center has about 4 treadmills, a couple of elipitical stairmasters, a couple of bikes, free weights, one mutli station machine and an area for with mats, bosu balls and stability balls. Overall, we had a wonderful stay and would definitely return to the Palomar Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was great”
Reviews.Author: swim_coach61
Reviews.Content: It started off with an unrequested upgrade to a suite, and never really came down. Although it took the two of us a bit of time to figure out the lights and I never found the robes until the last day (I'm not really a hotel explorer), it was well worth the price of admission. My main complaint? Extremely poor water pressure -- easily the worst I've experienced at a high-end hotel. But the pluses out-weighed that. The free evening wine reception was great, as were the flatbread pizzas. Room service was quick and tasty, although it took a while for them to pick up the tray... The bed was comfortable and the view (ok, into an office building), was acceptable. The fitness center, albeit small, had treadmills, machines, high-range dumbbells, swiss balls, and a view. I did not try the pool; however, i wish I had. It wasn't cheap, or inexpensive -- but in this case, definitely worth it. I'll stay there again when I get the chance (it also seems to book pretty quickly).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: LoriCAtlanta
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Palomar is within walking distance of the Magnificent Mile, Millennium Park, the Chicago River and the Chicago Theater. It's just steps from the Grand subway station on the Red Line, and it's also an easy walk to the Brown line. The room was beautiful and comfortable, there was some construction going on outside but we were on the 16th floor so we didn't hear anything. We loved the nightly wine reception, free coffee and tea in the morning, and drinks throughout the day, like iced tea or lemon water. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Customer service lacking and information from the Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: Michael0507
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at this Hotel because of its location and the Conference that I was attending was in the same Hotel. On my arrival , I was welcomed by a Woman at the Front Desk who was polite and curtious. I checked in and went up to my Room which was very nice lacking nothing, and very spacious. Beautiful views , the only negative aspect was the carpeting , very nice motif , but carpeting in a Hotel for me is passÃ© !! I had dinner at the Trump Plaza Restaurant ,, the Sixteen , what a delight, the service and food was " Epoustouflant " Only after did my soirÃ©e go down hill. I went to a Banque wuthdrew money ,, went to a Bar to have a drink and was lured into a car by two people who I met and they implied they worked for the Tourisme Board of Chicago. I was driven to a an area that was like a war zone and they took all my money and my I-phone and threw me out of the car, the only thing that saved my life was the fact I told them that I was V.I.P. and my phone had a tracking device and people would be looking for me immediately ! I was left to walk and find a Gas station and asked for help. The Chicago police arrived, and were very helpful and took the information and drove me back to my Hotel. I had no money and no phone thus, I was shell shocked, and explained what had happened to me to the Front Desk. I asked for a cash advance and was told it was impossible because the fact that the Room was being paid for by my Boss , and it was checked off that " All Charges " was to be put on the Credit Card , according to them it only pertained to the Hotel and Room charges, thus I would have to wait for the Manager in the morning. I was still in a daze, not realizing that Bank Card was in my pocket ,, only the next morning. Good cutomer service is to do all you can and beyond to help the client who has been through a horrible ordeal. I give this Hotel 3 stars for comfort , but 0 for knowing how to go beyond to help a customer who lived through an ordeal never to forget. I will return to Chicago but I will be less naive in thinking all people are helpful and nice. Also maybe this Hotel should re-look at their policy and even though they called my Boss who was also on vacation , I had already left the Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Palomar once again pleases and impresses”
Reviews.Author: foolonthehill58
Reviews.Content: This is our second or third time staying at the Hotel Palomar in downtown Chicago. It is just an excellent hotel in an excellent location. From the minute your arrive the valets, front desk personnel and room accommodations are first rate. We were given a corner room with beautiful views of the city. The beds, pillows and furnishings were comfortable and stylish. City noise was diminished by sound proof window. (you still could hear the occasional siren) My wife and I traveled with her 85 year old mother in a wheelchair and everyone, as to be expected, went out of their way to accommodate her. She loved the 'rooftop' pool. (it's not exactly on the roof) You simply can't beat the location and the service and quite frankly the price is not bad for a Magnificent Mile hotel. (valet parking is a bit spendy) EATT across and down the street South, is very good for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: SFWOxford
Reviews.Content: I had never been to Chicago before but the Palomar was certainly a good base - very close to the river and to the shops. Room was a good size - immaculately clean. Staff on the whole were fine aoart from when my key didn't work I was made to feel like an imposter - I know they have to be careful of security but it wasn't my fault that the key stopped working! Free morning coffee is a nice touch but it would be good to have a coffee maker in the room rather than have to go down to the lobby. Food was good - the room service staff were excellent - couldn't fault them

Reviews.Title: “Great family stay”
Reviews.Author: Map006
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here over Easter weekend and had a great time. The children loved the pool. We were close to everything - Navy Pier, Millennium Park, shopping, church on Easter Sunday at the Cathedral. We walked everywhere except for the Field Museum. We had children from the age of 2 through 19. We would definitely stay at the Palomar again. The children all received gift bags on arrival and all enjoyed their yo-yos.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Griff9966
Reviews.Content: Brilliant Hotel - Management and staff are all extremely professional, friendly and helpful. Fantastic rooms and service. Right in the middle of town and plenty to do within walking distance. Great restaurant and cocktail bar - nothing short of sensational and seems to be the in place with the locals as well. Thanks Joe and staff when we're in Chicago again we won't look any further.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Boutique Hotel in Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Buckwilli
Reviews.Content: If you like boutique hotels, you will love this one. Nice clean rooms. Great location, easy walk to Michigan Avenue as well as Chicago Riverwalk and other shopping areas. Would definitely stay there again on a return trip to Chicago. Only small complaint would be the tiny drop-off area in front of the hotel, but they were doing road construction when we were there so that may be improved soon. We stayed on the ninth floor, would probably ask to stay on a higher floor next time.

Reviews.Title: “The best!”
Reviews.Author: tgpenix
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent 4 nights at the Hotel Palomar while visiting Chicago. I am very happy that I chose this hotel. The location was great. We took the train from O'Hare, changed lines once and ended up very close to the hotel. We arrived about 12 noon, but our room was ready for us. Check in was very easy. The hotel is immaculate and very tastefully decorated. We loved our room and found it very comfortable and spacious. The bathroom had a nice size vanity and marble floors. The bedroom had a desk, lots of outlets, nice flat screen tv, and ipod docking station. The lady at the front desk suggested our room as it had a good view of the city. We were on the 10th floor far from the elevators. It was quiet in our room. Housekeeping came by 2-3 times/day to clean the room, replace towels, ice, chocolates on pillows, etc. They were very attentive to our needs. The front desk was helpful providing dining choices. As a kimpton reward member we had free wi-fi. The animal print robes provided was a nice touch. Our room rate with my government discount was great. The hotel was within close walking distance to Chicago attractions, shopping, and food choices. The fitness center was nice and open 24 hours a day. There was a small pool, but I did not use, but one of my favorite things was sitting on the open deck on the 17th floor reading and relaxing. The only thing I didn't like was with a debit card they put an extra hold for $100 per day, which comes off 2-3 days after check out...this was an additional 400 for our four night stay. But overall, fabulous place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Chicago so far”
Reviews.Author: billyfitness
Reviews.Content: The Palomar had everything a downtown hotel should have: Great , courteous, helpful staff, clean room, great view, quiet, and great lobby bar. (the best Bourbon collection I have every encountered!) I have stayed in numerous Chicago hotels and until now the Sofitel was my favorite but no more!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Radzie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to do a "staycation" and spend 2 nights in our own city doing the tourist thing. From the minute I got out of the cab, the service was top notch. Check in was a breeze and everyone was helpful. The room is very large and the bed is so comfortable!! Shortly after check in we were surprised with a bottle of champagne, since we mentioned we were also celebrating an anniversary. Nice! We loved the location, it's away from the craziness of Michigan Ave, but right down the street for you to walk and enjoy. It was a 15 minute walk to Navy Pier, definitely worth it. There are many restaurants and bars in the area, walk around and check them out! Every time we left the hotel, the staff asked if they could help find us some place to go, etc. While we didn't go to the restaurant, we did order the AMAZING parmesan truffle popcorn and margaritas while we laid out on the sundeck. The view is great and the pool is as well. The room service was fast and the manager friendly. Some extra touches include the hosted wine reception every evening as well as hosted coffee and tea in the morning (seriously who offers that?!). If you sign up for the free Kimpton card you also get free wi fi. I definitely recommend Hotel Palomar and would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: CJennel
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived to the second we checked out, our stay at the Hotel Palomar was wonderful!! Beautiful hotel, super clean, and a perfect location! The staff was super friendly! The view from our king deluxe room was beautiful (as well as the view from the terrace!) Our room was super clean and pretty big too! Thanks for the bottle of wine too Palomar, it made our anniversary week even more special! We'll be back next month for a few days to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday! Can't wait until then!! Wouldn't stay anywhere else in the city! We absolutely LOVED our stay here!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: JMA_QC
Reviews.Content: Honestly : can't find a single thing I didn't like! Beautifully decorated room Good-sized sitting area in room Awesome bathroom Warm, friendly reception staff Superb restaurant & bar Centrally located Free Internet access Would like to live there....

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel, our favourite in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: gracie66
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Palomar three times now. Excellent staff (friendly and responsive), central location (close to both Magnificent Mile and the Loop), attractive decor, lovely, spacious rooms -- and their restaurant, "Sable," is also top-notch. Particular favourites: the lap pool and the hotel lounge, which offers a morning coffee/tea service and afternoon drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Huge suites, good location”
Reviews.Author: originalsix
Reviews.Content: In summer, average Chicago rooms are not cheap. So it seemed like a rate of $305 for the Luxury 1-Bedroom Suite may be worth the extra money when travelling with the kids, as the sofa converts to a bed. The 2-room suite was huge and it has a monster size tub and shower. Free WiFi if you sign up to Kimpton loyalty program. The only negatives: noisy air conditioner and the sofa bed was not very comfortable.. not recommended for adults. Location is good... short walk to river walk or Michigan Ave, and plenty of Starbucks and good restaurants. It's a pet-friendly hotel, so if you are allergic, you may want to steer clear (although the place is very clean). I heard people complain about not getting AT&T phone reception in building, but Verizon is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent although of course not the cheapest”
Reviews.Author: Tim L
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for about a week with my wife & young daughter and we had a great time. The rooms are well appointed, the bed was probably the most comfortable that I have ever slept in (including in my own home) and the linen was very high quality and immaculately clean. Quite a big busy hotel but the staff were friendly and excellent. We really enjoyed the 17th floor 9if I remember correctly) swimming pool (although the water wasn't very clear (good quality just not very clear). Location was excellent as we didn't have a car but could walk to loads of the touristy things around. We wanted a quiet room and they gave us one with a lovely view on 14th floor but warned that there might be some noise and they would be happy to change. They were right - Palomar is quite close to a main fire station and those US fire truck sirens pierce anything. But we decided to stay put as the positive view outweighed the negative noise. A lovely stay - thankyou Hotel Palomar.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING HOTEL 5 STAR”
Reviews.Author: craftsbury
Reviews.Content: Was at wedding in Chicago for 3 nights at hotel Outstanding services was the main point from top to bottom-from doormen to top managers; never any problems but believe they could solve and want to help in any way; front desk helpful with ideas from restaurants to museums. can't believe it is not a 5 star hotel. excellent location; Red Soxs baseball stayed there also over busy weekend-able to handle as full hotel well. A+

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GotLobster
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a last minute business trip, found it on SniqueAway and decided to try it. What a nice surprise! The location was great, but best of all, the room is beautiful, spacious and comfortable. I typically stay at one of the chain hotels like the Hilton or Westin for business trips so this is quite a treat - almost feel guilty of enjoying the accommodation when I'm just there for business (so supposedly no pleasure ...?) The breakfast at the restaurant is WONDERUL. Great way to start my work day.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: amyh12382
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the hotel palomar chicago (kimpton) in late july with my husband for a quick city break. we had a fantastic time and would highly recommend the palomar to friends and colleagues visiting chicago. --location: whether you are in town for business or pleasure, there are few hotels as convenient and as well located as the palomar. within two blocks of the hotel, you can find supermarkets, michelin-starred dining, fast food, shopping, convenience stores and the l (grand station/red line, which means you're only about 15 minutes to wrigley, door to door). there are a lot of hotels in the theater district or along the water, but i find river north to be a much better neighborhood and it feels less like you are stuck in a tourist wasteland. --noise quality: although i stayed during a busy week, the hotel was quiet yet energetic (i.e. not dead; i hate it when i stay at a hotel and it is completely empty). city noise was hardly audible from the rooms, and hall/elevator/ice maker traffic was minimal, even though my room was right next door to the ice maker. --style: like all other kimpton hotels, the palomar has a funky, eclectic design. nevertheless, i found this hotel to be more restrained than some of the other kimpton properties i've stayed at, which suits the location i guess. this being chicago, the views from the rooms can be great (mine was of the famous marina city buildings). be sure to check out the view from the 17th floor (where the pool and gym are located), it was amazing during the day and at night. --staff: i normally do not have high expectations for customer service at hotels due to bad experiences traveling for business (international standards are not as high as the us), but the staff here were really great. each person i encountered was very friendly and remembered my preferences, fulfilled all requests, etc., yet it did not seem fake or annoying. definitely some of the best staff i've encountered in quite some time. --amenities: one of the best things about kimpton is their amenities and perks, like the evening wine reception/happy hour. before you arrive, join kimpton intouch if you're not already a member. it offers plenty of freebies, including wifi and minibar credit. additionally, the hotel offers promotions and such via their twitter (and facebook?), such as free wine. unfortunately i didn't get the chance to take advantage of it, but this hotel also offers a barre class (!!) on wednesday mornings near the pool and a group run with the hotel manager. very nice. they also offered free
