water throughout the day (both to enjoy in the lobby and bottles for the road) due to the heat wave, which was thoughtful. --value: while i've booked stays at kimptons directly with the hotel in the past, this property normally exceeds my hotel budget. yes, you get a ton of amenities and are in a great location, but i find the average best rate to be a bit pricey. nevertheless, when i was planning my trip, they had offered deals on sniqueaway (http://www.sniqueaway.com/invite/amyh12382) and you can save A LOT if you are willing to pre-pay in advance, no cancellations. to my surprise, the whole process was seamless, and the hotel even had my kimpton member id and special requests already taken care of upon arrival. overall, a wonderful option in chicago if it fits into your budget!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: marcothibault
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Palomar Chicago. The location was great, with many restaurants in the immediate area, and close to shopping as well. The room was clean and spacious, and felt more like a small apartment rather than just a hotel room. Best of all, the staff were courteous, and very helpful in making suggestions for restaurants, tours and responded to all questions with great patience. We would definitely stay there again and would not hesitate to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location with a Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: pehot75
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the Hotel Palomar this past week and I have no complaints at all. The location is great, with plenty of shopping and dining choices nearby. Everyone on staff was very friendly. The lobby was stocked with complementary coffee and tea in the morning and ice water/iced tea in the afternoon. My kids also loved the stocked candy dishes during the day. The front desk provided each of my kids "swag bags" with some nice freebees. The room was clean and a good size. The pool and the terrace area was wonderful as well. The wine hour from 5 - 6 in the lobby was a also a nice touch. It was also nice to be contacted via email by the staff a day or two before my arrival to see if I needed any assistance or special requests. Overall, great customer service from the Hotel Palomar. Free wifi was nice as well, if you are a member of their loyalty club. We will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Kimpton Property”
Reviews.Author: BigOrange56
Reviews.Content: Have previously stayed at Hotel Monaco, a sister property and loved it. This place is more contemporary and up to date with a different charm of its own. Hotel stays busy because it is right were the action is with shopping, food and the Red Line "L" train right out the door. The rooms were nice, quiet and well kept. Beds were extremely comfortable and the air conditioning was good, not great (it was a record hot week in Chicago). I would highly recommend this hotel as would any of the other Kimpton Properties!

Reviews.Title: “My new 'home' in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Mingo05
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth stay at the Hotel Palomar Chicago and I will definitely return. The rooms are clean, quiet and feature contemporary, comfortable design. The service is excellent. Everyone says hello, addresses you by name and makes you feel at home. Everything about this hotel is lovely. The towels are large and fluffy, the robes are animal print, the bathroom amenities are high-end. The manager hosts a wine reception each afternoon. Be sure to try the on-site restaurant, Sable. We shared several 'small bites' plates and everything was delicious. Hint: if you join the Kimpton loyalty program, you receive complimentary in-room internet, an honor bar credit and room upgrades when available. Also, if you arrive before check-in time, you can park your car, check your bags and go explore Chicago. The front desk will let you know when your room is ready. All you have to do when you return is pick up your room keys and your bags will be waiting for you in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: tanglesia
Reviews.Content: Room - awesome, bed comfortable, great bathroom, we were treated to a afternoon snack very thoughtful! Staff. Exceptional always friendly and helpful. Door men were the best! They gave us outstanding recommendations from dinner to shopping. Location. Perfect Can't wait to stay here again. Be sure to sign up for kimptons reward program. Lots of perks

Reviews.Title: “A very happy anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Journeywoman38
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Palomar over the 4th of July weekend; it was a belated 15th anniversary celebration. I generally love Kimpton hotels, and the Palomar was no exception! The staff was welcoming, knowledgeable, accommodating and responsive. The hotel itself is lovely, with fresh decor (loved the vintage photos of the Chicago Exposition in our room) and stylish furnishings. The wine reception in the lobby was fun (especially loved the signature cocktail option). The only minor complaint was that the shower curtain was moldy (there appeared to be no ventilation in the bathroom). But that glitch was pretty much eclipsed by the overall experience. After a day's sightseeing and dining in Chicago eateries, the Hotel Palomar was a great place to come home to.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: JSMass
Reviews.Content: Stayed during July for three nights. Arrived on a Friday evening and sadly, there was a big wedding over the weekend - meaning - LOTS OF PARTYING. We were up pretty late on Friday with the wedding revelers - about 2:30 am, then a car alarm went off right below our window until 10:00 am without stopping. We were also on a side of the hotel facing the FIRE DEPARTMENT - this could be a problem for you light sleepers. Because of a large storm system coming through the city we had a very exciting night. The hotel was immediately "on it" the next morning and moved us to another part of the building. We had a wonderful stay. The sheets were amazing. The rooms were VERY clean and well kept. Kimpton does a great job - the staff was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Escape!”
Reviews.Author: PhillyTraveler19147
Reviews.Content: Arriving July 12, my partner and I stayed 6 nights and loved everything the hotel had to offer. The King Spa Premier Room was a home-away-from-home for us, as we spent each day exploring the City and its eateries. One of our main reasons for the trip was our annual visit to the Pitchfork Music Festival - and, let me tell ya, after several hours outside in the summer heat - the sunken tub was a welcome - and refreshing - relief! We had a unique situation regarding our check-in, as we were using two ATM cards to cover the expenses. The hotel staff, and especially its accounting department, worked with us to make sure everything went swimmingly! Speaking of - the pool was inviting - clean and warm - which seemed odd at first - but once you were in it, it made total sense as you exited. The roof deck was a nice break - although it seemed popular by many - so we rarely took advantage of it. What we DID take advantage of was the Sable restaurant -- wonderful drinks by old-school bartenders ... a nice addition. In fact, they helped us discover OTHER places to dine out (having already dined there) ... thanks! Bottom line: I'd consider this my Chicago home from this point forward.

Reviews.Title: “great location near everything”
Reviews.Author: leskobear
Reviews.Content: This was a contemporary hotel very convenient to many restaurants and attractions. The number of nearby restaurants was amazing. Michigan Avenue was a couple of blocks away and John Hancock Tower, Millenium Park and the Art Institute were within walking distance of a mile or so. The room was very roomy and nicely appointed with contemporary furnishings and brightly colored carpet. It appeared very new. The a/c worked great and was very quiet. I will say the bathroom had the thinnest and roughest toilet paper I've seen. Had difficulty with cell service and internet on my phone in this building. Internet wouldn't work 90% of the time. It was in the middle of a heat wave, so the lobby and elevator area could be a little stuffy. Staff was helpful and the restaurant, Sable, had great food, if uneven service. Lobby staff was helpful and pleasant. Business center charged $7.95 for 15 minutes of internet. Since most places offer this free, I was surprised. Service was extremely slow and poor, so it was a complete waste of money.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: CyberMax
Reviews.Content: This was a birthday weekend celebration for both my wife and I. We wanted to be in a nice hotel in a good location for dinner and some night life with our friends. Hotel Polomar more than delivered on both the requirements. I booked online and mentioned the birthdays and that we wanted to checkin early and checkout late. Upon our early arrival, we were greeted by a very friendly staff that had our room ready for us. They wished us a happy birthday and informed us that we could checkout at 2:00pm. Our room decor was very nice and the bed was big and very comfortable. We met some friends down the street at Joe's for appetizers and drinks. We returned to the Palomar for the wine reception, which is a really nice touch. upon returning to our room, we discovered a complementary bottle of Merlot wine sent up by Mark the concierge, how great is that? After dinning at Hugo's and hitting some bars on Rush street, we came back to the hotel bar and stayed there the rest of the evening. The bar at the Palomar was big and much more comfortable then the cramped Rush street bars. We kind of wished we would have had dinner at hotel, since everything else there was so great. However, Hugo's is always a good choice for food and fun. The best part of the hotel stay for me was the great night sleep we had. I usually have problems sleeping in hotels because of the noise in the hallways or the other rooms. In this room, I did not hear a peep the entire night! We closed the drapes and it was pitch dark in the morning, so we slept in until 10:30am. We had a great breakfast in the room, the portions were huge and very reasonably priced. We loved Hotel Palomar and will definitly be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Bacholette Party”
Reviews.Author: LisaMDesign
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome for my bacholette party. We got a suite for the night and it was awesome. The only negative was the others staying on the floor didnt appreciate our energy (security told us to keep it down). The staff was wonderful and we loved the free happy hour from 5-6. It was the perfect way to start out the night. I would definitely stay there again. We liked the pool but it was filled with families so we felt a little left out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: Irishwake
Reviews.Content: During the weekend of July 8th and 9th, my wife and I stayed at Hotel Palomar in Chicago. The staff was great. They really paid attention to every detail and my wife loved them even more when one of the bell hops asked is she was a model. Also loved the location. Walk out the door and all of downtown Chicago is at your footsteps. We only stayed 2 nights but could have used another just to shop and explore all of the downtown area. When head back for a quick weekend we will definately stay at the Palomar.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. I would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: AGG35
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay downtown. Easy to get to Michigan Avenue and tons of great restaurants around. It's a quick walk to Trader Joes as well. The staff was always courteous. Complementary wine hour in the evening was a nice benefit. The restaurant connected to the restaurant had some great offerings, although it was more fun to eat at the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Fun get away for me and my daughters”
Reviews.Author: Richard_Temple_TX
Reviews.Content: We visited Chicago for a weekend. Great location. Got it as part of American Airlines vacation package. Free Wi-Fi if you sign up for free Kimpton Hotel rewards. We asked for a high floor and corner room, but got only the high floor. Great view. Close to Michigan Avenue and shopping/restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Loveagoodvacation
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Staff is friendly. Hotel is new and clean and not filled with the caliber of guests that make a lot of noise. I would definitely stay here again when I return. I have not one bad thing to report during the week we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place :)”
Reviews.Author: LuciaBertin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, the staff is very helpful! The room was so big!!!! The bathroom was the best!!! The only thing is that we reserved 2 beds and got the room with one big bed and a couch that turned into a bed not very comfortable to be honest. At 6 pm they serve wine at the lobby that was great!!!! The location was perfect! And the pool at night looks incredible!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: alshin
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot and stay mostly at 4 star hotels. We like the luxury but still want a lot of value for our money. We had reservations here and Trump Tower, and opted to stay here because of the nice package we got, including food credit and free parking. We are very pleased that we stayed here. My husband says that he would like to stay in Kimpton properties as much as possible. There is a construction in front of the hotel so coming in and out of the hotel was very difficult. I was not 100% thrilled with the location, either. It was about 15 minutes walk to the heart of Michigan Ave. We requested higher floor and received an adequately furnished room with the view of Chicago downtown. What distinguishes this property is the "trying to do everything we can" attitude of the employees. From the check-in person to the wine service in the afternoon to the bell man outside, employees are trying to please. I have one suggestion for the hotel and to Kimpton properties in general. Instead of just coffee service, throw in some pastries or donuts in the morning. That way those people who can go light will have satisfactory breakfast and those who want heavier breakfast will head to the Sable restaurant, which I found perfectly adequate. I would rather have a coffee machine in the room than going downstairs just to pick up a cup of coffee. If I can picke up a pastry or two, it might be ok. I took a survey after the stay and left some comments about minor airconditioning incident: I received an e-mail right back from the manager thanking me for the feedback and promising to rectify the situation. Now this is an organization who wants to listen to the customers and tries to better itself. No wonder recent Fortune magazine lists Kimpton hotels the best place to work for!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on Chicago and we have stayed at several!!”
Reviews.Author: bruiserjohnson
Reviews.Content: Great location! Close to navy pier and michigan ave. We stayed with our 5 year old. They have a guppy program where they will bring a goldfish to your room! Huge hit! Also brought a kids robe and a kids gift bag! Also the hotel offers a free wine tasting at 5. Chipolte is across the street an mcdonalds is close too. Room was very spacious And the pool was great too!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: treffy123
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spectacular - spacious, beautifully decorated. Funky cat-themed robes and fuzzy socks. I spent two nights here on business and would only stay here the next time I'm in Chicago. There were three of us on this trip and we couldn't believe we got such a great hotel for such a great price. We ate lunch in the restaurant which was also very good, although there are many, many other choices within walking distance. It was hard to get a table as a walk-in on that particular day, but they were happy to seat us at a high table in the bar area which was fine with us. Overall a great stay and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, friendly, comfortable, and classy!”
Reviews.Author: BunnyMpls33
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite places to stay in chicago. The hotel staff is genuine, the rooms are spacious and clean, mid-century modern with softer lines. I love their beds and the blackout shades! Great location for business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, but not too trendy”
Reviews.Author: Baconeater
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at the Palomar. It's small, a wee-bit trendy, but doesn't feel like a nightclub like the W. The room was spacious and clean. The best part was the free internet with membership in their rewards program. Also, the location near the red line is excellent. It's not too far from Michigan Ave, the Loop, or the train. All in all, the Palomar is probably one of my favorite hotels in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, great rooms, tasty food, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: doofuslarge
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Palomar during our first visit to Chicago. Simply put, we were more than satisfied. The location is great: walking distance to the park, the Red line, Mag Mile, river cruises, anything you want to do. The room was fresh and modern, very comfortable. The pool balcony has a great view and is very relaxing. The restaurant, Sable, has tasty modern food and wine options (the tenderloin was great, as were the curry scallops). The staff were able to help us with directions and other inquiries and were very friendly. For the price in downtown Chicago, I can't imagine a better hotel than the Palomar. We will come again!

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are dead on, this place is exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: NCSL
Reviews.Content: This was one of our best stays in Chicago. The hotel was so accommodating and really an exceptional value. We stayed at Palomar for our 5 year anniversary and they sent up a bottle of champagne and strawberries. The rooftop terrace at the hotel was our favorite part. We spent a lot of time up there sunbathing and also having drinks after dinner. The location is perfect, close to every restaurant and attraction we wanted to visit. The staff was great and the happy hour was fun. They even brought out complimentary mushroom, truffle oil pizza with white sangria. Our only small complaint was around the waiting time for the elevators, seemed a bit slow with only two for the hotel. Other than that minor issue, everything was flawless. Thanks again to the entire staff, I've been raving to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: bbearden
Reviews.Content: We have never been to Chicago and just returned from a great vacation. This is so sad to admit, but the most fun was happy hour at the Hotel Palomar. They offer free snacks and drinks from 5-6 pm and we enjoyed talking to the other guests during this time. I don't know if it was alcohol or what, but the guests here were so friendly and fun. I picked the hotel from trip advisor and again not disappointed. The employees were great (jessica) and the very nice guy with the cool hat that greeted us on arrival. (I never got his name since our taxi driver had a fender bender as he pulled up in front of the hotel. A little chaotic.) Every employee was extremely nice and friendly. This is the only place to stay in Chicago. Great location too. Centrally located on State st. Great job Palomar, keep it up. I will try to find Kimpton hotels in all the cities we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: ISA51
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about the Kimpton Brand hotels - this was another great stay, with friendly staff, spotless rooms in a great location. If you need to be in this area of the city, this is a great boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it, just for the robes”
Reviews.Author: CharltonEd
Reviews.Content: The room was great, all mod cons and really comfortable. It even had a great view. Only on opening the wardrobe did we get a shock. Zebra and Leopard skin style bath robes. When we stopped laughing we went out to the blues club a couple of blocks down to recover. The pool and pool balcony are really good, but one small thing please Palomar, have a non kids time for the pool so you can swim more than a yard at a time !

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable - even though I was alone!”
Reviews.Author: lisap921
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference back in March (sorry such a late review) and stayed at the Palomar. I chose this hotel based on proximity to Michigan Ave and where my conference was held AND the #2 rating on Trip Advisor! This was my first "big girl" business trip alone and I was nervous. The front desk staff was great and showed me where my conference was on a map, as well as restaurants, stores, etc. I asked about. On the first night I ate at the bar which is part of their restaurant. The bartender was great and everything he recommended from the menu was amazing! The room itself was probably the nicest I've ever stayed and I'm a frequent traveler. Immaculate bathroom, extremely comfortable bedding and a nicer flatscreen than what I have at home! The walls and door were also very thick and I didn't hear anything during the night. Spectacular floor to ceiling window with great views of the city. The doorman was so sweet and hailed a cab for me every morning. The coffee bar in the lobby was also very convenient. Whenever I travel now I will ALWAYS check to see if there is a Kimpton Hotel nearby....it was a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, friendly hotel with great rooms, just not near the fitness centre!”
Reviews.Author: runaway_with_me
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from an amazing trip to Chicago with my husband, celebrating our anniversary and FINALLY seeing U2, woot-woot! Hotel Palomar was really nice. Each and every staff member were very friendly and went out of their way to help out. Great location, clean, modern, spacious rooms with comfortable beds. Just make sure you do not get a room anywhere near the fitness centre, which is on the 17th floor. (Underneath it would probably be the worst!) The first morning, we were woken up bright-and-early by what sounded like a bowling alley next door! The same thing happened again the next morning, so my husband went out to investigate. (Along with another annoyed guest.) Turns out, it was weights being dropped on the floor. Thank God staff were sympathetic, and upgraded us to a "Spa Suite" on the 16th floor, away from the fitness centre's location. Shower heads could be better, but other than those two things, we will definitely stay at this hotel again the next time we visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Refeshing modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: cruzinquick
Reviews.Content: Hip digs in a cool new Chicago high rise. Nice size rooms, quiet, well designed, and good location north side of river. Friendly staff makes it a nice place away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel, superb location”
Reviews.Author: ZCastro
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent. It didn't get straight 5's for only one reason--room size. The standard king we booked was sold out so we were upgraded (yeah!) to a king with a little sitting area. I'm not sure what the exact title of that is, but the sitting area is necessary. Without it, the room would've been a little tight. Nevertheless, the bed was comfy, bathroom gorgeous and very clean. I highly recommend Sable, the in-house restaurant. Try the war if the roses drink and the veggie burgers. You will not be disappointed. Location is perfect! Many restaurants are walking distance as are great shops. Get the citypass if you plan on hitting the most popular tourist spots (field museum, willis tower, aquarium, etc). We didn't get it and we spent a lot more money. All in all, wonderful place to visit and it all starts with a fantastic hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant anniversary celebration”
Reviews.Author: Phokingsizebed
Reviews.Content: The rate was great: $169 A modernized interior design The concierge team sent up a complimentary bottle of chandon sparkling wine along with some strawberries and chocolate. Great view from the 17th floor balcony. BEWARE: the hotel is in DIRE need of a hot tub and the pool was so cold my dic froZe off lollzzz :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WRR_Bris
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Kimpton property for 4 nights in late June. Our room was well appointed and the hotel's location was excellent, being close to a red line station. The roof level pool was relaxing after a hard day's sight seeing. We had breakfast in the restaurant once and could not complain. Being a Kimpton In-touch member, the free wireless internet was very useful. Overall, The Palomor lives up to the Kimpton brand.

Reviews.Title: “Another great Kimpton”
Reviews.Author: Jan5776
Reviews.Content: I found Kimpton hotels several years ago and stay there whenever I can. This was my first trip to the Hotel Palomar in Chicago and it was one of the best. Friendly, helpful staff, beautiful, comfortable rooms and many little extra that made the stay that much better. I will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Sheptorious
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Palomar over Memorial Day weekend was wonderful. The hotel has a great location near plenty of great spots to eat, drink, and shop. It is also conveniently adjacent to the Grand/State CTA station. I was in a City View King on the 12th floor which boasted a floor to ceiling window with a decent view. The decor was pleasant and all the lights had a dimming mechanism which was nice to come back to in the evening. The bathroom was very clean, the shower had great pressure and temperature, and the provided products were beyond adequate. Free wi-fi is provided if you register for free with Kipton's Reward program. The facilities of the hotel match or exceed the high standards of their guest rooms. The lobby has an impressive, modern feel to it and foreshadows what the rest of your stay holds in store!Â  Overall, a great hotel. I look forward to staying here again and will seek out Kimpton hotels based on this standard of excellence.

Reviews.Title: “This is a fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cyosser
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went here for our anniversary. We absolutely loved it. The most memorable things are the customer service, amenities, and the complimentary cocktail hour. The front desk was very friendly and helpful, giving suggestions of where to eat (I recommend one stop for lunch is Quartino's down the street). They have a great deck and pool on the 15th floor (I think). Great place for to relax if the weather is not too hot. Great views. Each day, they had a cocktail hour. They had a fantastic drink called the "war of the roses". You have to try it. They also served white and red wine, and a sangria. In that hour, they also had an appetizer. One night we had deviled eggs (I know, a little odd choice), and the second day, they had thin crust pizza. Since they knew it was our anniversary, they brought us a complimentary bottle of wine (nice touch). The restaurant was very nice to grab a late night desert. For those that like to excercise, they have classes, and runs you can do with other hotel guests. Rooms are very clean and well appointed. I would definitely come here again for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a short stay in the city”
Reviews.Author: avmiddleton
Reviews.Content: Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at the Palomar. The room was spacious and beautifully decorated, the staff friendly. We were there during (but not for) St. Patty's Day festivities, so it was quite busy and loud around the hotel, but that's to be expected. The wine service in the evenings is quite lovely. Good location, but staying closer to Michigan might be more ideal for some. The only quip we had with the staff was waiting nearly 45 minutes for our car to be brought up from valet/overnight parking garage after a staff member mis-labeled our car keys and couldn't find our vehicle. However, as smart city travelers, we were prepared for something like this, so crisis averted.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel to Redeem All Other Hotels”
Reviews.Author: irieisle
Reviews.Content: This is what hotel service means: a personalized email to welcome me a couple of days before I arrive, clean and modern hotel, beautiful amenities in the basic room to still make you feel special, plush, cotton terry animal print robes, spa tub, well designed facilities, and a free Barre class on Tuesday mornings in their gym! I'm a super picky gal - and normally a Starwood hotel goer - but Hotel Palomar will be my hoice in Chicago from now on!

Reviews.Title: “A true gem and a fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: gables79
Reviews.Content: This gem is located in the Near North section of downtown Chicago just a short walk to the River and Loop area attractions. We stayed in a double queen which had more than enough space for my wife and I and our two teenagers. The CTA red line is literally across the street. Take this to go to Wrigley Field. The orange and brown lines are about a 5-6 block walk (10-15 minutes). Buy a one day Fun Pass that allows you unlimited bus and EL train rides for 24 hours. Pizzeria UNO and Due are very short walks from the hotel but go a little further and eat at Giordano's instead. The hotel staff were young, polite and very helpful. The hotel has a heated lap pool on the 17th floor (roof) that is lighted in a cool, blue neon at night. Would definitely come back to this hotel on my next trip to the Windy City!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Chicago Experience”
Reviews.Author: ChocFrog75
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful experience at the Palomar during my stay in Chicago. The hotel is ideally located within walking distance from the Magnificent Mile and other attractions, and public transport is literally on its doorstep. The area also offers good dining options. The hotel is nicely decorated, offering nice touches such as very high quality bath products, complimentary tea and coffee in the morning and wine in the afternoon. The room was lovely, with a great view and one of the best hotel beds I have ever slept in. The hotel bar is also very nice. Cocktails recommended! Overall, I would go back without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel, Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: NewOrleansKendall
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. We booked 2 rooms for my step daughter's sweet sixteen birthday. Upon arrival the front desk clerk wished her happy birthday and that evening a very nice chocolate dipped treat was brought to our room. The morning coffee and tea service was delicious and they even have a great wine happy hour event in the evening. Location was great. I mean what more can I say, except VIsit Chicago in the Summer time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ef59
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business based on great reviews. Loved up to its ratings. Great location and bedding and room quality outstanding. great service. I also ate at Sable the night I got in, wonderful small plate experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: MTnLZ
Reviews.Content: Very nice upscale hotel. Great location and would most definitely stay at again. Nice job Palomar!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BurlingameTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palomar (3 nights) for our anniversary. Hotel location is perfect - very close to the L. Staff was very helpful - we requested a higher floor and got moved to the 17th (top) floor. Heard a knock on the door and the hotel management had sent us a nice bottle of champagne - very nice touch. The wine/mixed drinks reception each evening was very well done - any choices and pizza. The restaurant in the hotel is great - we had breakfast there. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Smitty70
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights and loved it! Comfortable, well appointed rooms, friendly service, delicious restaurant, eco-friendly, and a great location. Our parking was included due to a special internet deal. Another Kimpton Hotel success, and we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: KLKentucky
Reviews.Content: This was a "spur-of-the-moment" trip for us to Chicago to visit family and to just hang out and have fun, so we didn't book our room until we were on the road and within 4 hours of Chicago. I found it online through several travel web sites - all reviews were consistent and good, so we took a chance and were able to book a room. We had a wonderful stay and feel lucky to have found such a nice hotel at a good price, close to Michigan and the sites we were interested in visiting. We were greeted immediately upon arrival at Hotel Palomar by Patrick at the valet drop off. He and the staff at the front desk gave us excellent recommendations and assistance booking restaurants, bars, taxis, limo service and shopping. Our room was quite large and very clean (standard double queens) - only thing I saw were dark fingerprint smudges on the closet door. Beds, pillows and linens were comfy and quite nice. Decor was contemporary chic, but comfortable and we didn't feel we were lacking anything. We enjoyed the floor-to-ceiling windows with a view of the city as well. We ordered room service one evening, which was pretty good. My husband ate breakfast downstairs and he was very happy with the taste and size of the meal. I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT HONEYMOON”
Reviews.Author: DjExcitement
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon and it was amazing! We paid for a basic room, and becauce of our honeymoon we got an upgrade to the king size deluxe suite and they gave us wine and flowers as well. The staff was friendly and showed interest in us. The doormen are amazing as well. They work tirelessly to find you taxis, and they were beyond attentive. My only gripe is that the attached restuarant isn't at the same quality of the rest of the hotel. But you are in the middle of everything (walk 5 minutes to get to a ton of restaurants, shopping, groceries, attractions, etc) so just get out and explore! This was by far the best place I've ever stayed at in my young life (34years old)... I eagerly await to make it back there.. I still can't get over the value.. I was looking at the Trump hotels when we booked this and the Palomar was 1/3 the price!! Palomar deserves all the praise it is getting, it was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks a million for making us feel so special!”
Reviews.Author: iriscin
Reviews.Content: A big thanks to Mike and the rest of the Hotel Palomar staff. We stayed three nights over the long holiday weekend and at check in they asked us why we had come to Chicago. In passing we told them about it being my Husband's birthday and our Anniversay. We headed out for the afternoon to do some shopping and upon our return we could not have been more surprized to find Champange and Strawberries with Sauce waiting for us along with a card wishing us best on both of our special events! The hotel was clean, hip and all around a fun place to be in the heart of the city. Plus if you have not eaten at Sable yet - go just for that!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE Plaomar Hotel”
Reviews.Author: demka30
Reviews.Content: Hi stay 3 day that hotel and totally LOVE IT front desk so helpful room was so nice clean near hotel u have a lot of option go to eat and more also couple blocks a lot shopping store for u I for sure back to Palomar Hotel!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A really good hotel in a top location with good service”
Reviews.Author: Adventurer365
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palomar for seven nights. It is in an ideal location just North of the river, an easy walk everywhere. The standard of service and accommodation is very high. The true test is when something goes wrong. On our last full day we had a water leak in our room. Ashlee, on reception, handled the problem very smoothly, with no fuss and had us in another great room in half an hour. The hotel offers all the little extras and if younare a club member the free WiFi is a bonus. The gym is perhaps the best I have used in an hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LennartH
Reviews.Content: The Palomar Chicago is a nice boutique hotel in downtown Chicago, near to the river and ideally located for exploring the city. The rooms are big and well cleaned, everything you need is available. When you register with their loyalty program, you get free WiFi and 10$ credit for the mini bar. In the evening, there is a hosted wine tasting hour in the living room. The hotel's design is great, warm and modern. The staff is caring. There was no problem to print some rail tickets for us - just send them per mail to the receptionist. In one of the highest floors, you find the pool with stunning views on the architecture near to the river.

Reviews.Title: “I felt like the best part of my trip started when I checked into my hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Werewolfindallas
Reviews.Content: I checked in the week of the National food and beverage convention that took over most hotels. Having said that I never felt more like a friend than another quest in a busy hotel. From the kindness of the frontdesk staff to the expertise of Mark the MVP Concierge; I felt they wanted to help and they new how to do so with ease. Mark's recommendations were spot on and smart. He also coordinated my fedex box and the architecture tour that was awesome! Joe from the hotel restaurant Sable seemed to be there every time I was to welcome me in and share some of his recommendations for drinks of the awesome food. Im not sure Kimpton knows just how much of a Pro his really is. What a great guy.The bar and the dinning room were both beautiful and made me feel cooler than I am. I met Heather the Executive Chef who was spot on when she said the chorizo enchiladas were the best. The pool looked great but we never took a dip in it. We did check out the beautiful view on the 17th floor terrace over white wine that we acquired from the wine reception served by the Hotel's management. Long story short..I was blown away from everyone's kindness, the look of my spacious room and I could not beat the location. I cannot wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Cherry on our cake”
Reviews.Author: Rmarbut
Reviews.Content: We went to Chicago for a birthday celebration. While all plans were based around our dinner we were greeted by such friendly and pleasant staff. The rooms were great and there was even a nice birthday note from the staff along with a bottle of wine. Our experience here certainly added to the celebration.

Reviews.Title: “Striving to be hip”
Reviews.Author: rube1950
Reviews.Content: This newer hotel just a few blocks from the Miracle Mile has a lot to offer. We had a deluxe king room and it was spacious and well-appointed, down to the tiger and zebra print robes. The bed was quite comfortable and the bathroom was what you would expect of a hotel at this level, although there was nothing particularly special about it. We noticed right away that the hotel was aiming for a younger, hipper clientele although we saw many other guests in our age group (baby boomers). The decor in the rooms, including the massive sliding bathroom door, the robes, the modern art on the hallway walls and the illuminated room numbers, to note just a few, were a clear attempt by the hotel to set itself apart from its competitors. We enjoyed the wine tastings, the complimentary morning coffee and afternoon jelly beans. Despite our not being the apparent target audience, we felt quite comfortable and would consider this hotel for our next Chicago visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Dagreat1sp
Reviews.Content: Very trendy place and enjoyable. Little more than I would like to spend, we weren't in the room most of the time but when we were it was great. Amazing trip from start to finish great staff, amenities, and service. I would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Friendly Staff = Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: rch_sa
Reviews.Content: We mentioned that we were celebrating our anniversary when making the reservation and were congratulated when checking in. We went walking around (check out Jazz Record Mart) and when we came back, we had champagne and chocolate strawberries waiting for us in the room. Nice touch. Kimpton has become our hotel chain of choice.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints, good location”
Reviews.Author: UncleBuff
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last october while in town for the marathon. Great location, close to almost everything, as Chicago is a great walking city. It was clean, service was good, and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Room and Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: mkjava
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Palomar in Chicago due to the many positive reviews that we saw in TripAdvisor, and those reviews were right. This hotel was one of the nicest that we've stayed at in quite some time. The decor was excellent, the room was spacious and comfortable, the staff was very friendly, and the location was perfect. Even with all of that, the price was great too, an excellent value compared to other comparable Chicago hotels. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: mpd_11
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Hotel Palomar 3 times now, in 1/11, 2/11 and 4/11, and love everything about it. The customer service is outstanding, from the front desk staff to the AGM, Joe. The rooms were spotless. Flat screen TV's. Nice fitness center and pool. Complimentary wine in the evenings, coffee in a.m.; hot apple cider and hot chocolate on a frigid Saturday afternoon in Jan. Great location for walking to restaurants, bars, Mag Mile shopping. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff; you will be happy at the Palomar”
Reviews.Author: mikeormichael
Reviews.Content: Just returned from long weekend stay at Hotel Palomar. I recommend it without hesitation. I found it to be a great value too. I give it a solid 4+ out of 5. There was nothing wrong with the hotel, but I do reserve 5 for truly special hotels...of which there are a handful in Chicago, but not many. Give me the Palomar over any mariott or hilton any day. The bell and lobby staff were very all very kind and courteous. The evening free wine tastings were a nice touch and a good way to relax. The room it self was extremely clean. Everything was new or almost new and in good working order. I think we were upgraded to a jr. suite, as our room had a small couch and table. The TV was a bit far away from the bed, but Iâ€™d happily take the couch in the room over TV at the foot of the bed. The bathroom was nice, shower had good temperature and pressure. nice towels and robes. Enough counterspace for my spouse to have all her stuff. Like several of the newer boutique hotels Iâ€™ve stayed at, the bathroom door was a sliding door, but was very heavy and closed well, offering enough privacy. Ordered room service and the food was promptly delivered and very good. We had a drink in the bar which is very trendy and popular. Not impressed with the waitstaff though as they were inattentive and uninterested in our table. The location is good, a good 10 minute walk from upper River North and areas like Water Tower. One distraction is that State St is under a lot of construction near the hotel â€“ so it isnâ€™t easy to walk right there and traffic can be bad, but the bell hop was always able to get us a taxi in less than 1 min. There is a 7-11 right next door and a starbucks in a hotel down the block. So easy to get your bottled water or morning coffee if you donâ€™t want room service.

Reviews.Title: “great location but just okay”
Reviews.Author: amybdetroit
Reviews.Content: Great location! The Thai restaurant across the street (I believe it was called Star of Siam) is really great. Walking distance to shopping and House of Blues. The room wasn't very large but we didn't spend a lot of time in it anyway. We enjoyed the wine reception in the living room area; quite a nice touch. We even met some other guests who were from our area. The young man at the door, who always wore his own stylish hat, was so friendly and personable! Now here are the cons. My husband and I have stayed at the Conrad and never heard as many sirens and fire trucks as we heard at this hotel. So I'm wondering if it's just in a pathway emergency vehicles take often or if the windows aren't as sound proof. We were disappointed our room did not have a coffee maker. We had to go to the living room area to get our coffee if we wanted it. Service at this hotel was inconsistent. The desk was run by young 20somethings and most of the time when walking past you wouldn't get a greeting. There were typically 4 employees at the front desk so it wasn't that they were too busy. When checking in it seemed I was bothering them. Strange behavior for such a highly rated hotel. The hotel's restaurant bar was very understaffed. There was one bartender and when we walked in we were not greeting by either the hostess or the bartender. We sat at a table in the bar for 10 minutes before finally leaving. Again, nothing was said to us. I'm a very friendly customer so do not miscontrue this review as me being demanding and snooty. I wasn't too upset about all of this because if you aren't happy with a place there are dozens you can try. However, I know for the price I do expect a few things that were missing and I won't stay here again. As my husband put it, "it's just missing something." Definitely warmth for one. Next year we'll stay at the Conrad again.

Reviews.Title: “great stay with teens”
Reviews.Author: 123hat
Reviews.Content: Great find! 2 moms with 4 kids combined loved this spot. The hotel gladly matched a great price we found at a discount site and it was all positive from there. The location was fantastic for city exploration by foot and subway but it was the outstanding service that really made this place special. All requests were happily met from housekeeping to the front staff. They were incredibly knowledgable about restaurants, directions and all questions were dealt with in a sincerely warm and friendly manner. Very clean, comfortable and quiet on the upper floors. Nothing bad to say!

Reviews.Title: “A boutique hotel with style and comfort, idealy located.”
Reviews.Author: VFrequentTravellers
Reviews.Content: Brilliant experience(unlike LA version). Staff excellent and attentive. Rooms wonderful with Wifi everywhere! Great pool and gym. Nice breakfast and in the best location. Walk everywhere, subway across the road and the concierge got great Bulls tickets! We are frequent travellers and fussy re accom. (hate big chains, like character).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel on Great (State) Street”
Reviews.Author: Ray-Oh
Reviews.Content: Wife, daughter, and I just spent our spring break in Chicago. The weather didn't cooperate, rain and snow--but the Hotel Palomar did. What a fantastic hotel. Service was superb, including quick responses to minor nuisances. Doorman staff was excellent. The free wine bar each evening was lively, along with good wine. Location was great right on State street just blocks from Michigan Avenue. Some subway construction in front of hotel, but a non issue as far as sleeping and getting around. Gym and pool on top floor, both top notch. I highly recommend the Hotel Palomar.

Reviews.Title: “They take customer service to new level ...”
Reviews.Author: InMyOwnW0rds
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers we found the service at the Palomar top notch. With all the traveling that we have done I can honestly say that there are only 2 hotels that have surpassed service expectations for me - one is in NYC - the other is the Palomar in Chicago. Before we even arrived the Palomar was at our service asking if we were celebrating anything in particular. I told them that we were in fact celebrating a couple of milestones and when we came back up from the first wine reception there was a bottle of champagne on ice waiting for us. Since our flight arrived at 11:00 I had asked for an early check in if available. We had a beautiful one bedroom suite and it was ready for us when we got to the hotel at noon. Reservations at a popular restaurant were made for us on the spot at the front desk as well as directions on which line on the transit system to use to reach different destinations. The room was spotless - the soaking tub was awesome ! We met quite a few interesting fellow travelers at the wine reception every night. The location was perfect - I overheard another couple comment on the great location at the wine reception which opened up a line of communication between our tables and we ended up meeting some very interesting people. There was a huge Jewel OSCO outlet just up the street where you could buy groceries of all kinds and a great selection of wine. The subway was just steps away as well. The only thing - as another reviewer pointed out that came in very handy to me was .... bring your own shower cap - for some reason it is not included in their toiletries - perhaps if you requested one they would supply one. There are also a lot of great restaurants close by - The Weber Grill is just across the street and there is a Chili's just down the street - as well as the hotels own restaurant. The General Manager - Nabil - was a fantastic host and made everyone feel special and welcomed. There is no doubt that future stays in Chicago will be at the Palomar - why risk disappointment anywhere else? Become a member of The Kimpton Group and enjoy their free add-ons (it's free).

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: DutchessSam
Reviews.Content: I will preface this review by saying that I am super high maintenence in terms of cleanliness and such and I was super nervous travelling with all the talk about bed bugs. So I did some heavy duty research online for hotels in Chicago prior to booking this and by the sounds of everything I read this was my best option. Well Hotel Palomar did not disappoint. This was truly my best travel experience thus far; and I have travelled quite a bit. First, I had called the night before to say that we were travelling for my sister and my cousin's 40th birthday and to see if we could possibly get an upgrade. Upon our arrival we were greeted by Colin whom helped us out of our cab; he was awesome, super friendly and helpful. Then at the front desk we met Jessica whom was equally as friendly. Although an upgrade wasn't available we were welcomed in our room with a birtdhay note and a bottle of wine for the girls to celebrate. This was an upexpected touch that made a huge difference. The room itself was small but comfortable and very, very clean. We had an amazing view being that we were in a corner room and the corner was floor to ceiling window. The wine reception daily was amazing. The pizza was the best I have ever had which gave me cravings for pizza the entire weekend. Our last day there we decided that we wanted to do something special like go to the hockey game and so we were introduced to Charles, the hotel concierge. He was amazing and was able to get us 4 seats together for a Playoff hockey game at an amazing price. When we were leaving the next morning we had been give a personalized note from Colin that was very sweet. There isn't a single thing that I could complain about, the hotel was amazing and I will now look for Kimpton's no matter where I am travelling too. I just hope that they can live up to the standard that Hotel Palomar set. Thank you all for the hospitality and we hope to come back soon!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LucyEths
Reviews.Content: The rooms were outstanding and the hotel was elegant. Subway access was right on the corner and lots of shopping near by. Everything was within walking distance. The bar and restaurant seemed like it would have been great only the hostess took 20 minutes to even look up to ask us if we wanted to wait for a table. Other than that, great hotel in a great location. Try to find a discounted room otherwise it's a little pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Really great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: msefidan
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at a Kimpton branded hotel and I have to admit that I am totally and fully impressed. Pros: The Palomar is trendy, but not trendy to the point where any comfort is sacrificed. The service is fantastic and the staff is friendly. They gave us early check in and the hotel manager personally emailed me the day before my arrival asking if I needed anything special. I thought that was pretty cool. Every night they have free wine tasting with thin crust pizza. A great touch. The workout facility was top notch. The room was very clean and the carpet plush. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was very nice with granite upscale touches you'd expect in a luxury hotel along with Kohler faucets. Free internet for Kimpton members (free membership) $10 worth of mini-bar credit. Turn down service in the evening. Subway station is around the corner (very convenient) Cons Not a lot of cons, but perhaps the rooms aren't enormous in size. I guess I shouldn't expect that from a downtown Chicago hotel. No microwave or mini-fridge. Again, not many luxury hotels have these, as they expect you will be not be bringing home leftovers.

Reviews.Title: “Special Weekend to Remember”
Reviews.Author: jlossner
Reviews.Content: For the past several weeks I have been planning my proposal in Chicago. I wanted everything to be perfect including our place of stay for the 4 night trip. Hotel Palomar ended up being amazing and in fact played a central role to our weekend. Upon arrival we enjoyed a short walk to all that Mag Mile has to offer. Upon our return to the Palomar I coaxed her into exploring the hotel. After ushering her to 17th floor patio I surprised her by popping the question while taking in the beautiful views. The hotel staff was â€œinâ€� on the plan and made everything perfect. They upgraded our room, sent us a bottle of champagne and seemed to take a special interest in our stay. We enjoyed the wine reception in the â€œliving-roomâ€� and shared our exciting news with other guests as well as the always smiling staff. The room was clean, comfortable, (the in-room jetted tub was great!) and the staff was always on point. The location couldnâ€™t have been better. It served as a great central base with short walks to Millennium Park, the Navy Pier, all of the shopping/dining on State, Rush, Michigan Ave and more. The pool was a little cold for her, but the views were fantastic. This Hotel will continue to serve as a special spot (for all of the reasons above) for us for years to come.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite business hotel - great choice especially with sale prices”
Reviews.Author: sss45
Reviews.Content: We are Kimpton Hotel fans and had previously stayed at the Allegro and Monaco. Had been waiting to try the Palomar and was not disappointed in any way. The location is quiet, convenient (two blocks from Miracle Mile), and close to many dining options for any time of day. I booked my reservation online and was surprised to get a personal email from one of the hotel managers prior to my trip asking if they could assist in any way. Since I was arriving very late, I dropped a reply asking them to make sure my room was held. Mateo at the front desk couldn't have been more welcoming and I received a lovely corner room on a high floor having booked the "double double" special. Rooms are very well laid out with the usual Kimpton amenities - super comfortable beds and pillows. Having spent too many nights this year in mid-priced chains with noisy heater fans, it was a welcome relief to have a quiet, modern system which kept pace with the chilly temps outdoors. Several of us dined at Sable Kitchen for dinner, breakfast and for cocktails in the bar one evening. I didn't think the breakfast menu was anything special - my colleague's oatmeal was watery and my omelet run of the mill. You can probably do better at the Weber Grill or EATT just a block or two away. However, the bar service (Katie) was excellent with a wide variety of interesting cocktails. In the morning, there's a very large room set up in the main lobby area with free coffee and lots of newspapers, bigger than many other Kimpton reception areas. It was painless to get taxis even with some minor street constructions and a town car option was indeed the same price as a taxi when offered up - with far better service. All in all this was one of the best business hotel venues I've stayed at in the US and I'll definitely be back next trip to Chicago. The price/value with discounted room rates is a no-brainer.

Reviews.Title: “In a word, superb”
Reviews.Author: SFMidwesterner
Reviews.Content: I felt compelled to leave a review on TripAdvisor because of how much we loved our stay at the Palomar. We did a one-night stay over Spring Break (staycation) with our two children, and to celebrate our anniversary. Upon check-in we were given milk & cookie vouchers for the kids and a free movie credit. The staff was extremely friendly, courteous and helpful - we even had someone deliver extra robes for our children, literally seconds before I was goiong to call down for some. The hotel and rooms are very hip (floor to ceiling windows) and clean, not large, but well laid out. The gym has aerobic equipment and some universal weights, but no free weights (no biggie). The pool is gorgeous, great views of the city, and well lit at night. We had a delicious meal at the connecting Sable Kitchen & Bar - raves there too (and we are serious foodies). I can't say enough good things about the Palomar Hotel - we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, clean and modern decor, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: ScubaLar
Reviews.Content: The Palomar is an excellent choice if you are looking for a place to stay within walking distance to the shopping of north .Michigan Ave and vicinity. It is also located near house of blues and theaters. Beautiful hotel with new rooms and trendy decor. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed.”
Reviews.Author: Katie258
Reviews.Content: We expected more. The room was nice. We paid a little extra for a corner room but the windows on one wall were pretty much useless. Should have just stayed in a regular King room. Internet is not included. The pool was nice but always full so we never got to use it and no whirlpool! The fitness room is excellent. The resteraunt was booked while we were there so can not comment on the food either. Overall I wish I had stayed at Trump or another larger hotel. Advantage was that the subway and bus stations are right outside the door.

Reviews.Title: “LOOOOOOVED every minute”
Reviews.Author: StephtravelsSC
Reviews.Content: First time in Chicago, first time at Hotel Palomar... loved them both. What a fabulous location right on the red line (only one change to/from Midway). Super friendly staff, willing to print out restaurant recommendations and directions. They even had an option on the breakfast door hanger to print out your boarding pass!! (WOW). They upgraded us for our anniversary, gave us a complimentary bottle of champagne, comped us an appetizer in the attached restaurant (try the cheese curds- a mid-west experience), free wine and apps at lobby reception EVERY night and free internet if you're a Kimpton member(very easy to sign up). So, book this classy hotel and enjoy all Chicago has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with the Hotel Palomar”
Reviews.Author: woody88
Reviews.Content: This past weekend, my husband, parents, and I traveled to Chicago. We have stayed at many of the 4 and 5 star hotels in the city. Hotel Palomar is our new favorite. Like the other reviewers, our rooms were ready when we arrived in the morning. We had two spa rooms, and thought they were very comfortable and spacious. The bathrooms were large and very nice. Staff: Every person that worked at the hotel was professional, friendly, and fun to talk with. They were all very helpful. Location: Extremely convenient to shopping, dining, nightlife, etc. Although we did not eat at the adjoining restaurant, we did go there for drinks. It was very social and nice. We also went to the wine reception from 5:00-6:00. The wine choices were good and the staff brought out pizzas throughout the hour. It was very nice. We are loyalty members and loved the fact that we received $10 off our mini-bar purchases, and free wireless. We will definitely stay at the hotel Palomar on our future stays. We had 0 negatives and all positives.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: tcanyon
Reviews.Content: Everything was great from start to finish. We traveled with two teenagers and an infant and the hotel staff was very accommodating. Nice to have a kids menu for breakfast options and excellent location. Right off the magnificent mile. The bar had a great drink menu and selection.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent new property, great design”
Reviews.Author: DenverDoug88
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 very comfortable nights at this year-old property, in a very nicely designed room with good bedding, fast wifi and friendly front desk help. Would recommend this property and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: jbg2
Reviews.Content: I chose the Palomar after reading the reviews on tripadvisor. The rooms are immaculate and the beds are very comfortable. We liked the location of the hotel and its proximity to public transit, Michigan Ave., good restaurants and the theatre district. I found the service to be inconsistent as another reviewer reported. On our first night there, we had turn down service with chocolates left on our pillows. The next three nights, no one came into the room. I called down and inquired about the service and for the rest of the stay, we received the service (truthfully, all I wanted was the chocolates). I also found that some times the staff at the front of the hotel went out of their way to open the door and greet us while other times they didn't open the door. As a caution to future guests, avoid the 16th floor under the pool. We initially were put on the 16th floor. I asked the woman who was checking us in if we were under the pool and she told us we weren't. It turns out we were under the pool and I could definitely hear the water noises. The staff offered to change our room that night but I was too tired to move. The next day we did change our room. All in all it was a good stay. I would definitely return again. However, if traveling with my whole family (5 people) I would look at Homewood Suites or Residence Inn for the space.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service!”
Reviews.Author: LeisureTraveler42
Reviews.Content: The first thing we noticed upon our arrival is how friendly the valet attendant was!! He ushered us into the hotel, where the amazingly friendly staff -- and I mean amazing, I haven't been treated like this since I don't know when-- greeted us warmly WITH goody bags for our two kids and a complimentary wine hour. Well that was certainly a good start! We had connecting rooms which had the curiously inconvenient quality that the doors wouldn't stay open unless propped with our suitcases. Still, a small inconvenience. The beds were not terribly comfortable but I'm pretty picky about this. Our room rate seemed better than most in Chicago, which is why we chose it, but maybe the lower price mirrors the lesser quality of the beds...? If I were to sum up the Palomar, I would say it's hip and stylish without an ounce of pretentiousness, perfectly inviting for families with kids, a fantastic pool upstairs with great evening lighting, ideal location, and a great value. We would make a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Girls Weekend Paradise”
Reviews.Author: bnucki
Reviews.Content: We had gotten an awesome steal of a deal on our reservations for March 18th-20th due to my subscription to Travel Ticker. Official check in was at 3 pm, but we arrived a little before then (2:30) thanks to missing traffic into town. State Street is undergoing reservations so due to some road construction the hotel's entrance is slightly obstructed, but from the moment we pulled in we had a fabulous stay. The bellmen were all super friendly and cracking jokes with us while they unloaded the multitude of luggage that 5 girls can pack. We were escorted to the desk and upon check in were told that we had been upgraded to a Luxury One Bedroom Suite instead of the traditional one bedroom suite that we had booked. We were in our room within 15 minutes of pulling into the entrance. We required a rollaway bed, and that was brought up about a half hour after getting into our room. Our room was super swanky and the bathtub had us all drooling (alas, due to the nature of the trip no one got to enjoy it.) We had requested a bottle of champagne as this was a Bachlorette getaway weekend and that arrived shortly after the rollaway. Upon check out we learned that the hotel had "treated" us to that as well, as it was not listed on our bill! We missed the wine hour as we were busy getting ready to go out. We spoke to both of the concierge's and they were both friendly and helpful with suggestions for restaurants and bars not only in the neighborhood, but in different neighborhoods in the city. Upon our 4 am arrival with two gigantic bags of McDonald's and 5 rather silly girls, we weren't met with disdain but rather a look of "glad you ladies are having fun!" They were booked to capacity on Friday so were not able to accomdate our request for an extra blanket, but the next day it was in our room after it had been cleaned, as were extra towels that we had forgotten to request. We did not make the coffee bar on Saturday morning as we had slept through it, but the bellman was able to point us to two Starbucks within a two block radius. He even was quick to point out that one was "fast" while the other had a better "quality" product! Which as an avid Starbucks drinker, I appreciate. Saturday afternoon we did make the wine and appetizer hour which was delightful, if not a wee bit crowded. But there was a wedding in the hotel that day, and of course it was a Saturday. Again the concierge was beyond helpful in new suggestions for the evening's activities. Upon departure for our night in Wrigleyville we decided we wanted the SUV cab instead of a normal cab as there were 5 of us. And the same bellhop from our Friday check in literally spent 10 minutes in the street trying to wave down a SUV cab that was not on a run already. It may seem small, but that gesture meant a lot to us! Upon our arrival back at the hotel in the wee hours of the morning, we came across a waiter who had just finished working at Sable. Sable was closed, but he recommended a couple of places down the block that were just the ticket at that time in the morning. Sunday's departure was painless and fast....from the time I gave the bellman our parking ticket to when the car showed up was a grand total of MAYBE 10 minutes. The Hotel Palomar is the ONLY hotel any of the 5 us will stay at in our future travels to Chicago. The service and quality was impeccable and the staff was both friendly, professional, fun and intuitive. Do yourself a HUGE favor and BOOK THIS HOTEL for your next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the high rating it gets - awesome”
Reviews.Author: worldcitizen01
Reviews.Content: Brand new. Modern. Clean. Fantastic service. Glamorous. A fantastic hotel in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - my second stay. Slightly disappointed this time.”
Reviews.Author: VinceInLA
Reviews.Content: As a business traveler, we have a corporate rate at the Allegro, another Kimpton hotel nearby, but I was able to get a lower rate with AAA at the Palomar and jumped on it, having stayed there once before (and loved it). This time, my experience was not quite as good, but I'd still recommend the hotel. It's a beautiful property, with very nice rooms. Service levels this time were inconsistent. As another recent reviewer noted - the doorman was sometimes there, sometimes not. And I had to hail my own cab several times during my 6-night stay. In addition, the front desk staff was only mildly pleasant. They did not display the levels of friendliness and warmth that I have come to expect from Kimpton hotels. I was not greeted upon returning to the hotel, nor was I greeted upon exiting the elevators and leaving the hotel (even when there were no guests being helped). Plus, I'm not sure when turn-down service comes around, but I only managed to receive it ONCE during my stay, at 8:55pm. I had a comfortable corner room on the 7th floor. Unfortunately, I found that being on the 7th floor is too close to the street level, so I was constantly awakened by emergency vehicle sirens (I guess there is a fire station close by). Next time, I will request a higher floor. The beds are very comfortable, and the rooms are well-appointed with free wifi and large, flat-screen TVs. The fitness center is also very well-equipped for a hotel fitness center, with dumbbells, cable weights and several cardio machines. There was even a bowl of apples in the fitness center! I noticed that there were free bottles of water and towels placed near the front entrance to the hotel. The free coffee/tea in the morning and wine in the evening were nice touches. Upon the recommendation of a friend of mine, I dined at Sable, the restaurant attached to the hotel. Unfortunately, there was a group event at the restaurant's bar, which made my dining experience rather unpleasant (the noise that reached the dining room from the bar was unbearable). The food was good, but took a long time between dishes - it was definitely one of the slowest solo dining experiences I've ever had. The wait staff was VERY pleasant and attentive, though. I did encounter one problem during my stay, which was not resolved to my satisfaction - the guest account folio on my TV was not showing the room charges and taxes correctly (the dollar amounts were not showing up, only the cents). When I reported the issue to the front desk, they sent an engineer to look at it while I was at dinner. When I returned, the engineer had left a note in my room, explaining that I should wait about 10 seconds for the folio to load. He didn't even notice that the amounts were completely wrong. So, I took a photo of the screen and brought it back down to the front desk to show them the problem. She offered to send another engineer up, but since it was already 11pm, I declined. Overall, though, I still recommend this hotel. It's much newer than the Allegro, and the rooms are nicer. But the staff could use a little more training in customer service. In my previous stays at the Allegro, I was ALWAYS greeted by the doorman with a cheery "welcome back!"

Reviews.Title: “Everything we needed”
Reviews.Author: PerryM
Reviews.Content: Just spent five days at this great hotel. Front desk staff could not do enough for us whenever we had a query about the city or hotel services - very obliging and hugely efficient. Room was nicely decorated and of a good size. Yes, you can hear the fire engine sirens occasionally but Chicago is a big and busy city! Enjoyed the wine hour each night - perfect for getting us out of our room and socialising in the lobby. Would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: nim71
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with good size rooms and very comfortable bed. Very central for shops, restaurants. Top floor indoor swimming pool with fantastic views. Free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jlafrentz
Reviews.Content: Lots of pros at this hotel -- great staff, extremely clean hotel, very comfortable beds, neat decor, complimentary WiFi for Kimpton members, complimentary wine reception between 5-6, located very close to a lot of shopping, restaurants and attractions, nice work out room. Some cons -- volume on TV is maxed out at 48 (on purpose) which isn't a problem unless you are at a "low volume" point on the show/movie and you can't turn it up any louder or are hard of hearing, ice machines are on every other floor, no vending machines for pop or snacks (7 Eleven about a block away, thou), pool a little on chilly and smaller side, rooms a little on the small side for 2 adults and 2 teenagers. We got a $127/night thru the hotels website which the room was definately worth. We throughly enjoyed our stay here and look forward to going back whenever visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Belated Birthday at the Palomar”
Reviews.Author: IowaLen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to Chicago and stayed at the Palomar as a belated birthday present for her, which included hearing folk artist Richard Shindell at SPACE in Evanston, relaxing, playing tourist, seeing the Marin watercolors and other exhibits at the Art Institute, dining out and having a good time together. The Palomar staff was at all times gracious, attentive and accommodating. They surprised us with a complementary bottle of wine in our room as a birthday present and also directed us to restaurants and shops, explained the transit system and honored every request made. The hotel is ideally located; we walked to Cafe Iberico, Trader Joe's, bookstores, the Paper Store, American Girl (for our granddaughters, and the like, and hopped on the subway (the El) to Evanston, museums and other spots. The Grand Street El station is across the street from the hotel, easy on, easy off. We garaged the car the entire weekend -- construction makes finding the hotel entrance difficult and city traffic isn't worth the hassle. The joint was jumping because it was the weekend of the St. Patty's Day Parade. The guests partying in the adjoining room were very noisy at night -- although we could not hear noise from the pool across the hall -- but at our request, hotel staff requested the other guests to quiet down. I live in a college town but grew up in NYC, so I expect to hear sirens and other city noises even in insulated rooms. It would have been nice to have a telephone directory in the room or lobby, so we wouldn't have to rely on staff. Next time we'll bring a laptop because wifi is free when you sign up with Kimpton Hotels. We were unable to check out later than hoped, but the staff said it was because the hotel was fully booked that night. The room looks better in person than online. The bed was extremely comfortable, the shower spot-on, and the Park and Play rate was excellent. What's not to like? We intend to return.

Reviews.Title: “We're so grateful for a fantastic experience!”
Reviews.Author: TerriandDave
Reviews.Content: My husband and I desperately needed just one night away. We were celebrating Valentine's Day (one month later), my husband's birthday (that I was out of town on business for) and our 9th wedding Anniversary. I had called the Hotel Palomar the day before our stay trying to get restaurant recommendations, since our reservation plans had to be changed at the last minute. We only had time for a quick bite before heading to a concert. I spoke with Alison at the front desk and she was extremely kind and helpful. She gave me some suggestions and offered to make us a reservation. What a great first impression before even getting to the hotel! We rushed to get to the hotel last Saturday night and were greeted by another extremely friendly and helpful front desk person. He had informed us that we were upgraded to a suite to celebrate all of our special occasions! Not only was the suite gorgeous, huge and spotlessly clean, we arrived to find a bottle of wine, a cheese plate and a handwritten note from Alison. Knowing that we had such limited time between our arrival and the concert, she had snacks and drinks waiting for us. What a surprise!! It was so very appreciated and it set the tone for our entire stay. The suite was perfect and the ENTIRE STAFF of the Palomar went above and beyond to make our stay special. There are many beautiful hotels in the city of Chicago, but we will return to the Palomar for the personal touches and friendliness of the staff. If they read these reviews, "Thank you again for a fantastic experience! We can't stop telling our friends and family what a wonderful time we had at your hotel!"

Reviews.Title: “WOW FACTOR - Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: jade_32f
Reviews.Content: This trip was to celebrate my sister's 40th Birthday. We chose this hotel due to the reviews and location. From the moment we arrived we were treated wonderfully. Bleu helped bring up our bags and two days later even remembered my sister's birthday. We asked at check-in for a knife since we were making some cocktails in the room. We no sooner shut the door from having our luggage unloaded and there was a know on the door, they had brought up a china plate with a linen napkin with the knife. I noticed that the foam pillows I requested, due to allergies, were instead feather. I called the front desk, within 5 minutes housekeeping was there with new pillows and completely changed out the entire bed linens on my sister's bed since the comforter was down filled also. Every single request was met in no more than 10 minutes. The hotel pictures look exactly as shown. The restaurant food is great and the bartenders, especially Nate, are friendly and have yummy drinks! When I come back to Chicago, there will be no question where we will be staying! Thanks to ALL of the staff that make our stay truly wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Limeonade
Reviews.Content: Clean, well maintained, spacious and quiet room. Great location. Best business hotel stay ever.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: davidcalifornia
Reviews.Content: My positive impression of this hotel started before I arrived. The day before my arrival I received an email from Gad in guest services asking if I had any requests. I did, involving room location and a fan in my room. Gad responded in an email that he would take care of this, which he did. I was greeted with a big smile upon check in. The room was clean and quiet. (These two things are my priority in any hotel stay, a clean quiet room.) Every employee, without exception, was friendly and polite. And competent. Overall this was my best hotel expeience. I would urge any person going to Chicago to think about staying here.

Reviews.Title: “The Service is Better Than The Ritz-Carlton”
Reviews.Author: mdhgCharleston
Reviews.Content: Everything you read here is true. Kimpton rocks. I'm in the Kimpton loyalty program, and I highly recommend it, especially for women. All the little touches--the choice of pillows, newspapers, the extra treats in the room--are so nice. I loved the coffee bar in the morning and the water bottles to take with you when you head out the door for "free" and the service that prints your boarding pass out for you. The rooms are nice and the location is great and the restaurant is fantastic. It's just what you expect from Kimpton--a great property, a boutique hotel in a central location with it's own personality. I've stayed at 2 of the other Kimptons in Chicago and this is the fav. The difference really is the customer service. They gave me great tips on a spa to book and where to eat.
