I was a nursing mother, and a bit nervous about managing that with travel, but they made it easy. I had to ask for some special accommodations in the room, like an extra fridge, and they were so nice about it. They will take care of you every time, book with Kimpton. It's less expensive than the Ritz, but even better service.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jmjbwolf
Reviews.Content: I just spent the weekend at the Hotel Palomar, and I couldn't have been happier with everything about this hotel. We didn't have a car, so we rode the El from Midway to downtown by using the excellent directions provided on the hotel's website. When we came up to street level, the hotel was right there! You can't ask for anything better when you're carrying your luggage. Even though we arrived at about noon, they had a room ready and let us go ahead and check in. I think that's a really nice touch. We found the room to be immaculate. The only reason for my slightly lower rating on the room was its size. It was fine for just the two of us, but you may want to upgrade if you have more than two people in your room. We asked for directions many times, and we were always given great service and accurate information. The hotel's central location made it easy for us to walk to the Navy Pier, Hancock Tower, shops on Michigan Avenue and State Street. And with the El stop being right outside and the weather being rather cold, we took it a few times just to get out of the elements. No problems at all! The complementary wine in the evenings was really good. It did get quite crowded. One night we had our wine in the lobby, and the next night we just took it to our room. But, it was nice to have and a great way to relax after a long day and before dinner. The beds in the hotel were some of the most comfortable I've ever experienced at a hotel. And the pillows were perfect! It was so quiet in the room, never heard anything at all. We were on the 7th floor. A wonderful weekend and a great place to stay. Next time I visit, I will definitely be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter1973
Reviews.Content: This is my kind of hotel -- comfortable and relaxed, yet chic and professional. Great room. Great gym and pool. Great breakfast. Great location. Enjoyed the complimentary wine tasting, too!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience!”
Reviews.Author: TessieUSA
Reviews.Content: Our experience with the Polomar began with making reservations right through to the day the doorman said "good-bye". I called about a small suite and the person making the reservation not only found me a fabulous room price but it included parking! A deal since parking is expensive in Chicago. We had a one-bedroom suite. Everything from check-in through our 3 day stay was superb. Loved the staff--all helpful and so friendly. The evening wine in the living room (with flatbread pizza hor d'ourves) was a special treat. This is a pet friendly hotel and we saw several dogs (wish we had brought ours) and we never heard any of them. It was cool to have a few of them in the living room at the wine recpetion. The Palomair is an ideal locaton. My only hope is that as they get more popular, they don't raise their rates so high that they become too expensive to stay there. One note. We ate in the hotel restaurant and frankly, it was just ok. There are plenty of great restaurants in the area. Oh, and we had mentoined it being our 32nd wedding anniversary and a special strawberry treat awaited us in our room on arrival. It was GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite Chicago hotel”
Reviews.Author: CharlieWilmette
Reviews.Content: I live in the Chicago suburbs, so I only stay in downtown hotels for staycations and getaways. And I have now found my favorite place to stay! Came down for one night with wife and 2 kids (8 & 12), and was attracted by the positive reviews, reasonable rates, and fact they have a pool for the kids. Was hoping for good, but we got great, and will definitely be back. I indicated on my reservation my wife's birthday, and they gave us a nice corner room - not huge, but nice sized, with cool decor and very comfortable beds, cool view of city skyline. On check-in, they gave my kids each a goodie-bag and coupons for free room-service milk and cookies. PLUS, a coupon to "raid the minibar". While the kids relaxed post-swim in the room, we went downstairs for the complementary wine reception with tasty snacks - crowded, but chic. After dinner at a nearby restaurant (tons of good ones in close walking distance), we dropped the kids in the room with their milk 'n cookies and went down to the hotel bar for a drink. Absolutely packed, and not a cheap cocktail, a great end energetic vibe for us suburbanites on a night downtown. Staff was friendly and helpful at every encounter, and was just a really nice experience. Only slight complaint is late night sirens are not very muffled - rooms are right above the street. Not much you can do about that though. We will be back soon - I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional! Best hotel stay!”
Reviews.Author: ScooterRed71
Reviews.Content: This is what a hotel should be! We stayed two nights for our anniversary and had the best hotel stay ever. I choose the City Deluxe room and requested the "stand by" upgrade. When we checked in, the front desk clerk told me that my requested upgrade was sold out but to make up for it, they would upgrade us "higher" and put us in the Artist suite. It was so nice! Huge living room, two bathrooms and a extremely comfortable bed. I requested a bottle of champagne to be in the room when we arrived and sure enough, it was there, on ice and with glasses. I've made this request at other hotels and for some reason, they never do it. Palomar did it perfectly! We dined at Sable, the adjacent restaurant, and had a great meal. The staff at Sable are some of the best restaurant employees I have ever encountered. I cannot remember the last time I stayed at a hotel and could not find one thing wrong. The Palomar is an exceptional hotel! We'll be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Champagneandcupcakes
Reviews.Content: This hotel will do everything they can to ensure you enjoy your stay. I've traveled all over and stayed at many hotels, and this is among the best I've visited. I go to Chicago every year and have now found my home there.

Reviews.Title: “Like Home”
Reviews.Author: lovelivelaugh14
Reviews.Content: I'm not a big review writer, but I just have to tell others how amazing my stay at the Palomar was. I arrived at the hotel at 1:00 pm and was allowed to check-in early even though check-in time officially starts at 3:00 pm. When I entered my room, I was in heaven. It was calm and tastefully decorated, with great attention to detail. I loved the umbrella, which came in handy, the animal print robes and sock/slippers, comfortable bed, and the modern clean lines. Best of all, as an Intouch member, I was allowed to choose two items from the minibar. Waking up the last day of my trip, I was sad to leave. I will only stay at the Palomar during my future trips to Chicago, and I look forward to exploring other Palomars around the country. * The Sable has amazing cocktails and delicious food

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: HoNeYmOoNeRs0221
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came for a weekend stay for our anniversary. Once we got there the hotel staff were very welcoming and friendly. No problems at all checking in, once we got into our room all we could say is "WOW" what a great room! Huge, clean..just everything was perfect! BTW, we stayed in the King Spa Premier room. LOVED every part of our stay! We even got a free bottle of champagne in our room for our anniversary from the staff! Will be staying there again. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Believe the reviews”
Reviews.Author: Wolfe99
Reviews.Content: As the title says.... believe the reviews. It is probably the best hotel we have ever stayed at. We normally stay at only Marriotts but picked this place based on the reviews and the fact that it is a smaller hotel. Here are our thoughts: . The location is great. Right in the middle of everything and just two blocks off Michigan. . Check-in: Arrived early but we got right into our room. Bellman was very friendly and helpfull. During our three day stay he was a wealth of knowledge about directions and restraunts in the area. Front desk personnel very helpful and knowledgeable with recommendations for restraunts and even a small chocolate company we had heard of. . Room: Extreamly clean and comfortable. All the amentites you would expect. Price was very reasonable considering what you get. . Hotel personnel: Extremely helpful and pleasent. Even when you are in the elevator going to your room if a staff member is on it they ask if you were enjoying your stay and if you needed anything. . Lounge: Personnel very friendly. Small and cozy. They serve wine and snacks each night. The wine was above average. The pizze was average. Papers and coffee every morning. Each morning they had bottled water iced down at the door for the runners. . Restraunt and bar: Very friendly and fast. We had breakfast and dinner their and service was great. We tried to have dinner there a second night but they were full. The receptionist and even the head cook tried to figure a way to fit us in but when they couldn't they recommended a restraunt for us. The prices were very reasonable. Breakfast was $11.00 for eggs, potatos, bacon, toast. Dinner menu is a little different than you would expect. They have a large selection of entries you can order from (meats, fruit, cheese, etc.) You pick which ones you want as you go along. . In the area: As stated it is only two blocks from Michigan avenue. Lots of good restraunts. Hotel recommeded Bennys Chop House and Shaws Crab House. Both were excellent. There is a 7 Eleven next door were you can get snacks, coffee, etc and an excellent restraunt one block down called "Eatt". We had breakfast there on morning. The area appears to be very safe. Lots of people walking around at night. There is some construction on State Street in front of the hotel but it didn't bother us or our ability to get a taxi. . Parking: $46.00 per night. Very fast valia. In summary, we have stayed at a lot of 5 star hotels and this one is the best. Don't hestitate to give it a try.... you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “"Great Hotel, Great Location"”
Reviews.Author: VACNUT
Reviews.Content: Arrived by train into Union Station, from Union Station it was a quick taxi ride to the Hotel. This Hotel was amazing, excellent staff, beautiful and very comfortable rooms. Great location for shopping, restaurants etc, all within walking distance. Went to Fogo De Chao for dinner, then back to the Hotel Bar for some excellent after dinner drinks. I would recommend this hotel and will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Kauf
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel at a good value. It's almost a shock to find a hotel chain that actually makes a concerted effort to make your stay pleasant. From the nice decor to the wine tasting at night to the friendly manner and can-do attitude. This boutique chain is anything but the rushed, cattle processing experience I had at other chain hotels on my trip offering a push button experience that felt like you were being processed. The Palomar is a great place to relax, get some work done, head outside for a great meal in the neighborhood and enjoy Chicago in the few minutes you might have in your busy day. I will definately make this my headquarters when heading to town for business, and even more telling, would stay here for pleasure when traveling for fun.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rooms and service in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: fadochicago
Reviews.Content: In the last 6 months i have had two wonderful experiences with the Hotel Palomar. The first was last summer for my wedding reception and stay. The second was this weekend for a getaway in the city. Both times i have been very impressed with the Hotel Palomar and the staff. The location is right off the Red line on State St and only a few blocks from Michigan Ave so it is very easy to get around downtown. There are a myriad of things to do with a few blocks of the hotel, including shopping and places to eat -- Millennium Park and the Art Institute are a few blocks more (20 min walk or short train/cab ride) . The rooms are very nice, decorated with bits of Chicago history. There is a wonderful terrace on the 17th floor with great views of the city. I have found the staff very attentive and helpful in both of my visits. During the weekend we got to experience the wine hour on Saturday night and coffee and tea in the lobby Sunday morning. Overall this is just a great hotel, that is in a great location if you are visiting Chicago. During your stay you get hungry, don't hesitate to check out Sable. The food is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite place!”
Reviews.Author: lisathew8lifter
Reviews.Content: This review is long over due! My girlfriend and I met in Chicago last January and stayed at the Four Seasons. This January we thought we would try something different and stay here. Although we enjoyed our stay at 4S, it had nothing on Hotel Palomar!!! The hotel manager emailed my friend to see if there were any special occasions we were celebrating and just to offer assistance with the city. All of her questions were answered and her requests were honored. Very impressive. We loved everything about this hotel, especially the Sable Bar. We spent two nights in Chi and ate dinner there both times, and lunch prior to heading to the airport. We spent both nights in the bar being spoiled with awesome service by Greg and Chris. I cannot say enough about the service, the atmosphere, the employees or the location. THIS is where I'm staying everytime i come back to Chicago!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to hang out during a blizzard”
Reviews.Author: CAWeekender29
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palomar during a business trip to Chicago. A blizzard ruined most of my plans - however I was very happy that while it was freezing outside I could enjoy the warmth of the Palomar. The room was clean, spacious and well appointed. The bed was comfortable and the space was quiet at night. The gym was a highlight for me, with large windows, new machines and complimentary apples to enjoy after a workout. To top it all the staff at the hotel and restaurant were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch service, excellent restaurant, fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: TXLonghornsATX
Reviews.Content: I recently made my first visit to the city of Chicago and could not have been more pleased with my stay at The Palomar. I've been to many hotels in North and South America and I must say that this hotel ranks as one of my favorites. The front desk staff were incredibly warm, friendly, and accommodating in every aspect. The restaurant, Sable, was fantastic and the rooms were excellent. I will only be staying here in my future visits to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely time”
Reviews.Author: mackswim
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very friendly and busy. Had a nice room with two queen beds and great pillows. Pool looked very inviting and peaceful. Staff was friendly and helpful, maybe just a tad unorganized, but nothing tragic. Restaurant was packed on Friday night but they were nice and brought our dinner into the hotel lobby for us. Location was much better than we thought. Great eating places very close by and short walk to shopping.

Reviews.Title: “New trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: HKFoodie
Reviews.Content: Hotel Palomar only opened in 2010 so the hotel is trendy with spacious rooms. At Euro 120 (inc tax) per night booked through Otel.com (prepaid voucher), I thought the rate was good especially given the location of the hotel. The gym is acceptable size with nice indoor swimming pool. The location is at the beginning of North Michigan Ave so it is in walking distance of restaurants and shopping. Like other Hotel Palomar, they offer free wine happy hour and coffee all day. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “I want all my hotels to be just like this!”
Reviews.Author: IzzyInBliss
Reviews.Content: I love the Palomar! As I write this from a fancy Morgans hotel in Miami after leaving Palomar this morning, I already miss it. Here's what I love. 1) Amazingly luxurious and comfortable. The room was beautifully appointed, as were all parts of the hotel I was atâ€”the gym, the pool, the restaurant. I just love my roomâ€”the bed, the sheets, the mini-bar choices (and prices!), the shower, the sink in the bathroom, the huge flat screen TV. 2) Great hospitality. It's beyond "service," because that misses that sense of "I'm coming 'home'" quality the Palomar's staff provided for me. 3) Great gym and pool. Especially the pool, which is heated yet surrounded by glass windows so it brings the outdoors into it. It's a great lap-poolâ€”not big enough to lounge in, which is perfect in winter since no one else thought of swimming! 4) Great restaurant. The Sable is head and shoulders above the typical hotel restaurant. I ate all my meals there for the 2 days I stayed there, and loved it. 5) Great value. I'm on a 3-city tour this trip, and the Palomar was the lowest in cost but the most luxurious and comfortable. I want to stay here again! 6) Great loyalty program with Kimpton InTouch. So, I'm a Starwood and Kimpton member too. But none of them provide me with the perks that Kimpton doesâ€”free Internet (most hotels charge outrageous prices now for Internet, like the one I'm staying at now!), and $10 complimentary credit to the mini bar per stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at Palomar”
Reviews.Author: nobigdeal
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay. Rooms were extremely tastefully decorated, the bed was comfy with nice linens and a good firmness (no squishy saggy hotel beds here!). We had a king deluxe which was very spacious, with a huge bathroom and whirlpool tub nearly as big as some hotel hot tubs! There is a pool at the hotel with a beautiful view, though no hot tub. (We just used the one in our room.) The best part of the hotel though was the service. The front desk person who checked us in was very friendly and helpful. When we called to ask about getting a humidifier sent to the room and it was there within minutes, a very nice touch to combat that dry hotel air. The evening wine reception looked lovely. We were on our way to dinner so we just peeked in, but they had some tasty looking flatbread pizza things, and two decent looking wines. They also served coffee and tea there in the morning, in to-go cups you could take on your way. The hotel decor is beautiful. It feels hip but not stuffy or exclusionary--very welcoming. Overall we had a very wonderful stay at the Palomar, and we plan to come back again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “ANOTHER GREAT KIMPTON HOTEL, CLEAN, GENEROUS, AND CLASSY”
Reviews.Author: VAChuck
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel! Excellent location close to the Magnificient Mile. Amenities galore. Free wine tasting at night, complimentary goodies like apples and bottled war. The rooms are spacious and if you can find any dirt anywhere you must be carrying a microscope. The beds, like all of the Kimptons we have stayed in, are really comfortable, While in Chicago, take one of the architectural boat tours on the Illinois River. Very informative and you should only pay about $25 person for a 75 minute tour. Some of the world class attractions we enjoyed included the Art Institute of Chicago (it has the best Impressionist collecition in the world, including better than Muse de Orsay in Paris and the Met in NYC.)We spent the whole day in the Art Institute. Also spend about 4-5 hours in the Field Museum with its excellent antiquities and dinosaur exhibits. The Shedd Aquarium was interesting but disappointing in several respects. The line for paying took one half hour and was very poorly organized. Go early when it first opens to avoid this! Also, look the package you buy very carefully. Be certain to get what you want included. We missed the water show because it was not clear that it was not in our package. The City Pass for example did not include the water show with the Beluga whales. If the weather is nice, wander along the Magnificent Mile. The name fits!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Home Chicago at the Hotel Palomar”
Reviews.Author: SheShopsTooMuch
Reviews.Content: Practically perfect in every way. From "D" the doorman to the burger at the fantastic Sable Kitchen & Bar, the Hotel Palomar is the place to stay in Chicago. Immaculate, quiet, fantastic location and very professional staff- you really can't go wrong. Please see a detailed review on my blog at www.tripscout.blogspot.com.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LAURAELENA
Reviews.Content: L'Occitane products, great service, great location.

Reviews.Title: “They have thought of everything! And they're eco friendly too!”
Reviews.Author: ImpulseFeet
Reviews.Content: Just spent three wonderful days at the Palomar. From the minute you step in to the hotel, you are taken care of. Ashley at the front desk was lovely, and so helpful. She found us a cellphone charger, which they provide free of charge. When I got to my room, it just got better! If you forgot something, they can provide it. I asked for a heating pad, and it was at my room in minutes. Animal print robes!!! How much fun is that! The bathroom is lovely, and included a magnifying mirror (such a wonderful detail). Going to the pool and fitness centre was another wonderful experience. The pool offers magnificant views of Chicago, and its well heated. The icing on the cake of this hotel is the wine reception. A free tasting of wines from around the world everynight from 5-6 in the lobby. Its a wonderful way to wind down from the day, and sit by the wonderfully modern fireplace. They have really thought about their guests! Because they are eco conscious, you can decide whether you want your sheets and towels changed. By giving me the option to decide, the Palomar (and Kimpton chain) has won me over! I will no doubt be staying at the Kimpton chain hotels when I visit a city in which they have a hotel. Kudos Kimpton!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: ChoTN
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Palomar Chicago is located in a great area if you are interested in shopping, eating, and taking in the sights of Chicago. More importantly, the staff is wonderful! On the second evening, the room attendant, Gabriela, had some soda delivered to the room after she noticed we liked a certain brand! When my flight was cancelled, I called the hotel in hopes of getting a room for the night, and Gan took care of my reservation with a great rate! It was so nice to come back to the hotel and Gan's helpfulness after a not-so-great day at O'Hare. The room service was quick and yummy too! I spent two nights in the queen-queen deluxe and one night in a king room. Both rooms were clean with comfortable beds and great views. The rooms are well designed with a spacious closet. I will be choosing to stay at this hotel when I return to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: BetseyG
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Palomar is a perfect hotel for people looking for easy access to transit and attractions. The El is right across the street, Michigan Avenue is just a few blocks away, and lots of good restaurants, wine bars, and stores nearby. The hotel itself is trendy enough to capture the typical Chicago modern style while being warm and comfortable. What the hotel staff calls the "living room," off of the first floor reception, is a warm and inviting space with a gas fireplace and comfy seating. And, best of all, the hotel hosts a wine reception where guests grab a drink and stick around to mingle with each other. The rooms are great, and the beds and pillows even better. Hotel staff was wonderful -- always in a good mood and eager to help. Would, without hesitation, stay here again on future trips to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the weekend to catch a Cardinal / Cubs game!!”
Reviews.Author: jennmattnphanty
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location! We had recently stayed at a near by hotel but this one is better by far. We love the fact that we could bring our Boston Terrier and not have to pay extra! Hotel Palomar please never change this policy! The rooms are super clean including the bathrooms and are very spacious. Us and the dog loved looking out the floor to ceiling windows. The staff was very friendly. Only thing that bothered us would be the fact that we put a sign out on the door that we did NOT want the room to be cleaned and they still came in for housekeeping. Also odd too since they told us that if you have a pet they will not come in either, but they did. If you stay here you have to go across the stree to Rockbottom Brewery, it looked closed late one night but there is a whole seperate bar section and it was packed w tables. They brew their own beer and have a firey spinach dip that is awesome!! We will be going back in August this year and plan on staying at Hotel Palomar!! One last thing, our bed was sooo comfortable. We slept like babies.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: juliette1417
Reviews.Content: i booked one night here and loved it so much i ended up staying three. the bed was the most comfortable ever, the service was great, the staff was super friendly, and the room service breakfast was delicious. my only complaint - and it's my own fault - was that i slept in one of the days and should've put the the "dreaming" tag on my door, housekeeping seemed very intent on cleaning my room and came back every 20 min. overall, i loved this hotel and will definitely lookup kimpton hotels in other cities. there are so many cute perks of this place- especially the wine reception in the lobby, although many of the people there didn't seem to be staying at the hotel. i loved that i was able to bring my dog too, i'd definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pet Friendly Hotel with Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: Robinm61chicago
Reviews.Content: There is not one thing that I did not like about this hotel. It was in walking distance to many excellent restaurants, the river and the tour that we had prearranged. The staff was friendly. The rooms were nicely decorated, quiet, and very clean. There was a lovely lounge area with a fireplace and comfortable furniture. We missed the wine reception by a few minutes but it looked very inviting. The beds and pillows in the rooms were soft and comfortable. This hotel is very pet friendly. They even had a welcome bag for our dog and offered a dog bed! (no charge for pets, by the way). the Chai tea they offered in the morning was a nice option besides the usual coffee and other teas. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this hotel”
Reviews.Author: DetroitareaKate
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing stay at the Hotel Palomar in Atlanta, so were very excited to try the hotel in Chicago. We are happy to say we had just as wonderful of a stay. The hotel is beautiful, staff in friendly (with the exception of the doormen- not really sure why they stood there because they never helped us unless we looked completely helpless). We stayed in a spa room which was completely amazing. Floor to ceiling windows overlooking the city, sitting area with flat screen TV, VERY comfortable bed, jacuzzi tub... I could go on and on! The attention to detail was great! We visit Chicago on a regular basis and have stayed in a good majority of the hotels. Hotel Palomar is definitely at the top of our list. Now having stayed in 2, it is nice to see a hotel chain that is consistently excellent. PS- the hotel bar "Sable" is amazing. The drinks are very interesting and the bartenders know the answer to any question you might have!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel stay I've ever had with small children!”
Reviews.Author: maclean77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Palomar with a 2 month old, 4 year old and 7 year old. Upon our arrival, they had complimentary hot chocolate and apple cider in the lounge area right off of the front desk check in. They also had cookies and milk sent up to our room for the kids. The hotel staff was excellent and were so accomodating. We asked for a crib/pack and play sent up to the room and it arrived within 15 minutes of us checking in. They also asked if the two older children would like robes to match my husband and mine sent up. Now that's service! The rooms were decent sized (for a Chicago hotel), the beds were nice, and the pillows were comfortable. I couldn't have asked for a better stay! I would give this hotel at least 4 or 5 stars...

Reviews.Title: “New attractive hotel with some service issues”
Reviews.Author: RaySantaFe
Reviews.Content: This is a very attractive new hotel. The staff is friendly, but not really service oriented. I was expecting a fax. I asked the front desk personnel about six times if it came in. Each time I was told no. I even asked if the fax machine was working and had paper and was assured it was working just fine. Finally, I called the hotelâ€™s fax number and their fax machine never picked up. I had to have the fax sent to a FedEx office at my expense. We checked in on a Thursday night at 8:30 PM. There was no bell person nor were we offered assistance with our bags. I asked if the hotel had humidifiers and was told yes they do. I had to call down for one the next day. When I asked if they have humidifiers, the answer should have been yes and weâ€™ll have one sent up. On Christmas Day the hotel restaurant was closed. The hotel provided coffee and pastries in the lobby, which was a nice touch. The problem was they kept running out of coffee and the pumps on the coffee containers werenâ€™t working right. The food service was being provided by the front doorman who was trying, but this was not his job. We ran out of toilet paper twice during our stay and had to call for more because housekeeping never replaced the extra roll in the bathroom. They kept forgetting to replace the plastic bag that goes in the ice bucket. They provide body wash in the shower rather than bar soap, but they are small tubes good for about two showers and housekeeping never seemed to replace them. The Q tips in the vanity container in the bathroom were never replaced. One day we left our room at 12:00 Noon. I called the front desk and said that we would be gone for two hours and could we have our room made up before we returned. I was assured that could be accomplished. We returned at 2:00 PM and the room was NOT made up until after 4:00 PM. This hotel has some major housekeeping issues that could be easily rectified if the housekeepers were given a checklist to sign off on to make sure everything was done in a room. None of these items by themselves are major, but they all add up over a weekâ€™s stay and they become a major service issue.

Reviews.Title: “They bought me 2 Christmas trees for the room simply because they knew I loved Christmas! Outstanding customer service!”
Reviews.Author: ElleCarpy
Reviews.Content: I could write endlessly about how wonderful this hotel is...but, in essence: outstanding customer service and welcoming, helpful staff who are willing to do anything for you (most notably, Darren the doorman and Mark the concierge!); large, clean, quiet, modern and comfortable rooms; a beautiful lounge that was decorated for Christmas with a gorgeous tree and Christmas scent, as well as a warming, welcoming fire; free seasonal refreshments for all guests, provided three times per day in the cosy lounge, which were very popular and great for mingling or simply reading a book with a warm apple cider or glass of wine; and, the best part for us, was the fact that the hotel went out to buy two Christmas trees for our bedroom simply because I had emailed to say that I loved Christmas and hoped the hotel would be nicely decorated for our first trip to Chicago! So touching, the staff go above and beyond in every way, and we miss it already!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eafalendysz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautifully decorated and super chic! The lounge was stunning with a huge gas fireplace, lots of couches and floor-to-ceiling windows. There was also free wine tasting in the lounge every evening from 5-6, but we were never back at the hotel in time. The rooms were also stunning. We had a very nice view of the surrounding city. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The only complaint I could make was service at the attached hotel bar was very slow on our first visit and the cocktail server seemed annoyed by our presence. However, on the second evening, we ordered a bottle of wine from a very friendly bartender and were able to take it back to the hotel lounge to enjoy it in quiet. The bar gets quite packed on the weekends. I have read other reviews that it is noisy, so I might suggest that you request a room on a higher floor. Our room on the 14th floor was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but watch out for luggage!”
Reviews.Author: mom2nikki
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Chicago to do some Christmas shopping, and decided on Hotel Palomar as it's in a great location for shopping and eating in the River North area. We took the train, which was very convenient and an easy cab ride from Union Station to the hotel. Upon arrival, we were impressed by the beautiful sitting area with a very modern fireplace and the friendliness of all the staff. Our room was a king room with city view which was beautiful. Bathroom was a little small, but nicely appointed. We thoroughly enjoyed the wine hour and they even had a very nice sparkling rose' that we enjoyed and a goat cheese pizza with a hint of truffle oil. It was fun to meet new people and find out what brought them to Chicago. One disappointment was we had decided to come back to the hotel early one evening to just enjoy a swim to relax. We rushed back after having drinks and then jumped into our suits. It was about 10:15 and someone was cleaning it and told us they close the pool at 10. This seemed a little early to us. Our biggest issue with the hotel was on our last day. Since we had taken the train into the city and it didn't leave until 4 PM, we checked our bags with the bellhop. We each had a black carry-on size bag and some shopping bags. We returned to pick up our bags and the bellhop (not the one who checked in our bags) said he could only find one bag and our shopping bags. He asked us to come back into the room to see if we could find it. We noticed the bags were all over in a haphazard manner and not really neatly put together. After frantically checking around (we had a train to catch), we had to leave. Of course, the bag that came up missing was my bag-which contained a slew of new clothes, riding boots, new shoes, makeup, jewelry and other expensive items. Although the guest services manager has been assisting me with attempting to locate it and has followed up with an insurance claim, the actual hotel manager has never contacted me to apologize for this mess up. I am a travel consultant and therefore have stayed at hundreds of hotels and have never had something like this happen. We can't imagine how it came up "missing" and I just wanted to warn everyone to try to avoid checking your luggage here. To add insult to injury, after returning home I realized they had double charged me for an overpriced bottle of chardonnay ($24 for a split) as well as a snack that was to be covered by the free $10 snacks for being a member of the Kimpton rewards program. Just be aware - this hotel definitely has some serious kinks to work out!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: drduck1120
Reviews.Content: Service at this hotel is extraordinary. Management and staff alike are polite, attentive and accommodating to your every need with speed, efficiency and a smile! The hotel is conveniently located a few blocks from Michigan Avenue near excellent shopping and restaurants. The rooms are spacious and comfortable as well as spotlessly clean and well stocked with amenities. There is coffee to wake you in the morning and wine to start your evening in the very beautiful and comfortable lobby. The pool is inviting, and the fitness room has everything you could need. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this hotel and will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Palomar is the best!!!”
Reviews.Author: eyeu1
Reviews.Content: We cannot say enough about the Hotel Palomar in Chicago. We stayed there with our children (ages 6 and 4) for a family weekend getaway: Service: The staff and service were above and beyond anything we expected - they were professional, friendly, helpful, knowledgeable, courteous, and welcoming. They go out of their way to make families welcome, from the kids' gift bags at check-in to the afternoon jelly bean bar. Room: Beautiful, warm and modern, great products in the bathroom, fabulous robe and towels, clean, and a great night's sleep! Amenities: Our kids loved the pool! It was beautiful, especially at night. The fitness room was also better than I've seen in some gyms - although we didn't have the opportunity to take advantage of it, we did admire it. Food: We ordered room service both mornings we were there and our breakfast was delicious, hot, and on-time. They had chocolate chip pancakes for the kiddos, amazing bacon (the thick-cut, crispy kind), and fantastic coffee. All of the above was our experience with the hotel at the point when we checked out and got on the train to come home. Upon disembarking from the train at our destination and all four of us hauling our luggage to the car to drive home, I'm embarrassed to admit that we realized we had left our car keys behind at the hotel! Back to the train we trekked, for a 2-hour train ride back into Chicago to retrieve our keys. After looking at the train schedule, we found that there would be a 10-minute window in Chicago to hop on the return train and make it home by 10 pm (we still had a 2-hour drive ahead of us, with work and school the next day), or we would have to wait 2 hours in Chicago for the next train, which would get us home at midnight. We called the Palomar from the train to let them know we were coming back for our keys and inquired if there was any way at all that someone from the hotel could meet us at the train so that we could make the 10-minute window. The staff at the Palomar didn't hesitate! When we arrived back in Chicago, their head of guest services was waiting for us on the platform, with keys in hand and the information we needed to catch our train back. Thanks to their outstanding service, even our most unfortunate error turned into a positive, and as a family we will be able to laugh at ourselves and remember even the end of this trip fondly for years to come. We can't thank the Hotel Palomar enough!!

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Winter Getaway in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: UWSider
Reviews.Content: The beauty and service of this hotel set the high level of satisfaction. Our rooms were very large, with grand windows overlooking the city. Just missing: luggage rack! But the furnishings were top quality. The concierge began helping even before we arrived in Chicago--Mark, we love you! Each evening--complimentary wines, cider, pizza; morning comp coffee/tea--all served in a stunning lounge setting. We were so happy! Great location for everything you wish to see and do in midtown Chicago. Thank you, Kimpton for your high level of guest satisfaction!

Reviews.Title: “Courteous staff and very nice room in a new hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Jett_Set
Reviews.Content: We usually don't stay in hotels this nice, but since it was our anniversary we splurged a bit. The whole hotel is very nicely decorated. Wine reception in the evening was good touch. The king spa room was great, very tasteful and thoughtfully laid out. Loved the Fuji soaking tub for two and separate shower. Leopard and zebra bathrobes were super heavy and comfy. Workout room and pool on 17th floor very nice. The location is OK, about 3 blocks from either Chicago river or Michigan Avenue, and couldn't see anything interesting in the view from our room. Helpful staff. Sable bar prides themselves on their mixology, it was completely full and noisy on Saturday night. If you like super trendy fare, the restaurant may be for you.

Reviews.Title: “Service puts it over the top”
Reviews.Author: gregandsom
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked into the property, I decided this would be no more than four stars at best....but the service takes it to five-star status. We booked a king spa suite on line. Upon check-in, we went to our room, and found it wasn't what we had booked. We went down and told the front desk, and within two minutes they gave us keys to our new room, no hassles. Apparently at some point when we were talking about the room issue I mentioned it was our anniversary (I didn't even remember saying it), and at 6:30 that night, they sent up a bottle of champagne with fresh strawberries & chocolate. Everyone who came to our room addressed us by name. We asked Sunday morning for a late check out, no problem. Fantastic service from everyone we encountered. The complimentary cocktail hour each day was nice as well. The rooms weren't "Wow", but nice. Very large sitting area with a couch and desk, which I really wanted. Nice bathroom in the spa suite with very large sitting tub for two, and stand-up glass/marble shower. The bath robes are a cute touch (I won't spoil the surprise....). Because of the spacious sitting/work area, I can see why business travellers like this property so much. Didn't eat at Sable, but met friends there for drinks, was very nice. Incredible mixologist down there. Would you think a drink composed of Guinness, Gin, sherry, egg whites, and nutmeg would be worth drinking? Me neither....but it was! Was a three block walk to Miracle Mile, with top-notch bars & restaurants in every direction. We would stay here again, and recommend for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected pampering for anniversary”
Reviews.Author: amg120200
Reviews.Content: Wasn't even on property for five minutes and knew it was first rate hotel! I surprised my wife by taking her to Chicago for the weekend to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary and The Palomar came through! I requested early check-in; they came through (7am check-in). I paid for a city-view; they delivered the corner room on the 17th floor. I asked about things to do; they provided several options. Our heads haven't even hit the pillow! Knock, knock. Complimentary bottle of sparkling wine. Are you kidding me, we did't even get this treatment on our honeymoon. We thoroughly enjoyed the stay and would stay again. Only 4 stars on sleep quality because we haven't slept yet. Only 4 stars on location because it could always be closer to the action...

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Cglasb
Reviews.Content: I worked in Chicago for 6 months every other week and stayed at the Palomar almost every chance I could. Consistenly great. Clean, new, fabulous gym and pool, very nice hotel restaurant, efficient staff. Definitely recommend. Very convenient to Mich ave, restaurants and the Loop.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Venturing
Reviews.Content: Staff was very pleasant and included a special check-in gift for the kids. Very comfortable, nicely appointed, and an excellent location near top-notch restaurants. I would stay here or any other Palomar without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly family friendly”
Reviews.Author: blackfriars55
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a one night stay at Hotel Palomar with my husband and our 2.5 year old son. Per my request, the portable crib was already set up and waiting in our room upon check-in. They'd included a little blanket with the crib, too, which was handy since I hadn't brought one. Had no trouble checking in a few hours early, which was much appreciated before our excursions around town. As a member of the Kimpton In Touch program, we enjoyed a few perks such as a loaner bag of yoga paraphernalia (mat, blocks, complimentary water bottles), free internet access, my preferred paper (NYTimes) in the a.m., and complimentary mini bar snacks up to $10. These were admittedly little things, but they go a long way towards making one feel welcome. We swam in the pool (not very big or deep, but sufficiently large to get some exercise in) and I liked that the room didn't reek of chlorine and wasn't overly steamy. The pool is located on the top floor (17th) with fantastic views of the surrounding cityscape. We partook in the 'wine hour' and thought it a nice touch that they served mulled apple cider as a non-alcoholic/kiddy offering. Staff was very young and energetic. One of the front-door guys was exuberant and welcoming each time we arrived while another guy we saw towards the end of our stay was more reticent and stoic. Late one night, I called up the front desk to ask if I could purchase a bottle of contact lens solution since ours had leaked in our travel case and was depleted; not only did they have one on hand, they even found someone to run it right up to our room (and he left as quickly as he'd arrived, before I could hand him a tip). Late one night, we sat in the small lobby area in front of the gas fireplace, catching up on the day's papers, and enjoyed listening to the driving, techno beats over the sound system (which wasn't playing overly loud, mind you). That's one indication of the hotel's hip, modern vibe - no Muzak here. One morning we asked the front desk for brunch recommendations and they told us about Eggsperience nearby - a terrific place we'd love to visit the next time we're in town. The only confounding thing we encountered during our stay was that the closet door in our room was sort of stuck or a bit harder to open. So much so that I initially thought it was locked or was a connecting door of some sort. My husband and I did think it strange, then, when we believed there wasn't a closet in the room, but we put it down to the quirks of a boutique hotel. Needless to say, when we were finally clued in that that door was, indeed, the closet (complete with animal print robes, ironing board, iron) we thought it hilarious and were relieved. Overall, we had a wonderful stay. It was our first time at a Kimpton hotel but it definitely won't be our last. Will probably now seek them out as a preferred place to stay (given the right price, of course). Kudos, Kimpton and Hotel Palomar Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Inviting, clean, we loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: bell-lap
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palomar over the weekend, our first trip to Chicago. The staff we met were professional and friendly. We arrived at about 1pm and were able to get a room right away, which was nice because we'd come in via public transit - inexpensive and super-convenient (we exited Grand station on the Red line just steps from the hotel entrance) but about a 40 min trip which wore the kids out a bit (suggestion: bring something to do on the train!) We were greeted at reception with complimentary loot bags and vouchers for cookies and milk for the kids - the kids loved the little toys and the bedtime snack! And as a Kimpton member we also received a complimentary 'raid the mini-bar' voucher for up to 2 items and limit of $10, which the kids also enjoyed - orange juice and gummy bears! The room was on one of the conference floor levels (5) but it was quiet with only the odd ambulance siren at night (which didn't bother us much and which the kids slept through). We found it be a good-sized room, very new and clean, with 2 comfy queen beds. Our view wasn't great, looked out onto Illinois St, but we didn't care - view wasn't a top priority for us. The hotel was a great location for us, one bus and a few minutes to Navy Pier, a few blocks to North Michigan Avenue for the Christmas parade, and a straightforward trip to the museums. Special thanks to the hotel for accepting an item I had purchased online and had delivered there a day before we arrived. I had notified them in advance and it was a stress-free experience. My hubby loved the hard-to-find-in-Canada gift. We didn't attend the complimentary wine tastings but did enjoy the hot chocolate and apple cider in the lobby, complete with marshmallows, chocolate chips and cinnamon sticks - delicious! Another reviewer had mentioned that the bathroom sliding door had issues (didn't close fully?), but we had no problems with ours. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “everything was great except for the desk people”
Reviews.Author: syh75287
Reviews.Content: I would have given 5 stars except they charged my credit card instead of the company that reserved and booked my room. I've stayed at this hotel for business twice. The other time was last year in 2009. The hotel is still brand new. It is right next to the American Medical Association (State and Grand). I had a meeting there, and the AMA booked our rooms. There were at least 7 rooms booked for those that came from out of town for the meeting, but for some reason my reservation did not have "an account" to charge the room to. I had the issue both checking in and figured they would fix this upon check out. That was not the case. They said they would call and find out when I checked out. I left them my cell number, and within the hour I called the front desk to give them a contact name who reserved the rooms for us. It seemed all would be settled, but upon checking online I found they indeed charged my credit card. I guess they didn't follow through to get this resolved properly. That is the impression I got, at least. You can take the train from O'Hare ($2.25) by taking the blue line and transferring at the loop (Jackson stop) to the red line. Get off at Grand and you can see the hotel (1-2 min walk). It takes nearly an hour to take the train though. A cab from the hotel to the airport will run almost $40 without tip. The room offers L'Occitane shampoo, conditioner & body lotion (no body wash), but of course they have soap bars. They also stock cotton balls and qtips. The bathroom is immaculate, but that is also due to the hotel still being pretty new. The door is a slide door which is a full length mirror itself. They have an umbrella in the closet that you can borrow if needed as well as robes you can wear. My room looked out to the main street so the sirens from a police car or ambulance can be heard. If you sign up on their website for some loyalty program, you can get free internet access which is really nice. They also have a complimentary wine hour in the lobby (did not partake in). It's really a lovely boutique hotel. I forgot to rate my first stay there last year which would of been 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Made Great Pals with the Palomar”
Reviews.Author: MadameO
Reviews.Content: They really take care of you here. From Darren, the friendly face at the front door, to the concierge staff who can get you in anywhere you can really get spoiled here. Like all the Kimpton Hotels, there's lots of extra touches, like the manager's wine party every night. And jars of jelly beans in the afternoons. Take advantage of the upgrade offer when you book- for a few bucks more, if available when you show up, you can get a suite. Ours was enormous, and it came in handy. Even though my husband and I were on a short vacay, we both had to do a few conference calls. With two rooms, we almost did not get on each other's nerves. My only issue with this hotel is the slightly noisy heat/ac. Not a huge deal, though. And don't bother with the bar downstairs, there's an excellent dive bar across the street called Snickers. Don't let the homeless drunks peppered in with football fans fool you- Snickers is stocked with high end tequillas and vodkas. And all sorts of microbrews.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in the Big City”
Reviews.Author: snrisa
Reviews.Content: My family, friends and I stayed at this hotel for my wedding in Chicago this fall. The hotel staff were incredibly friendly, patient, and helpful. The common area lounge with wine in the evenings and coffee in the mornings was a great gathering place, and the bar/restaurant is not a "hotel restaurant" - it is hip, fun, and the food is very good. The rooms are spacious, nicely appointed, and spotless. I looked at a LOT of hotels in Chicago before selecting this one as the hotel for my out of town guests - the Palomar is really a cut above.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: valueformoneyplease9
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights and could not have asked for more, The staff were helpful,The rooms were comfy and the business sentre was handy. We didnt eat in the Sable Restaurant but the food looked and smelt wonderful. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wine tasting nice addition”
Reviews.Author: Frick
Reviews.Content: This was the fourth time I have stayed in a Kimpton Hotel and still consider it among the best. The Palomar is fairly new and has a beautiful, hip lobby. Our double queen room was spacious with a fantastic view from the 16th floor (per my request). As an InTouch member, I always look forward to the free "gift" upon arrival. Nothing. It wasn't until I read one of the cards in the room that InTouch members receive a $10 voucher for the honors bar. The next morning I asked the front desk about this. The employee was surprised I had not received that information at check-in. I also did not receive the coupons for my second morning $1 breakfast (a hotel package), so I would have to say the evening front desk was not quite with it when we checked in. On the other hand, I give high marks to the staff at Sable, the hotel restaurant, who took care of carefully packaging our continental breakfast to take up to our room. For $1 more, my daughter and I both got a bagel, a substantial variety of fresh fruit, juice and coffee. The restaurant staff were very friendly and eager to serve. The highlights - exceptionally clean rooms, very comfy beds, L'occitane toiletries, animal print robes, nightly wine tasting and free "during your stay" yoga kits with bottled water. Next time we'll bring our swimsuits as the 17th floor pool looks very inviting. They do offer free wireless internet for InTouch members, but if you don't have a comptuer with you, you have to use the computers in the business center that are only accessible with your credit card.

Reviews.Title: “A true hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Armed_Businessman
Reviews.Content: By far exceeded my expectations.. From the moment you step out of your car to the moment your departing. Sable Restaurant was very receptive despite me not having a reservation.. Staff is very catering. Housekeeping was exceptional.. Rooms are spacious.. Beds are very comfortable..

Reviews.Title: “That Extra touch...”
Reviews.Author: Galila
Reviews.Content: All quality hotels offer you a variation of the same thing. Most hotel critics are subjective, so I too am not objective when it comes to this hotel. I'll limit my comments to 'that extra touch' as I like to call it. This Kimpton chain hotel gets a 10 for everything it has to offer. However, when it comes to complimentary freshly-brewed coffee in the morning and a complimentary range of quality wines to sip from at the end of a long day (between 5-7pm), all offered in their tasteful home living-room that is their lobby area - then it is this hotel that is offering something a touch special. Something you will definitely remember after so many nights spent in those dreary business-catered for 'quality' hotels on offer. Take the plunge and enjoy all this hotel has to offer. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff & a few miscues”
Reviews.Author: bently1614
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Palomar is on par with the staff at another of my most favorite hotels - the Egerton House in London! That being said I wish that they had paid attention to some of the smaller details. As a member of there "inTouch" program, I asked for a local paper which never came even after going to the front desk and mentioning that it hadn't arrived. I was assured the issue would be taken care of. Unfortunately, it wasn't. I had wanted to have breakfast in my suite the day I was leaving, so I filled out the form which had been left on the bed and hung it on my door by 10 PM the night before. When I got up in the morning I checked to make sure that it had been picked up and everything was on target and it was still hanging there! In all of my travels, that has NEVER happened before! While it was a minor inconvenience to have to go downstairs for breakfast, I wish that I had had the time to have a quiet breakfast in my room before spending the day traveling! In fairness, I did speak to one of the assistant managers of the hotel before I left and he was most gracious about "my suggestions" and did give me his card. Even with the above issues, I have booked to return for another stay next month as the location and the staff really made up for the small "problems" that I am sure can be solved to take this venue to the 5 star level.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort is King at the Palomar”
Reviews.Author: BerkshireGal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at the Hotel Palomar recently and were very pleased. The hotel is new and beautiful; the rooms surround you with comfort (the leopard and zebra terry robes were a hit!). The staff was very helpful, courteous and eager to please. The manager sent up champagne when he learned that it was our first trip to Chicago and we were celebrating a 70th birthday. The morning coffee in the Lobby and the evening wine tasting are very popular. We found the location to be perfect for walking -- convenient to the River, the Loop and the Magnificent Mile. There are some terrific restaurants within a block or two of the hotel which is highly desirable after a full day of sightseeing. We tried the Rosebud Trattoria, the Eatt Diner and the Rock Bottom Brew Pub -- all were excellent and all are within a block of the hotel. There is also a Starbucks for those who need their caffeine jolt.

Reviews.Title: “worth a try!”
Reviews.Author: sild-o
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 days at the Palomar Hotel. Great location and excellent restaurant on site called "Sable". We really appreciated the personal attention/great service from the booking to the check out. I signed up to be a member of the Kimpton hotels and that gave us a few perks (wine reception, newspaper and choice of room, internet). A few days before our trip, the guest service supervisor of the hotel sent me an email asking if we had any special requests and if it was for a special occasion. We were celebrating my husband's birthday and when we arrived in the room there was a bottle of wine and cupcakes; a nice touch! The room was impeccable. It was very clean and spacious (for a Chicago hotel) and the bed was comfortable. The service-- front desk, cleaning persons etc were always courteous and helpful. In addition, we really liked the location of the hotel. Ask for a room on a high floor so you can get a good view. There are only 17 stories so the higher the better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel..Great Staff...Great Extras”
Reviews.Author: BigFrail
Reviews.Content: Great hotel near many restaurants and shopping. Very well done inside. Indoor pool thats only 3.5 ft deep on the 17 floor. Staff was great! Concierge, Mark, was extremely helpful! Free wine during social hour and Free coffee in the morning made the stay that much better! Would recomend and will return!

Reviews.Title: “Great place...great staff”
Reviews.Author: MawCincinnati
Reviews.Content: This place was a beautiful, contemporary boutique hotel. It was very clean and the people were extremely friendly and helpful. I really felt welcome here. There was a wine reception in the living room from 5-6 every evening and coffee and tea each morning. The Sable restaurant and bar were very nice. We did not eat at the restaurant but we had great drinks at the bar. The food looked and smelled fantastic and we wished that we were able to stay a little longer to give it a try. The staff at this hotel was probably one of the best that I have ever encountered. Each person seemed to go out of their way to make our stay a pleasurable one and they succeeded. We would definitely visit this hotel again but would probably ask for a room facing away from the street. There is a firehouse nearby and we heard alot of sirens throughout the night. It might not be a problem on most weekends but we were there on Halloween weekend and there was a large party going on at another nearby hotel; there had been alot of trouble and serious injuries reported on the news the following morning which probably contributed to the siren noise.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificient service, magnificient staff”
Reviews.Author: NoraIsrael
Reviews.Content: I think that the most important thing at Palomar is the attitude. Nothing is a problem, from the little things you forgot at home and they are made "handy" to you through the free happy hour wine, through the willing to help from all the staff members. One of the best hotels we've ever been!

Reviews.Title: “An adequate place to stay in Chicago. Not even close to the best.”
Reviews.Author: edwo2
Reviews.Content: Over all it was an average place to stay. Inexplicably expensive, slow internet. Expensive parking. Every time I tried to call the concierge or the restaurantâ€”the line was busy. I expected more for the price. On the other hand, the location was an easy walk or cab to just about anywhere. I can find a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: EricC01
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Palomar for 4 nights, October. The room was large, the bed comfy, and at last, a room with alot of plug sockets!! It was clean, modern and practical. Tea and Coffee facilities in the room would have been good though. The pool area was great, compact (you wouldn't want more than two at a time), plenty of towels and best of all were the views from pool and sundeck. Did i miss the changing room?? I couldn't find one.................... I ate one evening meal and two breakfast in Sable (restaurant) each experience was good, food, service and price. The location was excellent, central to many Chicago attractions and as in most of the city, a feel safe area. The evening complimentary wine tasting for guests was a nice touch and most appreciated. Coffee was served each morning in the lounge (I would have preferred a room facility). Customer service was excellent all round. One fault (sorry), if the restaurant is going to be closed all evening for a private funtion, hotel guests should be advised. A good choice, a good price and would definately return to Palomar!

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and Royalty wrapped into an affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: audhep79
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palomar on a recent business trip to Chicago. First off, the staff was extremely helpful - from the concierge to the front desk. They had suggestions on where to eat, gave me precise directions to find places on foot (and provided a map), and stored my luggage after checkout until my meeting was done. The staff deserves a big pat on the back! The room itself was very spacious - I received a corner room, which afforded me two floor to ceiling window views of downtown Chicago. The room was spacious and impeccably clean. The tv was a large flat screen with an abundance of channels (which was much appreciated). The bathroom was standard for a high class hotel. The only thing I did not like about the room, was that the vanity was too high. I couldn't really get ready in the mirror (I'm 5'2") because of this. Luckily there was a mirror outside the bathroom door, which was great! I ordered room service and they delivered it on time, and it was a delicious breakfast. I would definitely stay at this hotel again when visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A superb home in the city”
Reviews.Author: chicagofan71
Reviews.Content: This is a really great boutique hotel! The room was very modern with excellent city views looking down to Lake Michigan. Try to get a corner room for 2 walls of floor to ceiling views. The bed was incredibly comfortable. The furnishings clean, new and modern. The staff were incredibly nice and helpful. They really seem to enjoy working here. The location is fabulous. Subway stop (Red line) steps away, easy walk to the Mag Mile, Wrigley building and river. An easy walk to the Loop and Navy Pier. Room service breakfast was a real treat. The staff even left me a gold fish in a bowl to liven up the room. If you're looking for a city experience with a small town feel, this is your hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “CUSTOMER SERVICE PAR EXCELLENCE”
Reviews.Author: Travellingman2243
Reviews.Content: Boutique hotel in an excellent loction in river north close to major attractions and many restaurants. Customer service was fantastic - from the help of the concierge(s) recomending what to see, restaurants to try and courteous and timely response of all hotel workers to any issues that arose - rooms nicely decorated and comfortable- become an in touch member and receive free internet service .

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay.”
Reviews.Author: grannyfriday
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palomar in September with my husband. It was our first stay in Chicago and I was delighted that I had picked such a good hotel. I have used Kimpton Hotels before. The location was perfect, the room was very comfortable, but tea and coffee making facilities would have been the 'icing on the cake'. Lots of people seem to think that the sliding bathroom door is a problem, but quite frankly I didn't have a problem with it, after all, I wasn't staying there with a stranger! Finally all the staff were friendly and curtious.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: AnneDM
Reviews.Content: Good location next to metro and easy walk into centre of city. Very comfortable bed and pillows. Have a swim early morning and watch the sun come up over the lake. Only ever heard sirens during the night and it would be almost impossible to soundproof a room that much!.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely luxury in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mnlaw48
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and I spent four nights at the Hotel Palomar in Chicago and had a wonderful experience. The hotel is beautiful, in a very hip, zen, minimalist way. Our room was quiet and comfortable, and beautifully appointed. All the staff were professional and helpful. The location is fantastic. It's in the River North area, which makes it central to almost all downtown and near north attractions. We walked almost everywhere we wanted to go, and at night when we didn't want to walk, we were a $10 cab ride from home. I would definitely stay at the Palomar again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: SanFranciscoSfgal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palomar for a long weekend to celebrate my 40th b-day. We loved everything about the hotel. Our room was spacious, modern and well designed with fabulous adjustable lighting. I thought it was genius that the bathroom was designed with a sliding pocket door - it operated silently and saved space in the room. Cool touches abounded like art books, magazines, animal print robes and L'Occitane toiletries. The bed was super comfy with high quality bedding and a perfect firm-but-not-too-firm mattress. The room felt very luxurious and we had a hard time leaving it every day. Housekeeping was unobtrusive and everything was spotless. The staff, from the front desk to the valet, was always professional and friendly. The bar was a fun place to hang out, but the cocktail prices were crazy high, even for artisanal cocktails. All in all, we had a great experience and would not hesitate to stay here again. Tip: join the hotel rewards club and get free wi-fi access and other little fun perks.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: benelong
Reviews.Content: Excellent location What made this hotel stand out was the fantastic staff. They actually left me with the impression that they liked what they were doing and who they were working with. Always happy and always so very willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “Good Boutique Hotel in the heart of Chicago. But was it good enough?????”
Reviews.Author: LASteve1977
Reviews.Content: This is not a big hotel! Rather a nice Boutique Hotel in a good location. The staff was freindly enough, got a great room on the 16th floor. The bed was hands down the best bed I've ever slept in, and I stay at 5-star resorts all the time. The room wasn't that big, but nice and modern. My one big complaint was it was a bit noisy at times. Housekeeping cleaning and making noise in the hallways at 8:45am, and even on the 16th floor I heard some street noise. You would think a new hotel would have soundproof windows? Other than that, the location was great and room was classy. I would recommend staying here if you're on a high floor and can get a good deal on the room. Other than that.... I'm not sure if I would return, but did have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “lovely art deco experience near Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: smartgal008
Reviews.Content: Lovely modern art deco decor hotel (new) very close to Magnificent Mile. Spacious rooms with very clearn modern baths and very comfortable beds. Has that special touch vibe of Kimpton hotels--sumptuous towels, animal print terry robes, free wine tasting happy hour. Super friendly yet sophisticated service; conceriege was very helpful in identifying eating, directions, etc.. Did not eat in restaurant but specialty cocktails were great. Great spot to view 2K point of Chicago marathon. Somewhat small lobby but large sitting room adjacent lobby with Chicago art books to brows through. Not a bargain hotel but great value for the atmosphere. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: jak9295
Reviews.Content: I booked at the Palomar because of the great reviews I saw online. Unfortunately, the trip did not live up to expectations. A few days before the trip, I received an email from the concierge asking us whether we were celebrating anything special and if we needed any services (e.g. restaurant reservations, etc.) I responded that I was with my best friend celebrating our mutual 40th birthdays and that we would like reservations at a particular restaurant. I did not hear back before my arrival but assumed that something would be communicated when checking in. At check in, we were told that we could have a corner room on the 5th floor (with the benefits of windows on both sides of the room) or a room higher up. We chose the room with more windows and were disappointed when we arrived on the 5th floor to see that it was the same floor as the conference center where an event had taken place earlier in the day - something that we were not informed of. The floor was not clean, with linens, empty glasses, etc. strewn about.. We then called down to the front desk to ask about our reservations to the requested resaurant to learn that there was nothing on record regarding our request. Why send such an email if it will just be ignored? The room was indeed on the corner, but not with enough windows to make up for the fact that we shared it with a conference floor, and there were cigarette butts and a dirty rag on the ledge outside our room door. To make matters worse, there was not an actual bathroom door, but a sliding door to the bathroom, which did not shut all the way. OK because we were best friends, but would have been most uncomforable if I had been with a significant other. We visited the bar downstairs (Sable) for a drink, and had a very unpleasant bartender - a rude bald man with a beard who basically ignored us. Luckily, a nice female bartender took pity on us and took our order. In short, I was not impressed with my stay at the Palomar which was unfortunate because I have had such great experiences with the hotel in San Francisco and Kimpton hotels in general.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, trendy, good location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: open2travel
Reviews.Content: Beautiful brand new boutique hotel. Make sure to sign up for Kimpton Hotel's "In Touch" Program online before your stay---you'll get free wifi and ten dollars worth of snacks from the minibar. Standard rooms are pretty small because they contain 2 queen beds...I really don't know where they would have set up a massage table if I had ordered one. Also, the bathroom doors are right off the room and do not close fully in the standard queen room, but they are working on the problem. It's already fixed in the more expensive rooms, so before you go find out if they fixed the problem (if you care about your privacy). Staff is amazing, gym open 24 hours. Fast elevators and clean rooms. An easy walk to lots of attractions and shopping. All in all, it was a great trip and the hotel is really superb, with small customer service touches that make you feel welcome. P.S.---hotel parking is pricey, so think twice before renting a car, or get a special hotel deal of room & parking together.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Tra415
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the hotel, I knew this would be a fantastic trip. We were tired from the drive and just wanted to valet our car (at $50 a night) just so we wouldn't have to deal with Chicago traffic and trying to find a cheaper place to park. The valet totally surprised me. He asked if we would be needing our car during our stay. I told him no. He then suggested we park literally across the street for only $25 a night. How cool is that?! That type of service continued throughout our 2 night stay. The front desk attendants directed us to the complimentary Arnold Palmers that afternoon and the complimentary wine hour around 5:00 p.m. Mark, our concierge, was incredibly helpful with advanced tickets, directions, suggestions, etc. Overall fantastic experience and would definitely recommend this hotel to all of my friends and colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: vegasdmbgirl
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean hotel right in the middle of downtown. Right across the street from the red line Grand Station. Everyone from the front desk to the valet attendants were extremely friendly and helpful everytime we walked in or out of the hotel. We asked to change room types in the middle of the stay due to having an extra 2 people staying with us and they were able to switch our room from a king bed to a 2 queen bed room. Great evening reception with complimentary wine and lemonade. They always had bottled water on your way out the door in the morning along with the usual coffee (iced cofee too), and tea. The only thing I would change about the hotel is the bathroom door. It is a sliding door like the kind on a bedroom closet. It has a space on each side of the door which takes away some privacy. I would definitely stay here again for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great design,great service, clean comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Goodrider11
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel, it feels like a happening place. The free afternoon wine and fancy o'dourves plus morning coffe ,tea etc with the morning papers in the small but classy and comfortable lobby very easy to socialize were only some of the things that put it over the top. Roof top pool,exercise room and patio with a great view. Very helpful staff no long lines super restaurant and a location that is walking distance from most everything. There is an Italian resturant just down the street that was great too. Rooms were very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel met all my expectations and more.”
Reviews.Author: PeoriaILSCrow
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend in Chicago for our 25th wedding anniversary. I did a lot of research for the right hotel for this special occasion and the Hotel Palomar exceeded our expectations. The staff was friendly and accomodating. The beds were very comfortable and the room was ultra clean. Our concierge, Mark, helped us pick out things to see and a restauant. When we were finished with our meal, the waiter brought out an elegant dessert that said Happy 25th Anniversary, and said it was from our concierge. What a nice surprise. We were in walking distance to everything. Sable's Kitchen in the hotel was one of our favorite restaurants, good for all meals. And the Rock Bottom Brewery across the street was also great. Will definitely go back. First time in a Kimpton Hotel, and we were impressed.

Reviews.Title: “New favorite hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: goalie30
Reviews.Content: This hotel was rated #1 on Trip Advisor, and it deserved it. The decor was elegant without being intimidating. The room was very well appointed, with one of the best hotel beds I've slept in. It was right in the middle of everything we set out to do in Chicago. Three things stood out in particular for me. One was the fitness facilities...very large, modern machines, and a spectacular view. The second was the pool. While not huge, it was beautiful, with the same view as the fitness center. Last, and most importantly, was the staff. Without exception, every staff member we interacted with was friendly, helpful, and warm. They took a good hotel and made it special. We'll definitely look for more Hotel Palomars wherever we travel.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Perfect”
Reviews.Author: fundiego
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Palomar does everything right. It has great curb appeal, and the modern look carries into the lobby and public spaces of the property. We especially liked the gym, which featured a wide selection of modern equipment and a sizable lap pool. The trendy vibe carries into the guest rooms, where wood touches and neutral colors make the rooms warm and homey. The bed was top-notch (not too firm, not too soft) and, along with the great black-out drapes and a/c (summer in Chicago is hot), made for a great sleep. The little touches, like really tasty room service and the complimentary happy hour (ice-cold sangria was a perfect treat on a hot summer afternoon), made this a stay we won't soon forget! Definitely a top choice for a city hotel in Chicago!!!

Reviews.Title: “Its was Fantastic for Us”
Reviews.Author: BadgerTraveler2
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend at the Palomar with our two children just before school started. I called Charles Kerl the Concierge before I made reservations and told him what we wanted and he recommended the Luxury 1 bedroom suite. It had a door on the bedroom, pullout couch, and the spa bathroom. The room was in new condition and very large. I am a light sleeper and the room was very quiet, except for street noises, but I got acustom to that and a fan provided by the hotel helped. Check in and help with luggage was very easy and everyone was very nice. Charles tried to get us a reservation at the last minute at a small place, but they never answered the phone. I could never get through before the trip myself. The kids had welcome bags at check-in and a gold fish was waiting in the room with a coupon for cookies and milk. They just loved it.
