We had room service for breakfast twice and once for dinner after a long day. The food was excellent, hot, and delivered very quickly. The kids loved the fresh toast. The pool is very small and shallow, but our kids still had fun in it. All in all I would recommend this property, very nice, quiet, good service, and close to everything. Charles

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Saltrat
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at Hotel Palomar while in Chicago for a conference. I couldn't have been more pleased. This is what you would expect of a Kimpton Hotel. Stylish, minimalist, a bit whimsical, and excellent service. For a small additional fee I was upgraded to a corner king room on the 14th floor, with a great view of the city. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the service was outstanding, with nightly turn-down and chocolates on the pillow. The location is prime: An easy walk to the Magnificent Mile, Art Institute, Museum of Contemporary Art, and so forth. The staff was universally friendly and accomodating. Free coffee and tea in the morning and a complimentary hosted wine bar from 5:00 to 6:00. The restaurant, Sable, is also excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I hoped it would be!”
Reviews.Author: Synne9
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel for a recent conference trip based on the great reviews and wasn't disappointed. It was new, chic, comfortable, and in a great location. I booked a package with Perfect Escapes with daily breakfast, a bottle of champagne, and late check-out, which was definitely the way to go. The rooftop terrace was a nice little spot to sit, and the indoor pool looked nice. People had mentioned the sliding (and thus not-quite-fully-sealing) bathroom door as being possibly awkward, but I didn't find it to be a major issue when sharing the room with a colleague for one of the nights. Loved all the thoughtful touches: L'Occitane toiletries, water bottles at the door, animal-print robes, the evening wine reception. The staff were quite a good-looking and helpful group, too. I also signed up for the loyalty program, which gets your your paper of choice daily, free wireless, and some minibar goodies. (Definitely all loyalty-inspiring perks.) The only downside is that the street on the south side of the hotel (the one my room faced) seems to be the main drag for fire engines and ambulances, so it did get a little noisy at times.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful new (but cool) hotel with...”
Reviews.Author: highrollerreefing
Reviews.Content: Wonderful new (but cool) hotel with excellent restaurant and right next to The Magnificient Mile.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Sputnik_NYC
Reviews.Content: The Palomar exceeded expectations. Check-in was a breeze, friendly and efficient, and I was upgraded to a King Spa Premier Room. The room was gorgeous -- spacious, stylish modern decor, colorful well-arranged furniture, and meticulously maintained. The huge bathroom, clad in beautiful sand-colored marble and granite, was stunning, with an enormous soaking tub with whirlpool jets, large glass-enclosed shower and gleaming fixtures. The king-sized bed was extremely comfortable, with high-quality linens, and faced a 37" LG flat-screen TV. Signing up for Kimpton InTouch resulted in a $10 minibar credit and free in-room wireless internet, with a strong signal. Breakfast in the Sable restaurant was two poached eggs, pepper-crusted bacon, home fries and sourdough toast at a fairly priced $11. Fresh-squeezed OJ, hot strong coffee, and excellent raspberry preserves. Check-out was also a snap. I highly recommend this outstanding hotel and look forward to returning the next time I'm in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great room. Fantastic service. Refreshing experience.”
Reviews.Author: ajr_atlanta
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in August 2010 with my family (spouse, a toddler and an infant). We had a King Spa room which was great. The hotel had place a pack 'n play in our room and an extra fridge (at our request) for the baby food. They even gave us a microwave and an extra bed at our request. The hotel location is great. Two-three blocks from Michigan avenue. Very close to great restaurants and public transport. The room was surprisingly large and even with all the extra things we asked for, we had plenty of sitting room to unwind. Every evening they have a one hour "reception" in the lobby where they serve wine and juices. It allows you to mingle or just have a drink and talk to some of the hotel employees. The service was great, the hotel ws wonderful and it was great value for money. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to Chicago with small kids.

Reviews.Title: “New, modern and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Matkailija58
Reviews.Content: What could one say about a hotel when all essentials are excellent? One start to look at the details but still it's difficult to complain about something. We still try. The bell boy left our luggage unattented in the middle of reception hall when we came in and we had to take them to our room by ourselves. The corner of our bed was hidden by the linen so that we both hit our legs on it. The lamp in our room was almost broken although still working. Socket power outlet didn't have a proper contact. - But, hey come on. This hotel is excellent, the staff is nice, helpful and smiling. The breakfast tastes good. L'Occitane amenities are pure luxury as well the interior design of the room. What else are you looking for? To be welcomed by your own name? Have separate pillow or soap selection? Then this hotel is not for you :)

Reviews.Title: “Never want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: Magpie0778
Reviews.Content: I have always being a reader, never a review writer.. Well I just couldn't help myself this time.. I just L O V E the Palomar Hotel. I'm still here and don't want to leave. It truly takes a lot to WOW me. The staff is amazing and friendly. I felt like I was back home in GA where everyone talks to everyone. When you have a group of 20 and they can STILL remember all of your names.. That's amazing!! I love the energy every time I walk in. Its in a great location and everything is close by..

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Skivonnie
Reviews.Content: Great, new, clean hotel with a staff that knows how to take care of the guests. Try the pork belly flat bread at the restaurant and the scrambled eggs with veggies for room service in the morning. The location is perfect for exploring the delights of the city. The bed and linens ultra comfortable. If you're lucky enough to score a one bedroom suite enjoy the Figi soaking tub big enough for two Samarii warriors!!! The young trendy staff is beautiful & hip! I'm a very troubled sleeper and did pretty well here on the 10th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Was in Chicago the weekend of Sept 17-19...”
Reviews.Author: Zoobabu
Reviews.Content: Was in Chicago the weekend of Sept 17-19, 2010 to see the city and stayed at the Palomar. It's only been open for a few months so everything is still new and shiny. Front desk staff were helpful. The 5-6pm wine hour is a great way to meet fellow guests and sample new wines. Another great Kimpton hotel in a convenient location. Grab breakfast a block away at Eatt diner where the portions are HUGE.

Reviews.Title: “solid”
Reviews.Author: TravelingChumley
Reviews.Content: after staying at the Hotel Solamar in San Diego by fluke, I met a young staff person who recommended the Palomar. She said she works for the Kimpton people and was sold on the product. I've stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn across the street and the Omni a few blocks away. This place rates up there if not better than the Omni. The building is very well built. The fitness center was roomy and bright with newer machines. The young lady who checked me in did not give me a honor bar key and I went back to the desk and asked if I had my In Touch membership on file and it was. You get $10 worth of honor bar usage during your stay. I never knew about this service until meeting that young lady at the Solamar. Red Line at the corner and if you were to go to Wrigley, walk to Dearborn and take the 22 Clark bus instead of the L, you see much more of the city. Supermarket half a block away, great great location and facility.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific -- we will go back”
Reviews.Author: MTMusings
Reviews.Content: Dropped kid off for college and stayed two nights. Great location, fine breakfast, very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: merseydave
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Palomar for 11 nights whilst we explored Chicago and around. The Hotel is in a convenient spot on State and Illinois street. At the minute, State St is closed Southbound outside the hotel so if you are arriving by GPS bare the local diversion in mind. For metro users is right on Grand and Red â€“ In summer there is a free trolley bus that passes the side of the hotel down to the Navy Pier for all its attractions. On arriving, its not apparent that the car Valet is on State Street as you can see the hotel approaching down Illinois and that you drive under the porch- not just sit on the road. Us English people may not be used to it! For those bits and bobs there is a huge supermarket on the next block open till 11 every night- including Sunday. The room was great, large king bed, flat screen TV, desk, free internet if you become a friend of Kimpton before you go and once there you can put all your devices on like your i phone and laptop. People have mentioned the bathroom door- bit of an issue if one of you is â€œusing the facilitiesâ€� when the maid comes in for turndown service- great though that they fill your ice bucket. The light above the the room entrance flickered even when turned off- not apparent by day, but by night â€“ like sleeping in a lighthouse, so after the first night we had to get them to remove the bulb. Itâ€™s a common problem in the rooms and a problem with the wiring The restaurant, Sable is good, good food for sharing. The staff are friendly, special mention to David on valet who was chatty and knowledgeable about the city- good with advice and directions as was the stunningly handsome Patrick, always there with a smile to greet you and knowledge of the local facilities. There are the usual Kimpton things, wine at 5 hosted by staff , coffee at breakfast- although I have to say the coffee was grainy and not too nice! The hotel holds weddings and events and the only negative really was the at weekend when the hotel was really busy and getting the car out of valet took 30 minutes standing about despite phoning down 10 mins ahead- the message hadnâ€™t got through to the guys at the valet- not enough staff! The valet is also $46 a day, so budget for that or use the parking lot opposite . Overall- a great stay and I would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect blend of value, service, and elegance”
Reviews.Author: BundyLexington
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest hotels we've ever visited, from the professionalism of the bellhops, service desk, all the way to the cleanliness, elegance, and stylish design of the elevators, floors, and rooms. Great value in downtown Chicago. We'll be checking out the other U.S. Kimpton hotels based on the wonderful experience at this one. Our 13-year and 11-year olds loved it, too!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a fabulous extended weekend”
Reviews.Author: seaguy8
Reviews.Content: I had previously stayed at another Hotel Palomar in DC, so my expectation was high when I chose this hotel. Upon arrival at the hotel around 11am, the check-in was prompt but since the hotel was full, the room requested (pet-free and away from elevator)was not ready. Our bags were stored and we went for lunch and the guest service representative asked for my phone number so I could be reached when the room was ready. However, I never received the call and we head back to the hotel around 3pm, the official check-in time, and the room was ready. The room requested had 2 Queen size beds and the room size was larger than expected. It was nicely decorated but the view was very limited. Bed was comfortable and room was quiet. A bottle of complimentary wine was delivered to the room since I mentioned when the room was booked that we were celebrating our birthdays that weekend. That was indeed a nice touch. However, we had to request the key to the bar to access the bottle opener as we were not given when checked-in. The evening cocktail hour was a fabulous touch, the sangria was good and the wine was decent. The rooftop patio, gym and pool were comfortable and great during the stay. Location of the hotel was steps away from the subway and few blocks from the shopping areas. There were many restaurants around and location was also convenient to the river and parks. Overall, the hotel was very good and I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel made the start to our holiday wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Carolos
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband and two friends stayed in The Palomar for 3 nights at the end of August. We were starting our holiday in Chicago and then doing a road trip for two weeks through Wisconsin across to Michigan and finishing back in Chicago. I had got fantastic rates for the Palomar when I booked for us a couple of months prior to our stay and having stayed in a Kimpton Hotel in San Fransisco last year, knew generally what to expect (including the free evening wine party). Everything about the hotel was fantastic, the way we were greeeted on arrival, our lovely rooms and the location of the hotel with great restaurants, jazz & blues clubs and bars all nearby. We also received numerous free vouchers for cocktails in Sable bar attached to the hotel as we knew the password for the month when checking in (Check Facebook/Twitter). There is a wonderful terrace on the roof with a pool where you can relax for a while if the weather is good as it was when we were there. Unfortunately, the rates had greatly increased when we enquired about returning for our last 3 nights so we stayed elsewhere but all the great reviews about this hotel are accurate and we would have no hesitation in recommending it - go you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel - can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: jlrvs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a weekend at this hotel and had an amazing trip! You can see from other reviews what people liked about the hotel. But our favorite spot was the rooftop terrace - perfect spot for morning coffee and for a glass of wine before dinner! Great views of downtown and the lake, and a nice way to relax! The pool off the terrace is so pretty, it's small but very resort-like. My other favorite aspect of the hotel was the service - our room was cleaned several times a day, with nice little notes about the weather, chocolates, new toiletries (which are L'Occitane!!), etc. We stayed in a King room and had plenty of space. Don't forget Sable - the restaurant/bar off the lobby. We had drinks there one night, and it is a fun, lively hot spot with nice bartenders! This hotel is close to the red line of the transit, and walking distance to tons of fun bars and restaurants - about a 15 minute walk to Navy Pier, 3 blocks to Michigan and 2 blocks to the river!. Short cab ride to Lincoln Park and West Loop. I didn't love the bathroom doors, but it really doesn't change my overall opinion of this wonderful hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Home away form home”
Reviews.Author: George.Quinones
Reviews.Content: We just spend 4 wonderful days over labor day weekend at the Palomar hotel for our anniversary. The hotel is centrally located next to restaurants, and shopping. The staff at the front desk were attentive to our needs. Mark and Charles at the concierge desk were always available and ready to recommend restaurants and places to go. The sangria at the happy hour is a must, donâ€™t miss out on it. We will return to Chicago and will be staying at the Palomar again. Tell Blue George and Theresa say hello. Thanks again for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: OakONResident
Reviews.Content: Our excellent experience of Chicago was further enhanced by our stay at the Palomar. This modern hotel's location is excellent, and allowed us to walk everywhere - the Loop, theatres, the Magnificent Mile, Navy Pier, CAF Architectural boat tour dock, etc......

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with perfect location”
Reviews.Author: wgr
Reviews.Content: This new hotel in the Kimpton Chain has great service, excellent beds, a fabulous location (right at Grand Station on North State Street on the Red line and a few blocks off Michigan Avenue, the Chicago River and the theatre district)' Morning coffee downstairs (no coffee maker in the room and could offer a biscotti or something) and afternoon wine in the lounge, decent roof deck with swimming pool, decent prices. Great young friendly and very helpful staff. Nordstroms in the next block. Business centre a rip off, $6.95 for 15 minutes and .49 per page to print.

Reviews.Title: “Great everything!!”
Reviews.Author: smfry15
Reviews.Content: Love kimpton hotels!!

Reviews.Title: “My new #1...great value, fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lchilds72
Reviews.Content: Staff: top notch... Everyone was amazing... From front desk, concierge, even housekeeping. Rooms: I had a King Spa room. The bathroom was indulgent...Fugi tub especially Location: in the middle of everything, however not too much in the way of crowds. I used the El. Blue line from OHare to Jackson. Free transfer to redlined & off at Grand, which is right at the hotel. $2.25 each way... Beats cab fare! I'm a 30 something female and felt very safe. Great way to save $$$ Resturant (Sable): yummy food at great prices Kimpton InTouch: join ahead & you can use WiFi free & get $10 worth of goodies from the minibar.. Free! We even had our favorite snx ready & waiting for us, just because we shared about the reason for our visit. Truly, top notch service! I really can NOT emphasize what a great addition this is to the River North/Mag Mile area. I've stayed in 9-10 very nice hotels within this area, & this is BY FAR the best. Thx to the Palomar!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tallguy187
Reviews.Content: We got an excellent rate compared to other hotels out there and decided to go with this. Great decision as the reviews are spot on. Pros: Excellent Location - Near the Red Line subway station, In the middle of downtown, close enough to Michigan Avenue without the bustle, Walking distance to tons of restaurants, fast food, convenient stores (7-Eleven, Jewel Osco, Walgreens these will help you save tons of money) Excellent Service - The staff always try to meet your requests. If you ask them for assistance they go out of their way to help. This includes the front desks and the doormen. Great Rooms and facilities- Nice comfy beds, big TVs, nice gym, balcony etc. The free coffee and tea in the morning is nice and the reception at 6pm is also nice especially when its warm in the summer and you need something cool to drink. Cons: Hate to harp on it but as everyone says, the bathroom doors need to be replaced. I'm not sure who thought a sliding door that slid 90% of the way was a good idea. Last point on how to save on WiFi: Wifi is free if you sign up for a Kimpton In-Touch account before coming. Then use the email address you used when logging in for the first time. Also a good way to save on travel is to take the Subway there. Take the Blue line from Ohare to Jackson, transfer to the Red Line (to Howard) and stop at the Grand station. You can also save by buying essentials like water etc from the stores near by. Have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: bowtiewormy
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in the heart of downtown Chicago, extremely clean and modern. A short walk to Michigan Ave and many excellent restaurants. Evening wine reception was fun, nice way to meet other travellers and get some ideas for your visit. The staff were very helpful and courteous. No trouble to check your bags if you arrive prior to check-in or plan to stay a little late on the last day. Approx $7.00 cab ride from Amtrak station (Union Station). You can catch the free trolley to the Navy Pier from State St. Make sure that you sign up for the Kimpton rewards plan if you haven't already. They gave us a $10.00 credit for the mini-bar. It was hard to leave, we'll be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel--one of my favorites ever”
Reviews.Author: katiekins570
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and pretty much never wanted to leave. First of all, it was very well located, right downtown in the River North area. We could walk to almost everywhere we wanted to go. The staff are incredibly friendly, starting with check-in and continuing throughout our stay. We also loved the room, which was spacious and comfortable, with great extras like an iPod dock and fun bathrobes. The photos of the World's Fair in the rooms are lovely also. And the bed was really comfortable with nice linens. We also enjoyed the nightly free wine reception, which was held in a very stylish room off the lobby. I recommend joining the Kimpton rewards program before you go--it's free and gets you lots of extras. It meant we had free wi-fi, a free New York Times (our request) every morning, and a coupon for $10 worth of stuff from the minibar. We also tried the bar/restaurant attached to the hotel--very good food and drinks in a fun environment, with many locals there for the bar. Maybe the only criticism I have is that the pool is sort of small and in a funny steamy room; when we tried to go it was taken up by one large rambunctious famly, and we felt there wasn't room for us. Also, we had read parking was expensive at the hotel, so we parked in a lot directly across the street which was very convenient and a good bit cheaper. Overall, we had a fantastic stay and will definitely return if we go back to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Montreal Home Girl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Palomar for five nights in August and had a wonderful experience. The room was comfortable and clean with a flat screen TV and plenty of room. The only odd thing was that the bathroom door was a slider that didn't completely close so if youâ€™re the shy type that might be a small problem. Every morning there's free coffee and tea and at 5:00pm every evening they serve you wine, sangria and lemonade, in the living room, off the lobby. Everyone that works there is kind and polite and more than willing to help you. The hotel is situated in a great location, walking distance to the Magnificent Mile, the beach and Millennium Park. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “far exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: redandmed
Reviews.Content: mM husband and I stayed overnight to celebrate our anniversary...the room and the hotel were just outstanding...the decor, the friendliness and all of the amenities were above and beyond what we've experienced at any other hotel. There are many complimentary services, such as arnold palmers in the mid-afternoon and wine tasting in the evening. The rooftop terrace is especially comfortable and scenic. The concierge was fantastic in recommending a nearby restaurant (Shaw's) for its lobster. Everything was such a special treat and so superior to other hotels we've gone to for our annual overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, modern hotel with great staff and cool vibe!”
Reviews.Author: rand415
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I visited Chicago in August 2010. We spent one evening at this hotel and the rest of our time there with friends. The hotel was in a good location and was very cool. A swanky, modern feel inside with incredibly friendly staff. Our rooms were not huge but were very nice - with flat screen TV's and a nice bathroom. We loved the daily hour-long wine reception (free glass of wine), and got to take advantage of this our first night there. They had a very tasty sangria during this reception. Also, we didn't check it out but they had a small indoor pool upstairs and a few tables/chairs upstairs on the rooftop, which many people were using when we did check it out. I enjoyed my stay here and would recommend it to anyone interested in staying in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a weekend”
Reviews.Author: talya4513
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Palomar from 8/20-8/22 in a King spa room. Room was very clean and modern. Only thing that was annoying was that for a relatively new hotel, the bed already had two " valleys" from where people slept. Some nice touches were in the evening time, the hotel had a wine tasting and in the room there were some rather hilarious bath robes ( one cheetah print & one zebra print) to use. Overall a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel right in the middle of downtown”
Reviews.Author: workpanda
Reviews.Content: Pros: -clean, large rooms -excellent location (minutes from Magnificent Mile, good restaurants, Chicago River, EL train) -daily coffee and wine service in lobby Cons: -sliding door on bathroom which means zero privacy -$10/day for Wifi or $6 to use business centre

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean, with superior staffing.”
Reviews.Author: offtocrete
Reviews.Content: It was a wonderful time, the continental breakfast included with the room was perfect, fresh seasonal fruit, fresh squeezed orange juice, amazing raspberry jam with a choice of breads. The evening wine tasting is also a welcoming touch. Our room was large, very clean and modern. I would will certainly be back, but I will request a different room, the AC in the room we visited was unusually loud which was disturbing at night.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect beginning of our holiday”
Reviews.Author: tourleader038
Reviews.Content: After an 8hour flight from Europe, we checked in at the reception of this hotel. The day we arrived it was my husbands birthday;when I made the reservation I had asked if the hotel could arrange something[fruit or flowers]. What a big surprise when we found out we had an upgrade,we had a beautiful suite,we really couldn't believe what we saw. We enjoyed every minute of our stay,the room,the staff ,the wine hour, all is perfect. I don't know if we will be able to come back to Chicago, if we can we will stay in hotel Palomar.

Reviews.Title: “Great shopping location”
Reviews.Author: lizrogatz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I thought this would be a fun hotel to try with our 7 and 10 year old daughters. It is a great location to shop Michigan Avenue and the Northbridge Shops. It is a bit far to walk to Millennium Park in the August heat. We arrived a 3 to find our room was not ready - which I always find annoying. We got snack chits to use in the restaurant, which was better than just indoor pool passes. Our room was ready at 4 after sharing a DELICIOUS flatbread and pretzel nuggets with dipping sauce. The room was very nice and clean with 2 queen beds. The only thing that was odd was the bathroom door that slides like a barn door. This does not give adequate privacy, if you are not with the closest of friends or family (ie: you can be in total view while sitting on the toilet). A nice touch is the complimentary "wine hour" in the lobby from 5 -6, where red, white and sangria were offered. The indoor pool was slightly less inviting - more of a lap pool than a pool that kids would enjoy splashing around in. The outdoor terrace adjacent to the pool was quite nice, but no snack or beverage service was offered. Overall, I think it was a good value, as we paid $159 and comfortably accommodated 4 of us in a room. There are quite a few dinner options to walk to, which is nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Royal treatment, friendly service & b-day treats”
Reviews.Author: travelling_urbanista
Reviews.Content: When planning a trip to Chicago to celebrate my boyfriend's 30th b-day, I wanted a nice hotel close to the action, with a pool and of course a high tripadvisor rating. Hotel Palomar was my pick. In order to make my hubby's b-day trip special I emailed the General Manager, Nabil Moubayed, to request a little surprise of a small cake or complimentary breakfast. He responded quickly that he was happy to accommodate the request. Upon our arrival (which was so easy on the subway from Midway airport right to a station within 1 min walk to Palomar) we were greeted by Julie who was so friendly and told that we had been upgraded to a king deluxe room. This was unexpected and a nice surprise. The surprises kept on coming when we found two birthday cupcakes (which were DELICIOUS!), two small bottles of pink champagne and a card from Mr. Moubayed, in our room. We also received 2 complimentary drinks at the hotel's bar. This really made our stay special. We were very happy with the hotel, especially with: - the friendly staff - so nice to get eye contact and smiles - a clean, spotless room - a comfy bed - free coffee in the morning - pleasant chit chat with other guests included - free wine & sangria for one hour in the early evening - a nice little rooftop patio & pool (pool is quite shallow but perfect for wading) - awesome location, lots of shops and restaurants to choose from I have nothing bad to say but a couple of things that might be of concern to particular travellers: - bathroom has a sliding door and does have gaps (really not a problem) - sometimes we waited more than 2-3 mins for the elevators I will be back to the Hotel Palomar and recommend it to all of those that want a boutique style hotel with impeccable service & the highest of standards!

Reviews.Title: “friendly, helpful, fun staff, super room and several surprises!”
Reviews.Author: Tbouy
Reviews.Content: Saw a "summer special" and booked a long weekend for a summer get a way. I think I have found my new Chicago base of operations. Fantastic service, very friendly and fun staff (D the doorman and Amanda the AGM were most memorable). Location is tops and the coffee and wine in lobby were much appreciated. The roof top plaza, while small, was a haven for us in the late afternoons and early evening. Did not use the pool but it looked fine. Only suggestion is to have in-room coffee available. I shall return! PS: join the loyalty program and get free internet and other goodies.

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful hotel in the middle of it all”
Reviews.Author: GLCheerCoach
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay here. This was my second stay at Hotel Palomar and both experiences were great. The decor is very nice and the rooms are spacious with plenty of amenities. Don't miss the roof top patio that over looks the city, it has a great city view and doors that open up to the pool. The staff was very friendly and helpful for finding resatuarants and local attractions. One added bonus is the daily wine happy hour in the lobby, perfect after a day of meetings. Close enough to walk to Navy Pier and Grant Park, or shopping on Michigan Avenue. Plenty of delicious restaurants close by as well.

Reviews.Title: “A different kind of hotel with a fun vibe!”
Reviews.Author: Cavi
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Palomar. The service was supreme. The location was very convenient to everything you would want to do in Chicago. Everything about the hotel is fun, even the animal print lush terry robes. I was impressed with the breakfast. Everything they serve is fresh and local, even the sausage.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - in August we stayed here twice - Be back soon!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gabrielle16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palomar twice in August. Once with our daughter for 5 days and then just the two of us. The double Queen was spacious as was the King room. The beds are divine, interior design is pieceful, a joy for the eye - great taste! The service is perfect. I could go on compiimenting on other details. Restaurant Sable is a delight. We'll be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton hotels never disappoint!”
Reviews.Author: GinDandy
Reviews.Content: I love Kimpton - you always get a modern, clean, trendy hotel in a good location for a fair price, The Hotel Palomar was no exception. The rooms were average size, comfortable and pristine. Location was perfect to explore the area and the best part is Sable Kitchen and Bar in the lobby - amazing cocktails and food!

Reviews.Title: “great location & great everything”
Reviews.Author: WMC08
Reviews.Content: We come to Chicago often and this was the best overall hotel we have stayed at so far. The location is ideal - it is on the same block as the red line train, a few blocks from the Michigan ave mile, and walking distance to the loop. There are lots of great restaurants and nightlife nearby, in fact it is across the stree from Rock Bottom Brewery (try the roof top bar on a nice night) and a block away from some of the new Hubbard street bars. Uno's pizza, Lou Malnatis pizza, frontera grill, and the purple pig are only a few blocks away. The room was clean and well appointed with a mini fridge/var. The bed was very comfortable. The service from the front desk and doormen was helpful and pleasant. The hotel offers wine and beverage receptions daily. The red line train can take you to the loop (state street) or north to Wrigleyville. You can go to the Chicago red line station (one station north of the Grand station located next to the hotel) or other main stations and purchase a 3 day or 5 day metro pass that works on the El train stations and the busses. Many locals use the bus to get around because the train stations are not always convenient so don't be afraid to use the bus instead of the train espcially going up and down Mich Ave and to/from the museum campus.

Reviews.Title: “High quality and good value”
Reviews.Author: MJCarroll
Reviews.Content: There is a lot to like about this property and it is a hotel that gives 5 star touch and feel for a 4 star price. Comments: One of our traveling party had a housekeeping mix-up but the staff was appropriately apologetic. There is a small but serviceable swimming pool and a great sun deck adjacent to the pool which is in turn adjacent to a well equipped health club. The pictures both on tripadvisor and on the official website fairly depict the rooms and common areas. A standard king guest room is not a large as similar rooms at some larger 4 star properties in the area, but is bigger than some standard rooms at other so-called 4 star properties in the river north area. Funky and fun music plays constantly in the common areas and elevators. The rooms are quiet and the beds are comfortable with excellent linens.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Weeping_Tree
Reviews.Content: Only stayed for a night, before moving onto the W when my friends arrived the next day, but what an experience at the Palomar. Customer service was top-notch. When I arrived in the taxi the bellhop took my bags and when he opened the door to the cab, said "Welcome Mr. ...." I was stunned for a second and asked how he knew my last name, "It's on your airline tags" he said. I was just floored. Something so small but so detailed set up what was to be a great stay. The receptionist was lovely and without saying anything, she advised I was upgraded to a suite. I paid the normal rate and did nothing, that I know of, to warrant this! The room was lovely and expansive. Spent most of the afternoon at the pool, which was very nice as well. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Chicago. In comparison to the W I felt this was heaps better and much less $$$.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our visit”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel52
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights at the end of July for a short vacation. We actually saw it listed in one of the travel magazines we get. We got a fairly decent rate and coughed up the $46 per night for valet parking. It was convenient. Our stay was extremely nice. Easy check in. The staff was all courteous and very helpful. I joined the Kimpton In-touch program before reserving and, with that, got $10 worth of mini-bar items free and a free morning paper. We got a paper the first day, but not the 2nd day. I called to the desk and we got one...they actually had to go buy one someplace!?!? The room was really clean. There are some reviews that mention the bathroom door. It is different...it slides...and does not close all the way. But if you are related-- a little inch or two should not matter. We did not stop for the free wine in the evening or use the bar/restaurant attached. We did use the pool. They say it is heated...but I am not sure about that. The location was perfect for walking. The free trolley that goes to Navy Pier stops right across the street. If the price was right, we definitely would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: dmoutsop
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Palomar for a long weekend in August. I signed up for the Kimpton rewards program just before booking, and also found out about their 'secret password' program. So upon check-in I said the password and we got upgraded to a luxury suite. Perfect! The room was nicely designed and spacious, with a fabulous bathroom, great workstation and heavenly bed. Since I'd signed up for the Kimpton rewards program, I got free WiFi (!) and also got my preferred feather pillows and NYT delivered in the morning. All of these little things amounted to what was a fantastic stay! The staff all around was friendly and helpful. The hotel has a 'living room' off the lobby, which is exquisitely designed, where they serve morning coffee and evening wine. We didn't get to sample the wine unfortunately, but both morning took advantage of the coffee. It is really a nice touch. They even had iced coffee, as well as Mighty Leaf Tea (read: great tea). In between the coffee and wine, they served homemade lemonade and iced tea - fabulous! I also have to give the hotel's restaurant, Sable, massive kudos. We ate there our second night. By the end we wished we had eaten there the first. The cocktails are absolutely out of this world, and the food was amazing. Service was also fantastic, and the prices are completely reasonable. My only gripe is that the dining area was as cold as a refrigerator, so we sat in the (equally nice) bar area instead. I'll end with this: I've stayed in several Chicago hotels at similar price points. No other hotel comes remotely close to the Hotel Palomar. For the same price I've stayed at hotels without any of the personal touches or extra amenities, where I've felt like part of the tourist herd. We did not feel this way at Palomar. It's absolutely fantastic and we'd stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “It could have been great.”
Reviews.Author: Indianaboy
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fantastic. We did all that we could in 2 nights in chicago. Everything went smooth,,,,, except,,,, we could not get the room temperature stable. The configuration of the room was such that the air conditioning would blow directly on the bed. Specifically right in my face. It would blow in my face, get real cold and them stop allowing it to get very warm again. This went on all night, my wife and I did not get a good nights sleep. Then we had to drive home with no sleep. I hope that most of the other rooms in this hotel are not configured in this way.

Reviews.Title: “Overall ratings are clearly incorrect”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler_Paul
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on Trip Advisor rating and was disappointed from the moment we arrived. I had asked by email if we could get a roll-out bed for my 20 year old daughter so that we can all share the same room. I was told that the room would probably be a bit cramped, so when offered a junior suite upgrade for $100 extra per night I thought I would go for it and get something really special for myself, wife and daughter for their first trip to Chicago. The suite was 'OK', the safe gave me problems from start to finish. They sent an engineer 3 times, who supposedly had fixed the safe each time, but no it was still not working. Finally the guy today fixed it after offering me a replacement safe - on our last day of the stay. Too late my man. Room service.. I checked in advance that the hotel does have 24 hour room service. We often are out late and want a good pot of tea and biscuits when we get back. Sorry sir, we don't have any English breakfast, or cookies, or cheese plate. The after 10PM menu is a bit of a joke, unless you want to top up your carbs for the the rest of the day (!!!). Maybe I was expecting too much? I didnt think so from what was supposed to be rated one of the top hotels in Chicago from Trip Advisor reviews. When I signed up for the internet the online questions asked me if I would like a particular paper delivered to my room the next day. Sure I would - excellent idea. Come morning, we go to look. The room across the corridor had a paper, but I'm afraid not us. We are in a Suite remember? Is it possible to expect exemplary service when not only in a 'great' hotel, but also when you are paying an extra $100 a night for the suite? Maybe I am just off base here? The other thing was, we had booked into a 'city view' room. Which I thought meant a view of this wonderful city of Chicago (a really spectacular city for those of you who have not yet visited). The view we had was of a construction site on the road. We would later the next day go on the spectacular river cruise Architectural tour, and would see indeed what we were missing - I could have booked the Westin or the W for the same price, and had a much much better, indeed spectacular view. So, we head out for our first day, after pointing out the safe issues, the lack of tea facilities (there are none in the room, and no tea worth drinking from room service after 10pm), the 'wonderful' view and the lack of a newspaper to the front desk. We get back at 3PM and find our room has not been cleaned yet. Good god. So I call down and they explain that the cleaning staff are working their way around. How about you get to the suites (aka people who are spending the most money in your hotel) first? So we potter around for a bit, shower and get a knock on the door around 4:30PM from the cleaning staff - we asked if they could come back in 30 minutes. We head out. Get back around 10PM. Still no room cleaning!! Wow. They finally came to clean the room at noon the next day. after we had been out for breakfast and were just heading out for our sightseeing. There was no way I was going to stop them from coming into the room at that time... We needed clean sheets and towels. Or maybe this is expecting too much? I could go on about several other items, but most are really just regarding the 'nothing special' level of quality and service in the hotel. Seriously, if you are expecting special, go elsewhere. My main bitterness is that I was so sure that the Trip Advisor rating would not let me down, but please please - buyer beware. I would not stay at this hotel again if it were half the price i paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice vibe & location-however not quite ready for prime time in June”
Reviews.Author: urban-anthro
Reviews.Content: I am a bit late in writing this review, having stayed in June for my daughters college graduation. We booked our rooms with Kimpton in touch pre opening special rate of $89. Was supposed to include wine, which no one had any knowledge of-no big deal. Hotel itself is lovely. Room was not large, but well appointed. Staff friendly and really tried, but kinks had not yet been worked out. For example, day of graduation when we were running a bit late, valet brought our car, but failed to leave the keys and vanished, causing undue stress for our family. There was also a windstorm which knocked out the satellite TV. Certainly not the fault of the hotel, but this was in the thick of the world cup and our family are huge soccer fans. We were not able to get proper information about what was going on, or when the system would be back up. Everyone we spoke with had a different story. We were also misdirected as to where we could catch the games-sent to an ESPN Zone down the street which was closed etc. Nothing major, but if I were paying rack rate, I would not have been happy. We ended up extending our stay but the Palomar was booked. We Pricelined a room at the Omni for the same price and quite frankly had a nicer room and a more together experience that night. Would still give the Palomar another try when in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Third Stay and it just Keeps Getting Better!”
Reviews.Author: guess2
Reviews.Content: I recently treated a friend to an overnight stay at the Palomar in celebration of her successful battle with breast cancer. This was my third stay this year and her first. We were thrilled that our room was ready early. I cannot stress enough how friendly everyone at this hotel is and they truly go out of their way to be courteous and accomodating. The afternoon tea and lemonade were wonderful after shopping and the evening wine reception is such a nice touch. We also had a drink in the adjoining restaurant. In the morning there is complimentary coffee and tea. The location is great for walking along the river, shopping and dining, as well as visiting Navy Pier. The rooms are spacious, uniquely decorated and immaculately clean. This is definitely my favorite hotel in the city next to the Peninsula, but with the rates being so vastly different, and the service equal at both, I find myself repeatedly choosing Hotel Palomar.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Great Service, High Class almost Snobby Hotel”
Reviews.Author: foureyedg
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in over a dozen hotels in Chicago. The Palomar was by far one of the best. Most of the staff was great. We had an upgraded spa room with huge floor to ceiling windows. The bar is a must stop, great scotch, beer, and absinthe selection. When there talk to John behind the bar. He was helpful, attentive, knowledgeable, and over all exceptional. Some of the other older staff seem a bit snobby. Acting as though their job was beneath them. The pool is small but has an awesome view. The concierge was on top of her game. With her help we got THE best table at Smith & Wollensky and a wonderful sushi restaurant. All in all the Palomar is a wonderful addition to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kwtlax
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Hotel Palomar in July while in town searching for places to live. After reading the rave reviews on TripAdvisor, I decided to book after finding a great deal on Orbitz. I have to say, well done reviewers! The hotel was all we expected. The staff was incredibly friendly and very knowledgable about the area. The location is perfect - steps from Michigan Ave and sitting on top of the Red Line stop, which was perfect for us. The rooms are great - funky design, really comfortable. Great night sleep on the bed too. I could not have asked for more! I would definitely recommend staying here. Just make sure you have the location handy if you are taking a taxi/share ride from the airport - it's still pretty new and not everyone knows where it is.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish with a wonderful bathtub”
Reviews.Author: claired13
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in a King Spa Premier Room as a special one-night treat after getting LEGALLY married in Iowa that morning. I selected this hotel because of the Kimpton reputation, and exceptional corporate policies. I love being able to recycle at the hotel, just as I do at home. I also really love that they had a Pride package rate this summer (which we were never able to work with our summer schedule). Making the reservation was time-consuming because the website said rooms were available, but I kept getting error messages when trying to book the room. Then I called the number on their website and they told me they were "fully committed" for the night we were trying to book. So then I got on a discount travel website and booked the hotel room for that night in two seconds. Too bad I wasted all that time on the Hotel Website! Frustrating!!! Now, on to the hotel itself. The swimming pool is very small and was full of kids when we were there. The pool also does not get deeper than 3-feet-7-inches, so it's very shallow. I do like the roof top deck a lot. Nice view, comfy chairs. Valet parking was VERY expensive ($46), but our car's contents were safe so I'd say it was worth the money. We were moving across the country so our car was FILLED with stuff and everything was kept safe and the valets were super speedy and our car arrived in no time after we checked out. Friendly valets. When we arrived, Bleu was very fun to talk to. Super nice guy. When we saw him later, a bell hop had obviously told him that we were celebrating our LEGAL IOWA marriage, and he told us "Congratulations!" So sweet of him to remember us and congratulate us! My very favorite part of our hotel room was our bathtub! We stayed in a King Spa Premier room and the Fuji soaking tub is wonderful! I have stayed in a LOT of VERY nice hotels with very nice bathtubs, but this was my very favorite bath tub! The room was immaculately clean, and beautifully designed. So aesthetically pleasing! Even though we were on the "14th" floor, you could still hear quite a lot of street noise, including sirens. However, it quieted down by the time we went to bed. Plus, the bed was so comfortable that we slept very soundly. The bedding is luxuriously soft and comfortable, and I really appreciate that the sheets and bedding did not smell of bleach or strong detergent. All in all, we had a wonderful experience here. We actually tried to extend our stay, but they were all booked up! Too bad. I cannot WAIT to go back!!! And don't forget to tip the staff! If you're staying in such a nice hotel, you can surely afford to tip well. Don't forget to tip your maid, valet, and bellhop GENEROUSLY. Especially the cleaning staff--cleaning rooms is such hard work, they deserve BIG tips!

Reviews.Title: “Rocky start”
Reviews.Author: mallmaj
Reviews.Content: We checked into Hotel Palomar Friday the 13th, and the reception personel were very friendlly and helpful. Had a few issues with check in. Our first room only accomodated two people and we had three so they held our luggage while a different room was being cleaned for us. After checking into our second room the airconditioning did not work. They kept sending workers up to fix it, however after the first hour, I asked my husband to please get us yet another room. Staff was wonderful in finding us a room and gave us complimentary drink tickets for our trouble. Only trouble is, we are not drinkers. Overall the stay is nice, lets see how our second night is! Oh and the baggage guys were the most helpful of everyone!

Reviews.Title: “WOW !!!”
Reviews.Author: deb181720
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews from Trip Advisor and decided to book a stay. We were very pleased with our experience. The staff was friendly and very helpful when asked about the sites and sounds of Chicago. The door man Darren aka D, went out of his way to be helpful, far beyond are expectations, a true ambassador for Chicago. Not used to the city noises, we found the traffic, emergency services sirens disturbing to our sleep, but other than that. Excellent!!! Thank you to the entire staff!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: okfyne
Reviews.Content: I also booked our stay based on the previous reviews and I am so glad I did! All of the positive reviews are correct. This is an amazing hotel! No sense repeating some of the details other people have written about, i.e. wine reception, coffee/tea and other beverages, location, ALL GREAT! When making our reservation, I was not able to book our last night as there was no availability. I emailed the hotel to ask if we could be put on a wait list. Nabil, the manager, quickly responded and promised to check into the availability for us. Although a music festival was happening during the upcoming weekend, he arranged for us to stay at his hotel for our entire stay! Perfect, as who wants to pack up and move to another hotel for one night. Nabil was awesome in making our trip perfect and so memorable. There were some personal reasons for us needing to getaway, and one night Nabil had champagne delivered to our room! How thoughtful is that? At other hotels you are a number and they don't care what might be going on in your life. We arrived early last Sunday and were immediately greeted by â€œDâ€� (Darren). What a wonderful guy! He is so friendly and aims to please. Every morning when we left the hotel D would ask where we were headed, gave directions and suggestions on where we could eat that day. Not only â€œDâ€�, but Mateo, Mark, Cullen and all the staff are WONDERFUL!!! So helpful, friendly and they all make you feel so welcome. You can tell each of them love their jobs. We arrived at 10:00 a.m. so understandably our room wasn't going to be ready for awhile. They stored our luggage and we had brunch at the Sable. Our meals were delicious and they gave us so much food, we could not eat it all. Prices were reasonable too. Nabil told us that Transformers 3 was filming just down the street so we headed down to Wacker Drive and it was so cool to watch the action! When our room was ready Cullen brought up our luggage and showed us around the room. We asked if we could get a mini fridge and, without exaggeration, within 5 minutes we had a mini fridge in our room - at no charge. Cullen again came to our rescue during our last night. While dining at a nearby restaurant red wine was spilled onto my husband. We headed back to the hotel to change and Cullen met us at the door. We told him our story. We went up to our room to change and less than 5 min. later, there was a knock at our door and Cullen had arranged for club soda to be delivered to our room. I am so sorry I forgot the gentleman's name who brought up the club soda, but he felt so bad when he heard what happened that he even offered to bring a bottle of wine to our room - not kidding! We needed more club soda and more was delivered immediately. The rooftop patio was very nice and the pool looked nice also, although we never went in it. Never went to the hotel bar at night, but if other reviews loved it then believe it! Some people complained about the elevators, but we stayed there for 5 nights and never had any issues with a long wait or crowded elevator. Our king room with the Figi tub was awesome! The tub was so relaxing after a day of walking and not irritating like other Jacuzzi tubs. The shower was huge. Some other reviewers complained about the sliding bathroom door not completely closing, but it wasn't a problem with us being a couple. We understand the hotel is in the process of repairing this issue. The turn down service was a very nice touch. We were on the 15th floor and heard some sirens during the day, but they did not keep us up at night. Very quiet hotel, didn't hear any other room doors closing, etc. The housekeeping service was excellent. The hairdryer and iron were great quality and it was a nice touch that the hotel supplied cotton balls and qtips. Also, there was a list of other items you could get for free or for purchase, at a minimal cost, if you forgot something. We also liked the tiger and zebra robes! A prior review complained about the number of tv channels, but there were lots for us. All the major networks, speciality channels (ie Discovery) plus plenty of high definition channels. To be honest, you don't go to Chicago to watch tv, but after a full day out touring there is enough on tv to just chill if you want to. This is the best hotel we have stayed in. Would highly recommend it to anyone, and hope to return next year! Bravo to Nabil and all his staff!!! Thank you for making our stay so enjoyable. They truly make customer service their number 1 priority.

Reviews.Title: “Never written a review, but I was compelled.”
Reviews.Author: trav8169
Reviews.Content: My wife an I stayed 3 nights. Great location except the occasional fire engine (firehouse a few blocks away) but I think regardless of were you are in the city you are going to here them quite frequently and I mean frequently, but not that big of a deal. Second, yes the bathroom door is a little, interesting lets say. An obvious failure at an attempt to be a little too out of the box. Great concept in style just poorly executed. But a supposed fix in the works, or at least I hope there is, b/c other than that this hotel is top-notch class, fun, and very convenient to anything in Chicago you could want. Besides there is a beautful bathroom in the lobby if this door thing really bothers you. This hotel is truly worth a try and so is the fabulous restaurant/bar downstairs (Sable). Great apps. and a very fun yet educational drink stop. Plenty of popular bars great restaurants and even infamous restaurants within a pleasant walk Portillos, Gino's East Pizza, Rock and roll Mc Donalds (24hrs) Joes Seafood and Steaks (visited all of them and all worth going to at least once during your stay) there are also many more that looked like very good candidates. Rush St and Michigan Ave within 3 minute walk. The "L" stops out front of the lobby. Cant ask for a better location and service and price.

Reviews.Title: “fantastico”
Reviews.Author: HotelVillaDucale
Reviews.Content: I was at this albergocon the miafamiglia for 6 days. It 'a boutique hotel, very nice furnishings. In the air there is always a smell of clean, well inside the elevator. the rooms are comfortable, to see all that damage in strada.Ho found the ironing board and iron and 'a servizzi free, I' found it very comfortable, even the internet system is' free. The rooms are very clean and good restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Cool place, lots of perks”
Reviews.Author: bob7
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the Palomar. The hotel has some nice perks â€¦ daily free wine party in the lobby (living room) from 5-6, they served Yellow Tail and Sangria the days we were there, also free snacks on weekdays, but just the wine on weekends, no snacks then. Seating fills up pretty fast after 5, but lots of standing room. Also a rooftop patio just off the pool room with great city views, nice place to tan and have drinks. Take your own or order them. This is a funky hotel, hot music even in the elevator, the bar is hopping every night, cool doormen, off-beat dÃ©cor, great staff, way cooler than the regular old hotels. They are across the street from the stop where the free trolley goes to the Navy Pier, and they are half a block from the red subway line. The blue subway line comes into town from Oâ€™Hare, free transfer to the northbound red line at Jackson, get off at the Grand station for the Palomar. Takes an hour, saves a ton of cab fare, and costs $2.25pp, exact bills/change at the ticket machines. Get on the subway at Terminal 1. Great location, 10-15 minute walk to the riverwalk along Wacker, or the nonstop action along the Magnificent Mile (No. Michigan Ave). Millennium park is about a 20 minute walk. Two blocks from the famous Brazzaz, a Brazilian steakhouse where carvers rotate around the tables with over a dozen styles of grilled meat, filets, ribs, tenderloin, shrimp, sirloin, lamb leg or chops etc on swords, and they carve you off what you want as often as you want, also nice salad bar. There is a Big Bowl 2 blocks away, and tons of pizza joints and other fast food. The high end shopping is on the Mag Mile. Discount shopping at a Target near the Monroe stop on the red line south. The concierge has free tickets to comedy shows, and he will book it for you. But the show will turn down his request if they are selling well, it works best on off-nights. Bob7@canoemail.com

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Debra06
Reviews.Content: Got a good deal staying her for 4 nights. It was priced the same as the Courtyard and such so I thought I'd trying something new. What a nice stay!! Staff: Overly helpful staff, doorman addressed me by name, front desk couldn't do enough to help. They even have pre-printed directions to get you to all the popular Chicago sites. Amenities: Lots of little extras in the room like cotton balls, q-tips, special charging station for your electronics, umbrella, robes,etc... and a whole list of out of the ordinary free things you can request such as curling irons and heating pads. Bed/ Room: Really nice sheets, good, large mattress. Quiet room. VERY VERY quiet at night. Very modern. The room reminded me of the new look that the Courtyards are putting in all their renovated locations. Lobby/ lounge: Small but sufficient. Coffee/tea in the morning, tea/ lemonaid in the afternoon, and wine/ sangria (and sometimes hors d'oeuvres) in the evenings. All are complimentary. Morning and afternoon drinks are served with nice extras such as honey, vanilla flavoring, and wide variety of milks and sugars. Location: Right next to the red line which will take you with in a 10-15 min walk or bus ride of the museums (Field, Art Institute, Planetarium, Aquarium), Millennium park, and the Sears tower. Right next to Nordstroms...you can walk through Nordstroms and the accompanying mall and end up on Michigan Ave. Fantastic location! Also close to Benny's Chop House which was really good. FYI: Dogs are allowed, but you can request a pet-free room. They should advertise this more, as I almost didn't book because I'm allergic to dogs. FYI: Yes, the sliding bathroom door does have a 2-3 inch gap close to the entrance to the room and it might be uncomfortable for some. Yes, you can easily peer into the bathroom as you enter the room when the bathroom door is closed, but who's looking. Room Service: Room service was a little aggressive. The woman emptied my shopping bag from Walgreen's and thew out my receipt and the opened packaging for the products I purchased. She left the products on the dresser. Sweet of her, except I was planning to return the merchandise. She was able to reproduce my stuff from the garbage...sigh...oh well. Needless to say, our room was sparkling every day. (The hotel is very environmentally conscious so if you want fresh soaps everyday, you need to hide the old ones or notify housekeeping because we never got a new bar of soap our whole stay.) Customer feedback is welcomed: I noticed in other reviews that people didn't like using the bedroom slipper-socks, because it somehow seemed less sanitary than using a hotel towel. I see that the hotel now puts a fresh, tagged pair in each room and charges you for the socks if you open the packaging. I thought this was a nice way of listening to customer feeback and coming up with a solution. Overall...great hotel....would love to stay again. What a pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: New_Travel83
Reviews.Content: We read ALL the reviews on here before we booked our trip to Chicago... WE went with this STRICTLY based off the reviews..... Boyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy, am I glad we did! From the moment we got there to the minute we left, it was AMAZING! We got there on a Monday, pulled right up, they took everything out and took everything up to the room and parked our car... We went up to the room and there was a NICE bottle of champagne with ice and a card for our anniversary... The BAR is a GREAT atmosphere.. The 3 amigo's that work there are just GREAT! They really know how to make someone fit right in... The 1 bartender gave us a lesson on Tequila, the other made me try something other than Miller Light (lol ) and the other one made my wife a martini with FRESH mint!! Simply amazing and SUCH CLASS!!! Thanks again guys! The entire staff was just great. We have never been there before and they told us right where to go, to the T! We had so much fun and felt safe the entire time... What a good feeling! The rooms are as good as it can possibly get and the bathrooms are just SICK! Awesome shower and GREAT tub..... We will be back..... If there was 1 negative, it would've been that they didnt allow us to upgrade or mention anything to us on that, I filled something out online about a deal on upgrading if there were rooms available, I thought 4 sure it would've been offered with it being our 1st time and our anniversary. The person at the counter did say there were suites available.... Again, after I got in my room, I did NOT care.. Im not a picky type of person, they treated me great and that is why I am giving this place 5 stars.....ALL CLASS! OH, and the location....... PERFECT! Within a 5 minute walk to ANYTHING! Thanks again for making this 3 day getaway so special....

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dakotasky24
Reviews.Content: Traveling to Chicago on business for a 4 night stay. Upon my arrival, I discovered that my reservations had mistakenly been canceled completely rather than modified by the reservations agent. I was then advised that the hotel was completey booked for the next two nights as well as most of the surrounding hotels. Needless to say, I was livid! I came in contact with the AM, Amanda, who was very apologetic and responded quickly by making arrangements for me to stay at their sister hotel. I also received assurance from the GM, Nabil Mouabyed, that I would be able to return to the hotel in two days, at which time the hotel and staff would compensate for the inconvenience. When I returned, the hotel did more than compensate for the inconvenience, they made my first trip to Chicago even better with the upgraded amenities, outstanding services and friendly staff. Though it was to no fault of their own, the hotel's management team defininately made sure I left a satisfied customer. Thanks to the management team for your great customer service! The hotel is perfectly located, near great restaurants and shopping is in walking distance. There is also a grocery store one block down and a 7-eleven. It is directly on the trolley line, which is free. The bellmen are very personable and friendly, especially Darren and Bleu. The restaurant has a great breakfast selection and the staff were very friendly as well. Though my trip started off rocky, I definately left with a smile. And I am looking forward to returning to the Palomar for my annual business trip!

Reviews.Title: “Palomar Chicago - hotel delight”
Reviews.Author: CindySanti10
Reviews.Content: This week, I've been enjoying my first Chicago break ensconced in the Palomar, a Kimpton Hotel. Led here by reviews at TripAdvisor, and having stayed in Kimpton properties before, I felt Palomar would be a solid choice and meet my design expectations. I'm happy to report, I was right on both counts. Who can resist a hotel with leopard and zebra bathrobes? The hotel is in a great location, two blocks from Michigan Avenue. Being so new, several taxi drivers were unfamiliar with it, so be sure to keep the address on hand when you visit. The lobby is small but inviting. The reception area features a lovely tufted leather counter with lighted resin countertop, both in a warm gold, very fun and touchable. Gold and black marble floors add drama, along with white patent leather chairs. The color scheme carries into the wine reception room where the over-scale mod floral carpeting keeps the tone whimsical. I really enjoy the mix of materials in the public areas of the hotel. At check-in, which was handled quickly and smoothly, the Kimpton word-of-the-month resulted in a lovely bottle of wine at no charge. The front desk staff also gifted my son with a bag of toys (the beach ball was a huge hit). Membership in the Kimpton InTouch Club also lands you free wi-fi and a $10 voucher for the minibar. We booked into 1127, described as a "luxury one bedroom suite". At 750 square feet, it is certainly a lot of real estate for the price. The living room features seating for six, along with a desk area and plenty of accessible outlets. The bathroom is enormous, with a jetted tub that can easily accommodate four people, if you were so inclined (those same four people could also shower at once)! The king bedroom boasts Frette linens and an assortment of pillows. Palomar gets 5 stars for thinking of everything. Every amenity is available, from a magnifying makeup mirror to toiletries you might have forgotten. The trademark Kimpton bathrobes make me smile! Hmmm, so why am I not singing the praises of the dÃ©cor? Well, as I've said before, I think hotel designers have an opportunity to take chances with dÃ©cor, to really create an interesting and original atmosphere. Don't get me wrong, my suite is very nice and quite pretty. But as Elle DÃ©cor's Margaret Russell has said: "pretty rooms are rarely memorable". The most exciting aspect of the room is actually the carpeting! The mod floral, downsized from the lobby, is rhythmic and unexpected in the guest room. Subdued in beige and chocolate brown, it leads the color scheme throughout the suite. The textured wallpaper is beige, the furniture mixed dark brown and pale, both with a limed look. The sofa and chairs are light blue and fairly generic. Perfectly nice, but it doesn't have a luxury vibe. The furniture looks like it could live in any average hotel. The bathroom is neutral and very well appointed. I love that the quartz countertop is extra high, and the 12x24 inch marble tiles suit the spacious serenity. Toiletries are L'Occitane - yummy. Overall, I'm a fan of the Palomar, and would definitely recommend to others and stay here again myself. And the restaurant Sable - that story is still playing out - stay tuned for an update. My pictures are posted at: http://exuberanthome.com/palomar-chicago

Reviews.Title: “worth it's number one rating Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Munster21
Reviews.Content: An absolutely fab hotel in a great location. Definately merits its number one rating on trip advisor. We had a big double room with plenty of space, really clean. Great service. Only minor quibble was that you have to pay for internet access in the business lounge although I believe the wireless is free.

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly, great location!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoAW
Reviews.Content: This is was a great hotel to take my 8 year old son to. The room was beautiful and quite spacious. The location was great - walking distance to everything and right by the red line train. The pool was perfect but could use some pool toys as the other Hotel Palomars usually have this. The evening cocktail hour was very nice but needed some soda or something more than lemonade for the kids. The coffee in the morning was great but I ended up with lots of coffee grounds in my coffee everyday for some reason. There are tons of restaurants and there is a grocery store 1 block away to buy supplies. The staff was friendly and very helpful. They helped us find where Transformers was being filmed which was a thrill for my son! The cookies and milk at night was appreciated by him as well. This is the second Hotel Palomar we've been to and it was another wonderful experience. I highly recommend for a family with kids as my son loves these hotels as well! Note: there is a parking lot across the street from the hotel that you enter on Illinois, just west of State that appears to be the most reasonable deal at $25/day with in/out privileges.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: shponya
Reviews.Content: It was the best stay in Chicago ever! Stayed for 2 nights while in Chicago for a special event. Booked far in avance with AAA rate of $134/night. The most beautiful hotel right in the center of everything: 2 min from Magnificent Mile, subway Red Line right by the Hotel entrance. Gorgeous accommodations ( we stayed in King room) very well appointed room with awesome bed, pillows, work desk, bath robes (zebra and leopard). Coffee, tea, lemonade, ice tea and ice water in the lobby. And an exceptional service on the top of everything else. Well Done!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: MamaMona01
Reviews.Content: We used the Budget Travel magazine's 'Real Deal' for a 3 night weekend; and found Hotel Palomar top notch! Service was prompt, very personable staff. Room was extremely clean and comfortable; King Bed and Fugi Soaking Tub (hot tub for two in the room) topped the scale! I signed up for the Kimpton Loyalty Rewards (member) for free wi-fi and $10 out of the mini bar. Our package included wine from the lounge; a fabulous Zin! Happy Hour (free beverages) at 5pm everyday was a nice way to relax with wine and friends. The location was superb, and the valet parking was included in our package (and only took 5-10min. to get my car each time I left). We loved the open air rooftop terrace; located just off the indoor pool. Used it several times. Liked Most: Corner room with so many windows/open spaces! Liked Least: Rooftop terrace closed one night for a 'private' party.

Reviews.Title: “Best.Hotel.Ever.”
Reviews.Author: AandJ_Travelers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the lovely Palomar twice in one week (w/ Milwaukee inbetween; we were on a baseball trip). All we can convey is that we were in love with whole lot of the Palomar from the moment we arrived (happy face) 'til the moment we left (sad face). The customer service and hospitality was simply outstanding...everyone we encountered associated with the Palomar (sans one who just didn't give us that "warm fuzzy" feeling, and nickled & dimed us for her sheer pleasure..but I won't go into that ;-) was friendly, genuine, professional, fun, and so incredibly helpful, welcoming and sweet. Our room was very comfy and clean (housekeeping is phenomenal--quick, efficient, and eager to please)...we adored our bed, and whatever about the whole bathroom door thing; it seemed so trivial to focus on that when everything else was so top- notch. We used the pool a lot and didn't care that it was smaller; it was just perfect for a dip after a hot summer day exploring Chicago. I used the workout room daily and it was so clean (someone was cleaning it each time I was there), with great views of Chicago. Yes, the wine hour was busy, but oh well...I loved it! Nice and social and a great time to visit with others if you wished (or go to the lovely roof top as someone stated earlier). We'd like to reference some standouts at the Palomar: -Darren "D"...so kind & friendly; he always made sure we had water, even after my run along Lakeshore. -Bleu...easy to talk to, HY-sterical, and just happy to be there. -James R....Probably the sweetest, nicest man we've met. Ever. He was just always smiling, remembering our names, and consistently in a fantastic mood. -Mateo...A night auditor. Now this guy was funny, kind, and made you feel like you mattered even though it may have been late after an 11 p.m. dinner -Charles in Concierge will give you the BEST restaurant suggestions. -Gad went out of his way to send a fax for me and always say "hello". -Larry & Lisa...our fellow MSU alum and fans were so friendly at wine hour (and even answering my questions on email before we arrived). They made us feel like we were two of just a few guests at the hotel. -Last but not least, good ol' Jason D. at the front desk...you just knew that he wanted to make certain you were having a grand time, but he wasn't overbearing about it. Extremely genuine, kind, and professional. We enjoyed talking to him daily. As you can see, we were (are) smitten with the Palomar, and we can't wait to stay again...we'd go to Chicago and stay again just to visit with our fave people there and experience another great vacay! Thanks for making our annual summer trip this year so happily memorable & amazingly enjoyable!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay....wish I could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: gapper
Reviews.Content: we only had one night in Chicago, and regret not being able to stay longer because the hotel was awesome. The valet guys were extremely helpful and were right there when we pulled up. the cost is $46, but you are in the city. I had gotten an email a few months back before their opening and was able to get the room for $89! What a deal for this hotel, it was definitely worth a lot more. Upon check in, we also received a "raid the minibar" coupon for two items up o $10. It was beautifully decorated with flat screen tv. We did not get to enjoy the wine reception at night, but did go down for coffee and tea the next morning in the beautifully decorated lounge area. There was a nice pool on the top floor and also a rooftop bar which was very nice. We did not eat at the restaurant Sable, but it looked very nice. We had dinner across the street at Rock Bottom Brewery and I would highly recommend it. The red line was right next to the hotel and we were at the White Sox game in 15 minutes. There were shops and restaurants in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: PhoebeSpur
Reviews.Content: The staff was incredible! We stayed at the Palomar for our honeymoon, and we got upgraded to a beautiful suite. When we arrived the staff was really friendly and helpful (Charles) and after we got settled into our room, they sent us champagne and strawberrys and a hand written card congratulating us on our wedding. Very nice interior in the rooms, nice kept and comfortable beds. One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in :)

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to its ranking”
Reviews.Author: mr8tch
Reviews.Content: Within a week I stayed at the Swissotel and at the Palomar, two days each. I admit to the praise that most heap upon this new modern marvel. The king room I had is large and the bathroom is at least twice the size of any hotel I have ever been in. Yes, that "gap" exists on the bathroom door, but one would have to go out of one's way to "peek", and if you are accustomed to spending time with a partner, then it's a marginal design error. What was so nice was the that the shower was large and the tub was jacuzzi. What a treat. Any other hotel in downtown offer that amenity for no extra charge? The service is amazing. Doors are opened, bell/desk staff are insistently kind, but not overbearing. My shuttle to the airport happened to be late as I departed and the bellman courteously went back to the desk to have them call to see why. And how about coffee in the morning, tea in the afternoon and wine at 5, not to mention water at front door (and puppy treats if you happen to bring your dog along) and your choice of a morning newspaper, delivered? After having been nickled and dimed at the Swisshotel, these favors were very much appreciated. Location is prime. Restaurants dot State and Hubbard and it is just three short blocks from the Magnificent Mile. The walk to the Art Institute was bracing, about 30 minutes, but taking in all the activity on Michigan Avenue made it seem shorter. With sight-seeing stops between the Hancock Building and the Art Institute, I never had the need to use a cab. I think that the Palomar's attention to detail is what makes it stand out. It does not have the view that other hotels might offer, but for the money (about 225 a night), it is a bargain as it compares with other upscale venues. Internet comes with the room, as does fitness center/pool privileges. Cable does not have a wide variety of choice, but at least all local channels are available, some in HD. Oh, yes, ice on every floor. If there is one drawback, it would be the elevators. There are only two, and at busy times, stops are frequent. But this is a minor annoyance.
