I experienced the same frustration at the Swissotel. There is a reason this place is numero uno. Service, cleanliness, and attention to detail. I felt my comfort was the most important goal of the staff, not seeking ways to soak me for extra charges. My stay was relaxing. I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for this price class”
Reviews.Author: StatenIsland_NYPsac
Reviews.Content: Just to level-set everyone's expectations, there are better hotels in Chicago if you're willing to pay more. But within this hotel class and price class, I've been really happy with the Palomar. I have to travel to Chicago about once a month on average, and I can book myself within certain price parameters, and lately I've found myself chosing the Palomar over others that I would consider "better" hotels (The Wit is one for just slightly more). It's hard to say why, I guess that is a good testament to the hotel. The hotel restaurant (Sable) was good the one time I tried, and the hotel is 4 blocks walking distance from Sunda, which has become my favorite restaurant in all of Chicago. I'll be back at the Palomar next week.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, but #1?”
Reviews.Author: marily21
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel with a friend and chose it from the Tripadvisor ratings. Walked from Union Station to hotel, about 1.4 miles, warm day but pleasant walk with light bags. Check-in was fine, not many people waiting. We had a room on the 15th floor-not large, not small, very nice. The sliding bathroom door was okay, but my friend did not like the lack of privacy (it doesn't close tightly, there is a gap). The hotel is newer, everything looked new. But we didn't think anything about the hotel was extraordinary. The rooftop deck was small, but wonderful on a sunny day-and at night, there was a full moon, and it was gorgeous. We didn't use the pool or fitness center; the pool was small, but was beautiful, and the fitness center was well equipped. It was relatively easy to walk to attractions from the hotel, we went to the free Monday night concert at Millenium park, shopped, and went to Navy Pier. Lots of good restaurants within walking distance. When making the reservations, no one seemed willing to negotiate a better rate, but the rate was comparablen to most in the area. All in all, we'd probably stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a few quirks. Easy to overlook. Superior service.”
Reviews.Author: juniorgirl9
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Hotel Palomar for a family members wedding. State St. is having work done, so the hotel wasn't the easiest to get to. The hotel lobby is very modern and stylish. It is a little cramped if you have a lot of luggage. The rooms and furnishings are absolutely beautiful. The bathroom door was designed differently, so there was no privacy at all. (Gap) The rooms have their own recycle bin, which I liked. The pool is on the small side, and everytime I wanted to swim, it was full of children. Which is fine, but it would have been nice to have adult only hours so I could have gotten some swimming in. The service is absolutely top notch. I wish I could remember the door persons name. He was super friendly. He made our experience very fun. If you are staying within the next few weeks, Transformers 3 is filming a few blocks away. That was entertaining to watch. The reception for the wedding was held at this hotel. Most beautiful reception I've ever been to. Once again, the service was absolutely top notch. The only bad thing is that there is a fire station a half a block away, if you hate noise while you sleep, get some earplugs. One of the best stays I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: annekr
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights having secured a great Kimpton Intouch opening offer of $89 per night. Reserved a 2 bed room as traveling with grown up daughter but on check in was told 2 beds not available - bummer. But to make good we were upgraded to a suite on the 16th floor with a huge lounge and separate bedroom. Bathroom also huge with walk in shower and jacuzzi bath. Kimpton Intouch gift of $10 off minibar item very welcome - hic. Rooftop outside area and indoor pool a big bonus for this hotel and one which would attract me back. Food is available there but at room service rates which is expensive. Wine reception was busy but again something I love about Kimptons. We didn't eat in the restaurant but did have a drink at the bar which was buzzing. Hotel is in a brilliant location - walked to beach in one direction and Willis Tower in the other. Loads of bars and restaurants close by - really liked the Purple Pig for lunch. Finally - the staff - very welcoming and helpful. Can't fault the Palomar - hope to return sometime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago's”
Reviews.Author: maestrajennie
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic stay at Hotel Palomar in Chicago. Everyone there provided exceptional service. Used the secret word, "fireworks" for July and we were upgraded to a king suite. It was amazing. I also mentioned that it was our anniversary and when we returned back from dinner there was champagne and some strawberries with chocolate waiting for us. As a Kimpton member we received free internet & "raid the mini bar" - got $10 worth of items.Excellen location, just 2 blocks from the Mag Mile." Thanks again for making this a wonderful stay. The only problem: we had to leave:) See More

Reviews.Title: “Great location+spacious room =happy traveler”
Reviews.Author: leos_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend in July. Walked everywhere, enjoyed the comfy bed and quiet hallways.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel - excellent condition and knowledgable helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Torrie6
Reviews.Content: There is something about a new hotel - the team are aiming to please and certainly have in this case - the staff are helpful/knowledgable. The quality of the hotel is also tops, well equiped gym (better than most hotels) and location is excellent - very close to the magnificant mile - magnificant shopping strip. Being a Kimpton hotel they also do the nice evening drinks so guests can meet other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: delawaretraveler42
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel through some frequent flier miles I had sitting around and was extremely happy to find it was worth all those miles! I did research on this hotel prior to booking to ensure I would be using my miles wisely, and saw a few mixed reviews since the hotel was new. I am happy to have taken the chance on this hotel, our stay was excellent. The location is great if you are interested in walking within downtown Chicago and is close to any city transit you could need. From the top of the hotel you could see many of the well known Chicago landmarks. The front desk was extremely pleasant and helpful to our every need. The rooms were decorated in a beautifully modern way. The gym was small but did have a nice array of cardio machines with an excellent view of the city (if you opted not to watch the individual tvs provided). Generally we stay with family when visiting Chicago, but if a situation arises again where we need a hotel, I would not hesitate to book a room here again!

Reviews.Title: “perfect, perfect, perfect”
Reviews.Author: _Canadiangypsy1
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect hotel in every way from the arrival to check out. Beautiful surroundings, courteous, helpful staff and a lovely accommodation. Would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Best service EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tije99
Reviews.Content: From the moment my friend and I arrived at the hotel, we were greeted with smiles and wonderful attitudes, The doorman "D" was awesome along with the rest of the staff. They were all extremely helpful. They even pointed us in the right direction for events, restaurants and everything else in between, as it was our first time in the city. The hotel was very clean and the room was nice, stylish and very comfortable. I definitely would recommend this hotel for several reasons, the staff, the decor, and the location are just a few.

Reviews.Title: “terrific service and gorgeous facility”
Reviews.Author: ahickling
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palomar with my young daughter for three nights June 17-20, 2010 and absolutely loved the hotel. The room was one of the nicest I've ever stayed in (My daughter loved the Fuji jetted tub so much that she wanted to take 2 baths a day!) in terms of decor, design, and size. (It compared favorably to much more expensive hotels I've visited in other cities). We very much enjoyed other amenities of the hotel. The fitness center was very attractive and well-equipped. I loved the roof-top terrace. I also enjoyed the hosted wine reception and the hotel bar and restaurant (loved the artisanal cocktails). We were disappointed that the pool was closed (I would have appreciated knowing that in advance. It may seem odd, but the fact that the Palomar had a pool was an important factor in my selecting this hotel--when traveling with a young child, a pool can be a real life-saver! (Burn lots of energy while taking a break from touring.) I did notice a couple of minor blips with housekeeping (rug on bathroom floor disappeared on first morning never to be replaced; shampoo and conditioner never got replaced even though completely used up), as well. We also experienced a lengthy Direct TV outage due to a major storm. However, I cannot overstate how clean and overall well-kept I found the hotel to be. It is also a great location for visiting the Miracle Mile. The best part of my stay was the exceptional customer service. I don't usually note service at hotels, but in this case it really made an impression on me. Staff universally showed self-initiative, excellent responsiveness, and were very pro-active in addressing needs and questions. The concierge offered terrific assistance in arranging a swimming outing at another hotel that really impressed my daughter. I was also struck by how the front desk staff remembered previous conversations with me, and the bell staff were extremely resourceful, enthusiastic, and friendly. I am guessing that Kimpton has a philosophy of all employees using independent judgment and initiative. The results are awesome! I am looking forward to another visit to the hotel. In fact, I have purposely extended an upcoming business trip to the Chicago area just so that I have another opportunity to visit and enjoy the Palomar once again. I expect to enjoy this next visit even more than the first.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Hotel with Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: UrbanWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palomar with my boyfriend and his son for the 4th of July weekend and we had a wonderful experience. Most of the hotel staff were well trained and went above and beyond the call of duty to enhance our experience. Specifically, Gad and Ashley at the front desk were an amazing help during our stay. I especially enjoyed the jogging maps provided in the room. Housekeeping was impeccable. Loved the rooftop and common seating areas. Our room on the 5th floor was a little noisy due to the street traffic so I would advise requesting a room on a higher floor. The restaurant was nice with some unique items on the menu, but service could use some work. The bathroom door does cause a minor privacy issue, but it is not enough of a reason to avoid this gem. Having stayed at the Trump in Chicago, I can say for sure that this hotel is an incredible value. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Palomar Chicago exceeds all expectations”
Reviews.Author: Ron97
Reviews.Content: We decided to spend a few days in Chicago for our 25th wedding anniversary. Noticing that Kimpton was opening up a new Palomar in the River North neighborhood, a great location, I decided to check it out, since I had thoroughly enjoyed my previous stays at the San Francisco Palomar. When I called to confirm my booking the day before we were to arrive, I spoke to Amanda at the front desk and I mentioned to her that we were celebrating our 25th anniversary, and said we would appreciate any little special touch they could add to make our stay more enjoyable. Amanda assured me that we would not be disappointed. When we arrived, we were informed that we had been upgraded to a luxury suite. Wow! A lovely three-room suite, tastefully decorated, with the most comfortable bed I think I've ever slept in, and with a beautiful bathroom containing a huge glass-enclosed shower and a soaking tub designed to comfortably accommodate two. Staff was professional and accommodating at every turn, from the bellmen to the front desk, to the staff at the hip Sable Kitchen and Bar. Everything and everyone exceeded my expectations in every way. Thank you, Amanda and Hotel Palomar staff! You can be assured that I will continue to make the Palomar brand and Kimpton hotels in general my first option when traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: colindep
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights with my girlfriend over the July 4th weekend. The hotel exceeded my expectations and I would definitely stay there again. Pros: -The rooms were well appointed and very comfortable (the beds are extremely comfortable). -Service was excellent from valet to front desk -Sundeck had a great view and amenities looked nice although we didn't use them -Compared to other hotels the prices for extras such as the mini bar and parking seemed reasonable Cons: -I didn't like the sliding door in the washroom, not as private as I would have liked -Restaurant was overpriced for the quality of food and service (Don't bother with breakfast)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Four Night Stay at the Palomar!”
Reviews.Author: SusanM2004
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights at the Palomar at the end of June and were really pleased with the hotel, staff and location. Our King Deluxe City View room was a good size, very clean, well equipped and nicely furnished, very comfy bed, good bathroom amenities with nice thick towels, as well as robes. The wine reception (5-6 p.m.) was nicely done, and a great place to enjoy a quick or leisurely drink in their large sitting room (interesting books & a very nice fireplace in there as well.) The pool, exercise room and outdoor patio on the 17th floor are also great. (We took our wine up to the patio to enjoy the views and comfy lounge chairs there one evening.) Coffee/tea in the lobby, and bottled water at the door in the morning were appreciated. Staff were very friendly and helpful. We were there over a w/e and although the hotel was busy, we never had to wait more than a minute or two for elevators. We saw a few dogs but there are only a couple of floors designated for clients with pets, so it's not a concern for travelers without pets....it was actually fun to see a few pets during our stay there. In-touch members receive free internet, which saves about $12/day. The location is excellent ... within walking distance to the river, Michigan Ave, the Loop, Millennium Park, and also right next to the Red Line station (we made good use of the CTA on the trains and buses with our 3 day passes.) It was easy to take the train from the airport to the hotel and back again. We had an amazing time during this first visit to Chicago, and felt that staying at the Palomar really made the trip special!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome new option in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: AuroraMom
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by the Palomar and it outdid our expectations. They were overbooked when we checked in so instead of our double queen standard room we were upgraded to a king suite with a pullout couch. The young woman in reception could not have been nicer, and wanted to make sure the upgrade was okay. It was perfect with the wild storms we have been unfortunately having this summer, the upgrade was oh so welcome! The room was clean, the bathroom was amazing! Loved the bath products too! Ate breakfast at the restaurant, which they gave us a partial comp for and everything was delicious. Wine reception was very nice and again because of the weather, it was crowded and the staff was always polite Would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back to this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jhartman90019
Reviews.Content: We were excited to learn about the new Kimpton hotel and it did not let us down. The room was great (loved the lighted room numbers), the pool and exercise room were fabulous and the service was top notch. What other hotel offers soy milk with their morning coffee? Of course we always try to schedule our activities around the wine hour! We did order some snacks from Sable, the majority of which were quite tasty (avoid the pretzels as this wasn't worth it.) The hotel is very conveniently located. You can walk to Michigan Ave or grab the subway which is just a block away. The free internet is also appreciated as some other hotels charge $12/day! I can't wait to come back in two years for another conference!

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Unbelievable Service”
Reviews.Author: Four2Ski
Reviews.Content: The best customer service I have ever experienced at any hotel. My husband arranged this trip for my daughter and I to celebrate a birthday and graduation. When told of the event, the front desk manager upgraded our room to a suite, and a giant cupcake was delivered to my daughter on her birthday. The staff who worked the breakfast area got to know us in the few days we were there, and remembered our preferences every day. A special thank you and unlimited praise go to the doorman, Darren. He greeted us by name daily, helped with our bags, and even walked us to the subway as we left. We have never been treated as well at any hotel regardless of price. The hotel is new; the rooms are awesome as are the common areas. Prices are still great as the hotel builds its client base, but you better start making reservations early - with this level of service the hotel is sure to become the most popular in the city. Thanks to all the staff for a wonderful stay (and to my husband for choosing this hotel!) We left the Palomar with one thought - "When can we come back?"

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: HppyTravels
Reviews.Content: The only way I would stay at this hotel again is if 1) I was travelling alone/ with significant other only- will explain below, and 2) if it was a killer deal. You have to appriciate the attempt at fine decor, but this comes along with one huge design flaw. The bathroom door is a barn style sliding door. It is a big over sized door on sliding track that slides over the smaller door opening. What this means is that the door doesn't close, at the doors resting position there are 2 inches of open space on each side of the door. Wouldn't mind this if I was with my partner only, but I was with extended family. You can hear exactly what's going on when someone is in the bathroom. This means every time I had to go I would have to take the elevator up to the gym for a little privacy. Also the pool was closed on our visit and they said they were working to open it, yet we never saw one single worker. Also we had an intense storm while there, which knocked out the cable for a day and a half. You would think a hotel in Chicago would have strong enough cable equipment to master their nasty weather. Lastly it was mission impossible in this place to get washcloths and soap. We called twice to get washcloths and never recieved them and had to find the housekeeping room ourselves. They don't give you more shampoo or conditioner each day and we also had to help ourselves to those. The housekeeping actually had the nerve one day to move the half empty shampoo bottle out of the shower and put it on the counter as if it was new. Ill trained staff and poor design will keep me away from this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Could Use a Good Maintenance Man”
Reviews.Author: threeputt
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Palomar with my family over the Memorial Day weekend. Based on the reviews I read here first I signed up for the Kimpton Hotel membership on line. That allowed us to book our hotel on line and get 2 breakfasts for $1 each. Also, the hotel staff booked our room on a high floor as I'd listed as my preference. The staff at Hotel Palomar was the friendliest and most accommodating group I've ever seen. The only downside with our experience was that many of the mechanical issues listed in earlier reviews have still not been addressed. Our HBO signal kept cutting out and our phone rang busy when we tried to order room service. I spoke to the front desk and they said the call should have automatically forwarded to them. Bottom line: Great service people but they need more repair people.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: JohnFromMpls
Reviews.Content: I stay in hotels around the US every week. Rarely do I have an experience that motivates me to write a review. A lot of mediocrity out there. However, Hotel Palomar was a stand out. Not only is it brand new and elegant, but the service was outstanding. I really felt valued and accommodated. Never before has someone at the front desk printed out my boarding pass! Also the prices were very reasonable. Kudos!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KOE-KTO
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the end of May 2010 - 7th floor. Checked in smoothly prior to the check-in time. Hotel is new and clean. Room was large and nicely decorated. Wireless internet was fast. Very friendly staff. Morning cofee and tea was good. Wine reception at 5 pm was very nice. Lots of guests with dogs. Swiming pool on the 17th floor was fine, without strong smell of chlorine and not crowded. The deck on the 17th floor was prety cool, esp. because it was sunny. They overcharged me for parking - added an extra night - but they canceled the charge promptly. I like Kimpton hotels and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: worshiguchi
Reviews.Content: Sleek modern design, outstanding service, with a pool on the 17th floor. Within walking distance of everything, including Andy's Jazz Club (2 blocks) and the King of Siam (across the street).

Reviews.Title: “Another great Kimpton”
Reviews.Author: freakyholiday
Reviews.Content: I always enjoy staying Kimpton properties. This is another great Kimpton property, but you do need to know a few things before staying here. If you have any issues with noise, think twice about staying here. We started off in a one bedroom suite on the 7th floor and then we had to move in the middle of the night because we couldn't sleep because of the noise. Yes there was street noise, but there was also a mechanical noise emanating from the walls. We called downstairs, they sent up someone from maintenance and he said that the noise was from the water cooling system that the building used and would be something that you would hear throughout the building. We checked out a room on the 12th floor that was a spa king room and we found the mechanical noise to be much less in this room so we moved. Though you could still hear street noise on the 12th floor. Not sure why they didn't put thicker windows on a brand new building. From the bellmen to the front desk, everyone was nice and helpful, except, the concierge. The concierge was nice enough, but we found that people behind the front desk were more helpful in restaurant recommendations and other suggestions. One of the bellmen even gave us our favorite restaurant recommendation. Lastly, we were traveling with our dog, who is used to having lots of grass to use the bathroom on. She is kinda particular and wants dirt or grass, not concrete. There was not even a dirt patch anywhere close to the hotel. For a hotel that caters to dogs, I would think that they would have put in a grassy, even astroturf, area around the hotel for their 4 legged guests. Minor detail though. Overall, ended up being a great stay. Even though we were planning on having the one bedroom suite, the spa king room turned out nice and was a nice large space. If you can handle the noise, then you should have no problems with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: ordandnuntiya
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and stylish hotel. We booked before it opened and got a great "Grand Opening" deal. The rooms were modern, tastefully appointed and impeccably clean (not surprising, considering how new the place is). We had a corner room which was sunny, bright and had north and west views of the city. The bed was super comfy, too. My husband used the gym once and said it had everything you would want, including free bottled water for all guests. The roof deck and pool were not too big, but very nice. The hotel hosted "wine hour" every night in the living room adjacent to the lobby, which were very popular. It got a little crowded in there, but it was nice chance to mingle with other guests, or just people watch, if you prefer. One night of our stay was a little chilly, so the staff lit the gas fireplace - a nice touch. The location was fantastic - close by to many restaurants, subways, buses and attractions. The staff was super friendly and helpful. Overall, we had a great experience and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good option for business or leisure travel to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: MIAnonymous
Reviews.Content: Another nice Kimpton property. The hotel is just north of the river, so it's fairly equidistant between business locations in the Loop and shopping at the far end of Michigan Avenue. Nordstrom is just around the corner and it's a very short walk to Frontera Grill and other great restaurants. Very clean and comfortable guest room with lots of convenient desktop outlets for your laptop, phone, etc. The onsite restaurant had an interesting menu with a lot of variety, but there were some hiccups with the service and there are a lot of other options in the neighborhood. (Keeping in mind that it just opened, I'd gladly try it again in a few months when the kinks are ironed out.) I'll keep this hotel on my short list for business trips to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton has another winner!”
Reviews.Author: Drummerboy66
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Palomar. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful and the location was perfect - two blocks to Mag Mile, but also a short walk to the Navy Pier, The Loop and Millenium Park. The rooms were large, as expected for a brand new building and the restaurant was fabulous. In short, a great experience in Chicago

Reviews.Title: “This one is a keeper!”
Reviews.Author: Anjiggy
Reviews.Content: This River North area hotel is about 2 months old, and is one of the best i have been to. Staff i sooooo friendly, and willing to cater to your every need. Happy hour wine hour every day is a bonus and an unexpected treat. The design is trendy chic. mattresses are so comfy. lighting levels in hotel are on dimmers! bathroom is luxurious, but the bathroom door is a little awkward as it is a sliding panel, but does not close all the way and does not lock. outdoor terrace on the 17th floor and indoor pool. overall, this is such a great hotel! Sable bar & kitchen adjoin this hotel, and is also a new place to dine/drink, and very trendy chic. I will definitely go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sparkling hotel for business or pleasure - very impressive!”
Reviews.Author: sfrench2006
Reviews.Content: I was only in Chicago for one night, packed with dinner meeting and then early morning meetings to fly out the next day, so my experience was short-lived, but I was impressed. First, extremely friendly bellhop greeted my cab with a huge smile and helped me to the front desk with the greatest of courtesy. Next, I was a little dense and couldn't figure out how to get the power on the back side of the room to work and they apologized profusely and had somebody up there in literally 2 minutes. As it turned out, completely my fault. The amenities were great and the quality of the bed and shower were great. Room was designed as chic and modern. I had a 6am wake up call and I had accidentally left the phone off the hook. At 6:02am, thankfully, someone visited my door with a knock to make sure I was awake as they couldn't get to me on the phone. EXCELLENT SERVICE. Totally not expected, but completely appreciated. Given that I am a traveler that tends to have things go wrong in my travels (the cab dropped me at the wrong address and one of my flights got canceled on this same business trip), this hotel makes sure that I have a pleasant stay, no matter what obstacles I might throw at them. Complimentary wine (I missed it) in the evening and tasty organic teas /coffee in the morning. The gym was much better than I had expected with a lot of equipment, clean and well-stocked with eco-friendly water bottles and apples. I joined the Kimpton program for the free internet and I will definitely check out their other hotels in other locations in the future. One of the best business stays I've had in years. I'd definitely stay here for pleasure the next time I come to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great value”
Reviews.Author: PdxJulie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend after a business conference in Chicago. Very new hotel and everything was beautiful. The staff could not have been more friendly or helpful. The fitness center was very well equipped and the pool and roof deck were lovely. Close to lots of great restaurants and shopping. Only negatives are 1) there is a fire station a couple of blocks away and sirens were quite loud and 2) the music in the reception area was so loud it was difficult to hear the staff during check in or when trying to get directions on the way out. Other than that, a lovely stay in a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, excellent!”
Reviews.Author: avourlid
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the brand new Chicago Palomar. Location is very central, twin room was very spacious and spotlessly clean, and staff was very friendly. As per usual with Kimpton hotels, wireless is free for intouch members (registration is free). The hotel bar was more than decent (looked like an after work venue).

Reviews.Title: “The perfect staycation - great price, amazing service, comfortable bed, close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: Fidothefatcat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Palomar with our eight month old daughter for a staycation over Mother's Day weekend. We had the most wonderful time. I found the best rate using the hotel's own website. We found a fantastic deal that included parking and two free cocktails. Rooms. We had a king room that was spacious and very clean. There was plenty of room for the pack-n-play that the hotel supplied. The bed was very comfortable and the linens were very soft. Pool. The pool was a bit chilly, but my daughter did not mind. The lounge chairs were comfy and the pool area was warm. Restaurant/Bar. The free cocktails were out of this world. The restaurant attached to the hotel, Sable, boasts mixologists on staff. Their concoctions were very tasty. My husband brought them up to the room to enjoy while we watched a movie and ordered truffle parmesan popcorn from room service. Sable also had a great brunch menu. Staff. Everyone we encountered at the hotel was very helpful and friendly. I cannot say enough good things about our stay. We hope to stay there again. Location. This is a perfect location. It is just a block away from Michigan Avenue shops. This was great for us because it meant we had the convenience of being able to shop on Michigan Avenue but could avoid the hassle of walking along Michigan Avenue if we wanted. It is also very close to great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “great location and value”
Reviews.Author: eatsunlaugh
Reviews.Content: was a little nervous as the hotel had just opened but we had great service and no delays. I stayed at the Kimpton in Boston a few years back and a good experience. Had an excellent rate, join Kimpton Intouch for added benefits (late check out, 2 free mini bar snack - all reasonably priced anyway, free wifi) - check their website for promotions, often get something better than consolidators ($1 extra for breakfast for example) we were even able to check in considerably early although a little south of the Mile central, great bars and restaurants and transportation nearby, close to Navy Pier - highly recommend the architectural tour, the Loop for a quick sightsee rooftop pool small but great adjoining outdoor seating for a pre dinner cocktail standard room was clean, bathroom very high end, Occitane product did not take part in the wine hour, the morning coffee rush could have used some more to go cups fyi - all Kimptons accept dogs

Reviews.Title: “I loved every part of this hotel, Sevice was outstanding and our room was very nice! Wow:)”
Reviews.Author: angierios
Reviews.Content: Wonderful new hotel that opened in April 2010! We stayed one night in May in the Spa king room and it was a very nice room, It was spacious, beds were comfy,nice decor, and the spa tub was larger than i expected! Staff was friendly and service was great! We hade a great stay at Hotel Palomar and we will definately be going back!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great service”
Reviews.Author: dana828
Reviews.Content: This is the second Kimpton hotel we've stayed at in Chicago (previously staying at the Allegro). The location of the Palomar is perfect-within walking distance of almost everything, and right across the street from a Red Line "L" station. The wine reception each evening is a wonderful touch. The room was much larger than the rooms at the Allegro, and very comfortable. I wish I could take the bed home with me! When we checked in, there was a welcome card and bottle of wine in our room. The card listed a different rate special than we had booked ($20 less per night, and breakfast included at Sable both mornings of our stay). We asked at the front desk the next morning if we could get that rate instead of the one we had booked, and they were able to do so for the second night of our stay. I only wish we had asked about it the first night! But still, it saved us $20 off our second night, plus the $34 breakfast on Sunday morning was free. Excellent breakfast, by the way!! Hopefully the prices don't jump too much once they've been open for awhile, because we loved this hotel and would absolutely stay here again if we can still afford it next time we're in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy New Hotel - Still Kid Friendly”
Reviews.Author: JenCommerceTwp_MI
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Palomar is a great new hotel. We travelled with a another family and between the 2 of us we has 7 and two 5 year olds. Although we originally didn't get rooms near by each other like we had wanted and the hotel was packed, one of the managers, Andy , was able to take care of it the day after check in and accomodate our request. They offered a great jelly bean bar daily for the kids, their own robes, free milk and cookies, a free wine reception, and great cocktails in the bar (free vouchers!). The rates were great! The staff was friendly and the bathrooms were awesome!! The jetted tub is fabulous. Not many hotels in big cities are so family friendly, but we found one that we will come back to again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful Chicago Kimpton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: southshorean
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had stayed at Kimpton's Hotel Monaco (loved it btw) last year, so we thought we'd try out the new Kimpton in town this trip. We loved our stay at Palomar. First, Rachel, at the front desk was very kind and helpful, I give her and A+ for service. On that same note, everyone at the front desk was always kind and very friendly when we stopped by or called down for anything. Our room was fantastic! We had a suite. The soaking tub was wonderful for relaxing after a long day exploring the city. The bed was super comfy. Our only negative comment would be if you are a very light sleeper be a little weary because you are in the middle of downtown chicago and the city can be a bit noisy at night (there is a fire station not too many blocks away). We had no trouble sleeping but it was noisy during the day, so I imagine it could be at night as well. One afternoon we went down to Sable for an appetizer and drinks late one afternoon and were very happy with the food. We had the pork belly flatbread and highly recommend it. Overall we highly recommend Hotel Palomar to anyone who wants a relaxing and enjoyable place to stay. It is near everything downtown and couldn't provide a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch !”
Reviews.Author: BootsandScoots
Reviews.Content: I am a fan of the Kimpton Properties. They are a top notch company. Their staff is experienced, cordial and helpful. Their hotels are meticulously clean and the bedding, unfortunately, makes you want to sleep in on vacation! The hotel is steps to the metro and 1 block to the bus. I would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing New Hotel in Downtown Chicago!!”
Reviews.Author: RandRTraveller
Reviews.Content: What an amazing experience - the Bell Man/Door man "D" was the best there is. All the staff at this new Kimpton hotel were top notch. We loved the wine reception in the evening. Loved the robes and bath products. The hotel is closely situated to the Magnificant Mile and many restaurants. The restaurant was great and quick for breakast. Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family stay”
Reviews.Author: tofarrell
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled with our three elementary-school-aged children for Spring Break. We ended up at the Palomar because of the excellent "grand opening" rates which allowed us to book a suite rather than two separate rooms. Simply put: we had a wonderful stay. From the bellman to the room service waiter, every member of the staff was exceedingly kind, courteous, and worked hard to please. Chic "boutique hotels" can be a bit intimidating for families, especially those with small children, but everyone made us feel like we were the "coolest" of their "cool" guests. The suite room was spotless, hip-ly furnished, and huge. The similarly ample bath with marble shower and jetted soaking tub was fantastic. We ate breakfast at the hotel restaurant, and again, the staff was incredibly friendly and accommodating, especially our waiter. The food was excellent. We ate other meals out, as the hotel is located in the middle of some of the best restaurant territory in Chicago. There were some "grand opening" glitches, that really do not merit mention. The fire extinguishers were still wore their the construction dust covers. Construction dust and dirt bubbled up in the soaking tub (at least I hope it was construction dust!) Room service brought meals without any silverware. There were no pillows or blankets for the kids' pull-out bed. All of these problems were quickly and efficiently remedied with a call to the reception desk. All in all, we will definitely consider returning to the Palomar at our next opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Would love to go back!”
Reviews.Author: JulieBNC
Reviews.Content: We grabbed the introductory rate of $89 for a night here, and felt like we were the smartest people in Chicago. The hotel is in a great location, right next to the Red Line, and an easy walk to Michigan Avenue. The staff was extremely helpful. Printed our boarding passes for us. They are still getting up and running, making sure TVs work, etc. The room was comfortable. One thing to note: the bathroom door is a sliding one, and leaves a small opening just big enough for kids to annoy one another.... Our kids enjoyed the pool, but I imagine it might get crowded quickly once the hotel fills up. Night views from the rooftop terrace were beautiful. Evening wine, morning coffee, daytime jellybeans in the lobby were all nice touches. Do join the Kimpton rewards program before you go for the free wireless and complimentary items from the minibar. We would like to come back again, but it may be out of our price range now....

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing change of pace.”
Reviews.Author: TShip
Reviews.Content: I spent one night in Chicago at the end of a busineess trip, on my one dime. When in DC, I usually stay at either the Hotel Palomar (always great) or the Hotel Medera (Getting very tired), so I thought I'd check out the brand new Hotel Palomar in Chicago. The hotel just opened two week ago and is still in its soft opening. I grabbed a chance to stay for $107! WOW waht a deal! It was worth $250! The lobby is an amazingly confortable and chic place of course. It is not big, but a spot to relax and read coffee table books and enjoy a glass of wine. The Staff was young and full of energy, and committed to my satisfaction. The highlight was the room. BIG and furnished comfortably with attention to details like lighting and queen sized beds. Only a couple of negitives. One, my room looked into another building and ATT service was not available (booster?) and second, the smoking area is outside the front door and you have to walk thru a crowd of smokers to get in the door ( move it! ) . Overall a 10!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: Elena1234
Reviews.Content: This is a brand new hotel downtown Chicago; when we arrived we were met by a very friendly bell man. We nearly fell to the floor when we were told that our parking was going to be $46. The staff inside told us that the other parking facilities would charge the same maybe a couple dollars less; but another guest told us that there were cheaper parking (of course by this time we had given the car to valet). We were able to find parking just down the street for only 34.00 (so shop around). The staff were great and really went out of their way to make the stay pleasurable. The hotel is located just a few blocks off Michigan Avenue; and everything is brand new. I think that the Kimpton Brand hotels are the best out there for their STAFF and the amenities they provide. For example, if you sign up for their membership, you will recieve a welcome beverage (or snack) coupon which I think rocks after travelling. We got our bed turned down, and ice placed into the ice bucket (which is totally wonderful), the maid also noticed that the tv was not working (sound but no video) and she told us that she had already called someone to come and fix it...and no kidding he showed up several minutes later...great service!!! In the morning, the hotel had cold water to go which was complimentary. I really do think that its the little things that matter, and this hotel understands this. That is the exact reason we booked an anniversary party at this hotel. This visit was to ensure everything will run smoothly for the actual event.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cubafreaktoronto
Reviews.Content: This hotel just opened about a week and a half ago. Absolutely amazing experience. Right when we got there, valet service taking care of you. You get cocktails on arrival and the atmosphere was amazing! Most comfortable beds, 42 inch flat screens in bedrooms and also free earphones if you asked!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: dbcnbc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights with our 10 year old son. The nicest people on the staff were the valets and the outside crew. They were so warm and made us feel at home and welcome. The hotel decor is modern and upscale without being pretentious. The rooms were spacious with extras such as cool zebra striped robes. Make sure you sign up to be a Kimpton member which is free. You will get free internet and $10 worth of free goodies to take from the honor bar. With the incredible rate of $95 a night (it was called the sweet deal rate) we received a free continental breakfast for 2 each morning. That was a little disappointing. You get coffee, juice and toast, bagel,croissant, or muffin. The toast was overly dry, the muffins were dry and didn't taste fresh, and, you guessed it, the bagel was on the stale side. Didn't try the croissant. The coffee and juice were good and the restaurant was pretty. Every afternoon, in the lobby, there were huge jars of jelly bellys to help yourself. We did! That was great. Every evening there was a wine reception, which was very nice, they have sodas for the kids. Yes, the pool was small. The hotel was only a few blocks from Michigan Ave. and there are tons of shops, food, grocery stores right there. That's especially nice when you're traveling with kids. We walked to the Oriental Theatre to see "Billy Elliot" (which was fantastic) and it only took us 10 minutes. We walked back after the show, it was after 11pm, and my son was hungry, there is a Subway (food) right next store. We got subs and brought them up to the room. The parking is really expensive, $46 a night. There are some other garages right around the block if you want to save arount $8 a night. The only negative thing that I can say is that when I was making the reservation the woman on the phone wanted to know how old my son was because they like to have something special for the kids when we check in. I thought that was so nice, but it never came to fruition. Oh well, with the Lego store 2 blocks away, he got his share and more! Hope this helped. We go to Chicago every year. We've stayed at a lot of different hotels, and I'm really picky, and I have to say that I liked this one the best for the price range that it is in. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great service, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Romans116
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for the weekend for our 19th anniversary and we couldn't have enjoyed ourselves more. We stayed at the Allegro last year for our 18th and were very pleased, but we will be returning next year to stay at the Palomar for our 20th. The ONLY negative thing I can say is that the construction made it very difficult to get to the hotel, but having said that, it was a minor inconvenience. The first person we encountered was Darren, at the street and he immediately made us feel welcome. Johnathan was the next door man we met and between him and Darren, we found out everything we needed to know about downtown Chicago, riding the subway and where to eat. The rooms are very nice, the view from the terrace is breathtaking at night and the location of the hotel couldn't possibly be better. Everything is within walking distance. I spoke with Andy Yoon on the phone when there were some questions with our reservation and he was extremely helpful and took care of everthing for us. Our experience with the Kimpton hotel chain has caused my wife and I to plan our weekend getaways according to the location of the nearest Kimpton hotel in whatever city we will be visiting. We drove 6 hours to Chicago and after the end of a long drive, I was energized because of the warm reception by the hotel staff. Thanks so much and see you next year!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: guess2
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled to stay at the hotel during its first weekend. Of course the rates were lower--getting something up and running has its bumps in the road, but once the kinks are worked out, this is going to be a great place and we would not hesitate to return. The rooms are spacious and beautifully decorated. Sable, the restaurant in the hotel, has delicious drinks and unique appetizers. Activities of every kind are within walking distance. We can't wait to go back. The only negatives we experienced were that our room was not ready at check-in time, but the brew pub across the street was a great place to wait and our luggage was checked, and the key did not work to our mini-bar--something must have been wrong with the lock. Other than that, it was flawless. Parking is definitely on the expensive side at $46 per night.

Reviews.Title: “My wife and I are staying here as we...”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTraveler2010
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are staying here as we speak (Fri and Sat night). We live in the suburbs but came to stay close to Michigan Ave to enjoy the restaurants and shops. I knew it was risky saying here the first week this hotel opened but I could not pass up the price so I guess you get what you paid for. As soon as I reserved 2 nights online and mentioned my wife's birthday, the hotel manager upgraded our room at no charge. Now I was really looking forward to it. My package included 2 glasses of alcohol but since we don't drink the manager assured me we would get 2 diet cokes. Now here is where things turned unpleasant: 1. We turned on the brand new flat screen TV and no channels worked (no signal). We called downstairs and they said it's a hotel-wide issue. After a while a few channels started working and eventually all. 2. We were on the 16th floor of a 17-floor hotel. We decided to go downstairs and walk to Michigan ave.. We pushed the evelator button and waited, and waited. After close to 10 minutes I called downstairs and they told me both elevators were not functioning so we were asked to take stairs from 16th floor to 6th floor and then take elevator to first floor, which we did. I was happy we were not downstairs with our luggage trying to come up to 16th floor via the stairs. 3. Late into the night (close to midnight) the room felt cold it was set at 68 degrees. I change the tempurate up to 75 and the heating unit started to make a very (very) loud noise. I turned the heater off and the noise stopped. I tried again around 2am and then 6am but got same results. We didn't want anyone to come to out room in the middle of the night. 3. In the morning we called downstairs and they sent a very well-manned and friendly engineer to our room. He couldn't tell why the issue was happening and couldn't replicate it. But he told us if they can't fix it they will move us to a different room. We told him we will be going out (11am) and will return after 5 hours so hopefully by then they can fix issue or move us to another room. Needless to say 5 1/2 hours later we returned and waited 40 minutes for another room (20 in lobby and 20 in old room). I am now in a new room which seems fine so far. I hope my last night here is pleasant. If I did not have the 3 issues below the hotel would be receiving 4 and 5 points on everything, but that is not the case.

HotelInfo.Name: Palomar Chicago, a Kimpton Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 505 North State Street, Chicago, IL 60654
